column48:
PES University (1st and 2nd year):
•Professor CNR Rao Merit Scholarship in 3rd semester and 4th semester.
•Core member of TAS (The Amateur Scientist) - the biggest inter-school fest across India.
•Debating Achievements: Winner at Phase Shift 2016 Technical Debate, Novice Finalist at Soundarya Debate India Open, Semi-finals Panelist at BITS Pilani, Goa Debate, Third Best Adjudicator at PES Debate, and Octo-finalist at Christ University Parliamentary Debate.
column49:
PES University (3rd year):
•Founder, TechShift PES University – Tech for Good. This is the first Indian TechShift organization, and will serve as a platform for students to do projects for the greater good, and tie up with charitable organizations who could use technical solutions.
•Overall winner and Audience Choice Award winner – NTT Data All-India Hackathon(Code for Good).
•Teaching a course on Algorithms to a class of 40 students on the edX PESx platform.
•Selected as a recipient of a merit scholarship, courtesy of Scholarship America.
•Participated in MoveHack – Just Solve it. (A global mobility hackathon organized by Niti Aayog – a government think tank). Performed analytics on Pune’s traffic and mobility crisis as a part of the team.
•President ofThe PES Debating Society.
•Debating Achievements: Finalist & 3rd Best Speaker at Ramaiah Inter-Varsity Debate, 2019,Quarter-finalist at Christ University Parliamentary Debate, 2019, Semi-finalist at MS Ramaiah Memorial Parliamentary Debate, 2018.
•Professor CNR Rao Merit Scholarship in 5thand 6thsemester. The Frank Anthony Public School (Academic Year 2015-16: Class 12):
•House Captain – Rodrigues House(2015 – 2016).
•Best Student in Computer Science for the year 2015-2016. 
•Represented The Frank Anthony Public School at HP Code Wars 2015.
•Major Sandeep Unnikrishnan Memorial Leadership Award - In recognition of outstanding all-round performance, in sports and academics, and demonstrating exemplary leadership initiative and abilities. 
•Vivian Gas Memorial Rolling Trophy - Best Student in English Class 12.
•Tehmi Nowroji Creative Excellence Award.
•English Editor - Editing Committee – Courage 2015-2016.

The Frank Anthony Public School  (Academic Year 2014-15: Class 11):
•The Adrian Galaway Memorial Rolling Trophy – Best Student In English Class 11.
•English Olympiad – State Rank #1.
•Vice President of The Interact Club, The Frank Anthony Public School.
•Represented The Frank Anthony Public School at HP Code Wars 2014.

column37:
{Project_1:[Project_1_Domain@@Project_1_Student Developer, Crio Summer Of Doing:
- Built a backend system for the mock application QEats: A Food Ordering Application
- Implemented API’s to query for cuisines, food items and restaurants, to fetch menu’s of the restaurants, to add/remove items from the cart of a given user, to place the order and deployed the backend on AWS.
- Implemented a simple food recommendation system as part of the capstone project
- Was selected among the top 10 teams in the capstone challenge
- Link : https://criodo.github.io/csod-2019-AbhinavHegde97/
]##Project_2:[Project_2_Domain@@Project_2_ Selfieless Acts:
- an Online photo sharing app, that is containerized and orchestrated automatically. There are two instances of AWS hosting two different parts of the app, users and acts.
- An orchestrator running in acts instance automatically does load balancing, fault tolerance,auto-scaling of the containers running in the same instance. The backend of the application is built using Flask
- Added API’s to add/remove user’s and acts
- Link: https://github.com/AbhinavHegde97/CloudComputingFinal
]##Project_3:[Project_3_Domain@@Project_3_ IPL Match Prediction:
- Simulating the match, given 2 teams, batting order , bowling order and team that bats first.
- Using Probability:
- K-Means clustering is applied to batsmen statistics . 10 Clusters for batsmen were created to resemble 10
batting positions . 5 Clusters for bowlers were created
- For each delivery , the batsman vs bowler statistics is retrieved and runs and wickets for that delivery are calculated based on probability statistics and confidence score
- Using Decision Tree
- Simulating a match over by over with the help of Decision Tree
- Used the 10 parameters to predict the outcome of runs
and wickets:
- Link: https://github.com/AbhinavHegde97/IPL-Match-Prediction
]##Project_4:[Project_4_Domain@@Project_4_ Long Term Fundamental Analysis of Stocks:
- construct 36 fundamental features to characterize each stock, and label stocks according to their ranking with respect to the return-to-volatility ratio.
- Algorithms used to solve the classification task Logistic Regression, Random Forest , Deep Neural Network.
]##Project_5:[Project_5_Domain@@Project_5_ Internal Semester Assesment Test:
- Created an application that mocks the Computer Based tests conducted at PES University
- Functionalities implemented for the question setter to add questions, add the choices and mark the correct answer
(Multiple Choice Questions and True/False)
- Used MySQL for DataBase, PHP and JavaScript for Backend functionalities
- Link: https://github.com/AbhinavHegde97/InternalEvaluation-ComputerBasedTest.]}

column37:
{Project_1:[Project_1_Domain@@Project_1_1. Research Papers
Document embedding generation for cyber-aggressive comment detection using a
supervised machine learning approach
Published in the proceedings of the 14th International Conference on Natural
Language Processing, to be indexed in ACL Anthology
Dec’17
]##Project_2:[Project_2_Domain@@Project_2_Recurrent neural network architectures with trained document embedding
for flagging cyber-aggressive comments on social media
Published in the proceedings of the 24th International Conference on Advanced
Computing and Communications
Aug’18
 ABHISHEK NARAYANAN
 Male, 20 years, Email: abhishek.1010n@gmail.com
PES University
100 ft Ring Road, Hosakerehalli, BSK III Stage, Bangalore: 560085
]##Project_3:[Project_3_Domain@@Project_3_IronSense : Towards the identification of fake user-profiles on twitter using machine
learning
Published in Proceedings of the 14th International Conference on Information Processing
Dec’18
Academic Projects
]##Project_4:[Project_4_Domain@@Project_4_SelfieLessActs : A cloud based scalable application
 Built a web application with features like uploading, deleting, upvoting images and
captions and deployed it on AWS cloud
 Implemented REST API’s for backend processing
 Developed a Fault Tolerant Container Orchestrator with a load balancer, an
autoscaling feature from scratch
Jan’19-May’19
]##Project_5:[Project_5_Domain@@Project_5_Front End of a Mini C Compiler
 Developed the Front End of a C like compiler supporting common language constructs
like if-else and for loop among other basic language constructs
 Implemented lexical analyser using Lex and syntax directed translations using Yacc for
syntax and semantic analysis followed by Intermediate Code Generation with minor
code optimisations facilitated
Jan’19-May’19
]##Project_6:[Project_6_Domain@@Project_6_Deraining videos for intelligent traffic systems
 Implemented algorithms to enhance traffic video feed for effective traffic video
analytics
Jul ’18-Jan’19
]##Project_7:[Project_7_Domain@@Project_7_Unix-Like File System in User Space
 Implemented a File System in User Space using FUSE with most of the necessary file
operations and system calls supported in the UNIX operating System
Aug’18–Dec’18
]##Project_8:[Project_8_Domain@@Project_8_Intelligent vision based vehicle parking system
 Built an IOT based parking lot using Arduino Uno with computer vision features to
 detect vehicles and display vacancy status, based on which entry is restricted
Jan’18-Apr’18
]##Project_9:[Project_9_Domain@@Project_9_Built a Text Editor from scratch
 Developed a user-friendly text editor in C language, operated via command prompt
 Incorporated various features such as insert or delete text, navigation at word level
and between lines as well as spell checking mechanism
Aug’17-Nov’17]}
column43:
{Internship_1:[Internship_1_Company@@Internship_1_1. Worked as a Freelancing Consultant in machine learning for Newgen Knowledgeworks, Chennai
 Provided consultancy to the firm to build a machine learning model to identify and separate various key fields
in bibliographies such as authors, date of publishing, publisher, etc. for the automation of indexing by
publishing authorities
 Delivered the end product performing the above mentioned task by implementing a named entity
recognition model to predict and segregate targeted fields using deep learning
 Jul ’18 – Aug ’18. ]##Internship_2:[Internship_2_Company@@Internship_2_Dataturks (Acquired by Walmart Labs) Data Science and Machine Learning intern June ’18 – Aug ’18
 Built various machine learning prediction models for a number of real world challenging projects such as Named Entity Recognition for
summarizing Resumes from indeed.com, sentiment analysis of e-commerce product reviews, etc., which have been made open source
for the community and published in online blogs
]##Internship_3:[Internship_3_Company@@Internship_3_Argbyte Technologies Cyber Security and Machine Learning intern Mar ’18 – May ’18
 Built a machine learning model for identification of fake user profiles or bots on Twitter and delivered the end product with the user
interface as a browser plugin to facilitate users to identify fraudulent accounts conveniently.
 Obtained an accuracy score of 94.15% and a precision of 95% on a baseline test dataset in classifying Twitter accounts as fake or
genuine, and the experimentation results have been compiled into a research paper submitted to ICIP Conference 2018
Center for Data Science and Applied
Machine Learning (CDSAML) Research intern in machine learning and data science June ’17 – August ’17
 Built machine learning models for natural language processing to detect cyber-aggressive comments on social media
 Obtained a maximum accuracy score of 93.84% and a precision of 94% on a baseline test dataset in classifying text comments as
cyber-aggressive or neutral, after comparison of various machine learning and deep learning approaches
 Published two research papers based on the conducted project, to be indexed in ACL and ACCS]}

column48:
Received the Prof MRD Merit Scholarship for being among top 5 students of the batch in all 6 semesters
2016-2018
 Awarded the Prof CNR Rao Merit Scholarship for being in the top 25% of the batch in all 6 semesters 2016-
2018
column49:
Felicitated with Distinction Award for academic excellence in all 6 semesters
 Published 2 research papers in the domain of machine learning and natural language processing for detecting
cyber-bullying by peers in social media
 Secured 3rd position in batch and acquired an international rank of 1358 in the International Olympiad of
Mathematics
 Judged as the 3rd best essay author in Kolkata in a city-wide anti-corruption essay competition hosted by the
Department of Income Tax, West Bengal and Sikkim for Vigilance Awareness Week
column51: Attended workshop on machine learning, image processing, GPUs and Deep Learning
column54:
Intra and Inter
Collegiate Events
 Participated in the #Code Hackathon hosted by the Microsoft Innovation Lab, PES University wherein a gesture
sign recognition module was developed to aid speech-impaired people and an accuracy score of 87% was
achieved on a test dataset in classifying gestures into their corresponding alphanumeric representation
 Chosen among the top 100 teams shortlisted for presentation at the National Level Techno Exhibition at Dr
Ambedkar Institute of Technology, 2017 for exhibiting a dual axis solar tracker model, for facilitating solar
panels to effectively harness solar power by changing orientation of panels with the sun’s movement.
 Volunteered in organizing events in the Lit and Quiz domain for Atmatrisha 2017, the cultural University Fest
 Presented a cyber-bullying detection system on behalf of Dept of CSE at Prakalpa 2018, the annual technical fest
of the University, implemented as a web app to scrape tweets of a logged in user and determine
whether he has been bullied online or not

column37:
{Project_1:[Project_1_Domain@@Project_1_1. Research Papers
Document embedding generation for cyber-aggressive comment detection using a
supervised machine learning approach
Published in the proceedings of the 14th International Conference on Natural
Language Processing, to be indexed in ACL Anthology
Dec’17
]##Project_2:[Project_2_Domain@@Project_2_Recurrent neural network architectures with trained document embedding
for flagging cyber-aggressive comments on social media
Published in the proceedings of the 24th International Conference on Advanced
Computing and Communications
Aug’18
 ABHISHEK NARAYANAN
 Male, 20 years, Email: abhishek.1010n@gmail.com
PES University
100 ft Ring Road, Hosakerehalli, BSK III Stage, Bangalore: 560085
]##Project_3:[Project_3_Domain@@Project_3_IronSense : Towards the identification of fake user-profiles on twitter using machine
learning
Published in Proceedings of the 14th International Conference on Information Processing
Dec’18
Academic Projects
]##Project_4:[Project_4_Domain@@Project_4_SelfieLessActs : A cloud based scalable application
 Built a web application with features like uploading, deleting, upvoting images and
captions and deployed it on AWS cloud
 Implemented REST API’s for backend processing
 Developed a Fault Tolerant Container Orchestrator with a load balancer, an
autoscaling feature from scratch
Jan’19-May’19
]##Project_5:[Project_5_Domain@@Project_5_Front End of a Mini C Compiler
 Developed the Front End of a C like compiler supporting common language constructs
like if-else and for loop among other basic language constructs
 Implemented lexical analyser using Lex and syntax directed translations using Yacc for
syntax and semantic analysis followed by Intermediate Code Generation with minor
code optimisations facilitated
Jan’19-May’19
]##Project_6:[Project_6_Domain@@Project_6_Deraining videos for intelligent traffic systems
 Implemented algorithms to enhance traffic video feed for effective traffic video
analytics
Jul ’18-Jan’19
]##Project_7:[Project_7_Domain@@Project_7_Unix-Like File System in User Space
 Implemented a File System in User Space using FUSE with most of the necessary file
operations and system calls supported in the UNIX operating System
Aug’18–Dec’18
]##Project_8:[Project_8_Domain@@Project_8_Intelligent vision based vehicle parking system
 Built an IOT based parking lot using Arduino Uno with computer vision features to
 detect vehicles and display vacancy status, based on which entry is restricted
Jan’18-Apr’18
]##Project_9:[Project_9_Domain@@Project_9_Built a Text Editor from scratch
 Developed a user-friendly text editor in C language, operated via command prompt
 Incorporated various features such as insert or delete text, navigation at word level
and between lines as well as spell checking mechanism
Aug’17-Nov’17]}
column43:
{Internship_1:[Internship_1_Company@@Internship_1_1. Worked as a Freelancing Consultant in machine learning for Newgen Knowledgeworks, Chennai
 Provided consultancy to the firm to build a machine learning model to identify and separate various key fields
in bibliographies such as authors, date of publishing, publisher, etc. for the automation of indexing by
publishing authorities
 Delivered the end product performing the above mentioned task by implementing a named entity
recognition model to predict and segregate targeted fields using deep learning
 Jul ’18 – Aug ’18. ]##Internship_2:[Internship_2_Company@@Internship_2_Dataturks (Acquired by Walmart Labs) Data Science and Machine Learning intern June ’18 – Aug ’18
 Built various machine learning prediction models for a number of real world challenging projects such as Named Entity Recognition for
summarizing Resumes from indeed.com, sentiment analysis of e-commerce product reviews, etc., which have been made open source
for the community and published in online blogs
]##Internship_3:[Internship_3_Company@@Internship_3_Argbyte Technologies Cyber Security and Machine Learning intern Mar ’18 – May ’18
 Built a machine learning model for identification of fake user profiles or bots on Twitter and delivered the end product with the user
interface as a browser plugin to facilitate users to identify fraudulent accounts conveniently.
 Obtained an accuracy score of 94.15% and a precision of 95% on a baseline test dataset in classifying Twitter accounts as fake or
genuine, and the experimentation results have been compiled into a research paper submitted to ICIP Conference 2018
Center for Data Science and Applied
Machine Learning (CDSAML) Research intern in machine learning and data science June ’17 – August ’17
 Built machine learning models for natural language processing to detect cyber-aggressive comments on social media
 Obtained a maximum accuracy score of 93.84% and a precision of 94% on a baseline test dataset in classifying text comments as
cyber-aggressive or neutral, after comparison of various machine learning and deep learning approaches
 Published two research papers based on the conducted project, to be indexed in ACL and ACCS]}

column48:
Received the Prof MRD Merit Scholarship for being among top 5 students of the batch in all 6 semesters
2016-2018
 Awarded the Prof CNR Rao Merit Scholarship for being in the top 25% of the batch in all 6 semesters 2016-
2018
column49:
Felicitated with Distinction Award for academic excellence in all 6 semesters
 Published 2 research papers in the domain of machine learning and natural language processing for detecting
cyber-bullying by peers in social media
 Secured 3rd position in batch and acquired an international rank of 1358 in the International Olympiad of
Mathematics
 Judged as the 3rd best essay author in Kolkata in a city-wide anti-corruption essay competition hosted by the
Department of Income Tax, West Bengal and Sikkim for Vigilance Awareness Week
column51: Attended workshop on machine learning, image processing, GPUs and Deep Learning
column54:
Intra and Inter
Collegiate Events
 Participated in the #Code Hackathon hosted by the Microsoft Innovation Lab, PES University wherein a gesture
sign recognition module was developed to aid speech-impaired people and an accuracy score of 87% was
achieved on a test dataset in classifying gestures into their corresponding alphanumeric representation
 Chosen among the top 100 teams shortlisted for presentation at the National Level Techno Exhibition at Dr
Ambedkar Institute of Technology, 2017 for exhibiting a dual axis solar tracker model, for facilitating solar
panels to effectively harness solar power by changing orientation of panels with the sun’s movement.
 Volunteered in organizing events in the Lit and Quiz domain for Atmatrisha 2017, the cultural University Fest
 Presented a cyber-bullying detection system on behalf of Dept of CSE at Prakalpa 2018, the annual technical fest
of the University, implemented as a web app to scrape tweets of a logged in user and determine
whether he has been bullied online or not

column11:
Intra and Inter
Collegiate Events
 Participated in the #Code Hackathon hosted by the Microsoft Innovation Lab, PES University wherein a gesture
sign recognition module was developed to aid speech-impaired people and an accuracy score of 87% was
achieved on a test dataset in classifying gestures into their corresponding alphanumeric representation
 Chosen among the top 100 teams shortlisted for presentation at the National Level Techno Exhibition at Dr
Ambedkar Institute of Technology, 2017 for exhibiting a dual axis solar tracker model, for facilitating solar
panels to effectively harness solar power by changing orientation of panels with the sun’s movement.
 Volunteered in organizing events in the Lit and Quiz domain for Atmatrisha 2017, the cultural University Fest
 Presented a cyber-bullying detection system on behalf of Dept of CSE at Prakalpa 2018, the annual technical fest
of the University, implemented as a web app to scrape tweets of a logged in user and determine
whether he has been bullied online or not

• Qualified Codechef Smackdown 2017 and 2019 Qualifier and Pre-Elimination round.
• Cleared Qualifier Round of Facebook Hacker Cup 2018 and 2019.
• Bagged 13th rank in “Hour Storm #1” organized by Hackerearth.
• Executive Member (Core Team contest organizer) in the college’s official coding club ‘ALCODING’.
• Bagged “Golden Jubilee Scholarship” from TATA MOTORS LIMITED for academic excellence.
column51:

outputs the corresponding intermediate code representation in three address code format.

column13: { e-yantra Robotics Competition 2017-18 : Implemented a PID (Proportional-Integral-Derivative) controller to fly an autonomous drone with the goal of chasing and capturing a ground bot (Spark V). WhyCon a vision based localisation system was used to track the coordinates of the drone and the Spark V. ROS (Robot Operating System) was used to issue motion commands to the drone, and receive sensor data from on-board sensors.}

column43:
{Internship_1:[Internship_1_Company@@Internship_1_GOLDMAN SACHS | Summer Intern June - Aug 2019
• Developed a cloud hosted subscription based notification generation
system for actionable alerts on anomalous trading activity
• Developed a chat-based interface to interact with the notification subscription service
]##Internship_2:[Internship_2_Company@@Internship_2_ MICROSOFT INNOVATION LABS - PES UNIVERSITY | Summer Intern June - Aug 2018
• Developed a Brain-Computer Interface to classify EEG signals during mental simulation of kinaesthetic movement based on the type of movement imagined (e.g. left or right hand motion)
• Trained an SVM to predict the class of movement using Common Spatial Patterns-based feature extraction
]##Internship_3:[Internship_3_Company@@Internship_3_ DETECTION OF DRIVER DROWSINESS | Research Credits Aug - Dec 2019
• Developed a vision based driver drowsiness detection system based on Facial Action Units
• Trained a two stage classifier - multi-label CNN to classify Action Units and
an XGBoost classifier to predict drowsiness based on the dense
representation of the image generated by the CNN]}

• CNR Rao Merit Scholarship PESU (Awarded to the top 20% of students in the Computer Science Department):

column49:
• Most Innovative Solution, Intel ADAS (Advanced Driver Awareness Systems) Challenge, PES University | Jan - May
2019 | for a vision based solution to Driver Drowsiness detection based on classifying facial action units with SVMs
and predicting drowsiness based on the probabilistic outputs of the SVMs (interpreted as action unit intensities)
column50:
Data Analytics Teaching Assistant | Aug-Dec 2019 - Served as a TA for Data Analytics under Dr. Gowri Srinivasa.
• Peer to Peer Teaching | Feb - Mar 2018 - Taught a hands-on course on Data Analytics with R as part of a peer to peer
teaching initiative at PES University.
• Participated in e-yantra Robotics Competition 2017-18 | Implemented a PID (Proportional-Integral-Derivative)
controller to fly an autonomous drone with the goal of chasing and capturing a ground bot (Spark V). WhyCon a vision
based localisation system was used to track the coordinates of the drone and the Spark V. ROS (Robot Operating
System) was used to issue motion commands to the drone, and receive sensor data from on-board sensors.
• Online Courses | Neural Networks and Deep Learning (by deeplearning.ai)

column49:
• Most Innovative Solution, Intel ADAS (Advanced Driver Awareness Systems) Challenge, PES University | Jan - May
2019 | for a vision based solution to Driver Drowsiness detection based on classifying facial action units with SVMs
and predicting drowsiness based on the probabilistic outputs of the SVMs (interpreted as action unit intensities)
column50:
Data Analytics Teaching Assistant | Aug-Dec 2019 - Served as a TA for Data Analytics under Dr. Gowri Srinivasa.
• Peer to Peer Teaching | Feb - Mar 2018 - Taught a hands-on course on Data Analytics with R as part of a peer to peer
teaching initiative at PES University.
• Participated in e-yantra Robotics Competition 2017-18 | Implemented a PID (Proportional-Integral-Derivative)
controller to fly an autonomous drone with the goal of chasing and capturing a ground bot (Spark V). WhyCon a vision
based localisation system was used to track the coordinates of the drone and the Spark V. ROS (Robot Operating
System) was used to issue motion commands to the drone, and receive sensor data from on-board sensors.
• Online Courses | Neural Networks and Deep Learning (by deeplearning.ai)

column37:
1. 2019 Transferred Fusion Learning using skipped networks .
Combining two pre-trained models to create a hybrid model. The idea here is that when
we connect two models using skipped connections between layers of different models, each
model can learn from the data as well as from each other.The project is currently under
progress and almost done.
####2019 Simple Social Media (as a cloud service) .
The project was to create a simple social media service with image support. We used flask
to handle back-end and REST API for the communication between client and server. The
server was hosted on AWS(Amazon Web Service) and had a load-balancer to control the
traffic.
####2019 Stock marked analysis using Machine Learning .
Stock market data data is actually time series. We used this data and extracted features
(closing values of the stock). Different methods were used such as Linear Regression,
Auto-Arima, Prophet and LSTM to predict the stock value. LSTM was the best among
them with accurate prediction.
####2019 Next word sequence prediction and Spell correction (NLP).
This project would basically make the computer text like humans with proper word choice
and semantically correct sentences.A language model was built using LSTM to predict next
sequence of words. Spell correction was done using Minimum edit distance algorithm.####2018 Smart Home (voice control) .
This project consists of Raspberry pi, framework to define own commands, Google assistant
and some Electronic devices. The output of Google assistant goes into the framework
(IFTTT) which is connected to the Raspberry Pi. The R-pi keeps listening to the it and
receives appropriate signals. Based on the signal corresponding devices are controlled.

column37:
{Project_1:[Project_1_Domain@@Project_1_Cloud Computing: SelfieLessActs- A cloud based scalable application:                                                                                 Built a web application with features like uploading, deleting ,upvoting
images and captions and deployed it on AWS cloud
▪ Implemented REST API’s for backend processing
▪ Developed a Fault Tolerant Container Orchestrator with a load balancer, an autoscaling feature from scratch ]##Project_2:[Project_2_Domain@@Project_2_ Compiler Design: Front end of a Mini C compiler:                          Developed the Front End of a C like compiler supporting common language constructs
▪ Implemented lexical analyser using lex and syntax directed  translations using Yacc for syntax and semantic analysis followed by Intermediate Code
Generation with minor code optimisations facilitated ]##Project_3:[Project_3_Domain@@Project_3_ Big Data: IPL Analysis                                                                                  ▪ From statistics, calculate probability of batsman being out, runs that he might score ,number of wickets Bowlers can take.
▪ With respect to previous matches data probabilities are calculated using the method clustering and tools like HDFS, Zookeeper
▪ Entire Match’s score of both innings is predicted. ]##Project_4:[Project_4_Domain@@Project_4_Artificial Intelligence: Maze generator using Backtraking: Using the method of Backtracing, a Maze Generater is created which is scalable on requirement. ]##Project_5:[Project_5_Domain@@Project_5_ Operating System: Unix-Like File System in User Space
▪ Implemented a File System in User Space using FUSE with most of the necessary file operations and system calls supported in the UNIX operating System. ]##Project_6:[Project_6_Domain@@Project_6_                                                                                              Built a Text Editor from scratch
▪ Developed a user-friendly text editor in C language, operated via command prompt
▪ Incorporated various features such as insert or delete text, navigation at word level and between lines as well as spell checking mechanism. ]##Project_7:[Project_7_Domain@@Project_7_ Computer vision based fruit plucking robot
▪ Built a robot using Arduino Uno to detect ripe fruits using computer vision and automatically approach the target and pluck it from the tree
▪ Tested successfully in a mock task environment created for evaluation.]}
column41: {"Offline Handwritten Telugu Character Dataset and Recognition":"INDICON 2019, IEEE"}
column43:
{Internship_1:[Internship_1_Company@@Internship_1_{Summer Research Fellowship Programme (SRFP):[Research Fellow@@ SRFP is a national-level fellowship offered by the Indian Academy of Sciences (IAS) to select students (362 engineering students this year) interested in research in STEM fields. Worked under Dr. Atul Negi, Professor at the University of Hyderabad, on Handwritten Character Recognition (HCR) in Telugu.Experimented with Visual Attention Networks to produce compelling results on real-world data from scanned documents. The dataset as well as recognition approach were later published.]##JNResearch:[Research Intern@@Worked on developing a cutting-edge Invoice Analysis pipeline under Mr. Anantharaman P.N, ex-Adobe Director- Engineering Manager. I was the only second-year student selected and was involved in all design and implementation aspects of the pipeline from data generation to model architectures. I have hence developed a thorough understanding of some types of Deep Learning Networks. Worked mainly with Region Proposal Networks - a component of Region-Convolutional Neural Networks - and Recurrent Neural Networks.]}
]}

column37:
{Project_1:[Project_1_Domain@@Project_1_Title: Library Management Utility
Duration: Aug 2017 - Apr 2018
Description: A tool for online library management was made. The front end was designed as a website and the back end
had SQL databases for storing and Data structures for operations. The project had concepts of Data Structures, PHP, JS,
HTML and MYSQ. ]##Project_2:[Project_2_Domain@@Project_2_  Title: Temperature Sensing D.C Fan
Duration: Jan 2018 - Apr 2018
Description: A temperature sensing D.C Fan was made which could sense the surrounding temperature and change the
fan speed accordingly. This was implemented using thermal sensors, LCD display, D.C motor and an Arduino., ]##Project_3:[Project_3_Domain@@Project_3_ Title: File System using FUSE
Duration: Sep 2018 - Nov 2018
Description: A simple file system was developed which used concepts of disk storage and file/Inode structure. FUSE
(Filesystem in Userspace) was used for integrating the designed files system with built in system calls. All major file and
directory operations were implemented and a large file was used as a virtual memory, ]##Project_4:[Project_4_Domain@@Project_4_ Title: Maze Solver using A* Search
Duration: Sep 2016 - Nov 2016
Description: An autonomous A.I agent was designed which solved randomized mazes using A* search algorithm to find
the optimal path between a user marked “start” and “goal” points. Concepts of Game search algorithms and Problem
solving using searches were used., ]##Project_5:[Project_5_Domain@@Project_5_ Title: Microservices backend on AWS Cloud:
Duration: Jan 2019 - Apr 2019
Description: A set of microservices were made to implement the backend of a cloud based app. This Cloud computing
project was done using Amazon AWS service. Concepts of containers, Docker, images, load balancer and microservices
were used to implement the backend.,]}
column43:
{Internship_1:[Internship_1_Company@@Internship_1_Topic: Cloud Computing And Big Data Centre: Centre for Cloud Computing and Big Data (CCBD) (Bangalore) Duration: Jun 2018 - Aug 2018 Description: Learnt the basics of Cloud Computing and usage of Open stack Swift. Focus was given to going through the source code of Swift, to understand how object storage happens., ]##Internship_2:[Internship_2_Company@@Internship_2_ Topic: Machine Learning and Natural Language Processing
Centre: CDSAML-Centre for Data Science and Applied Machine Learning At PESU College
(Bangalore)
Duration: Jun 2017 - Jul 2017
Description: Attended a workshop on Machine Learning and Natural Language Processing. Did
research on applying machine learning concepts and concepts of deep learning on detection of
cyber aggressive comments. Papers were written at the end of the internship.]}

sharing pictures of selfless
acts. Deployment of website
and back-end including a rest
API and auto scaling load
balancer on Amazon AWS cloud. ]##Project_2:[Project_2_Domain@@Project_2_
KMSDrive: Simple cloud storage POC to
showcase key management and
encryption in the cloud. ]##Project_3:[Project_3_Domain@@Project_3_
Stock projection
using deep learning:
Trying to find cyclic trends in
stocks related to the oil sector
based on stock prices and price
gradients. ]##Project_4:[Project_4_Domain@@Project_4_
Research - ongoing:
Byzantine fault
tracing using
system traces:
Implementing a multi - node
load balanced system which
can trace byzantine faults, ie
compromised nodes and take
measures to correct.
Implemented using reference
system traces during execution
of code to detect anomalous
behaviour . Securing such
system against read faults and
handling deployment changes.]}

column37:
{Project_1:[Project_1_Domain@@Project_1_• Anomaly detection in unstructured logs (Cisco)
Developed a log parser that converts unstructured logs to structured logs and extracts
necessary information from log files. Devised a Machine Learning approach to classify logs
as working and non-working logs using word embeddings created by Word2Vec Model and
various Machine Learning algorithms like Decision Tree and ANN and achieved an accuracy
of 99.97%.
]##Project_2:[Project_2_Domain@@Project_2_Visual Question Answering as a Factoid Question Answering Problem
The proposed approach employs region level scene descriptions as facts rather than a
single generic caption in which existing models have not been able to capture region level
details in a single caption. An End-to-End memory network (MemN2N) is then trained to
perform a factoid question answering task to reason out the answer to the input question.
]##Project_3:[Project_3_Domain@@Project_3_Development and Optimizations of Operations in Spatial Hadoop
SpatialHadoop is a MapReduce extension to Apache Hadoop designed specially to analyse
huge spatial datasets on a cluster of machines. Developed optimized code using Plane
Sweep Algorithm to perform difference operation on geo-spatial data in SpatialHadoop.
]##Project_4:[Project_4_Domain@@Project_4_ Container Orchestration in EC2 instance
Implemented a custom container orchestrator engine for docker containers in EC2 instance that
facilitates Load Balancing, Fault tolerance and Autoscaling features and built a cloud-based web
application with backend processing using REST API on the AWS instance.
]##Project_5:[Project_5_Domain@@Project_5_File System implementation with FUSE
Implemented our own fully functional file system including the internal data structures and
system calls similar to a Simple File System in UNIX Operating Systems using FUSE (File
System in User Space)
Page 2
]##Project_6:[Project_6_Domain@@Project_6_ Video Portal (Amazon)
Developed a video viewing portal with extensive frontend and backend using Node.js,
HTML, XML, JavaScript, Ajax, MySQL, CSS. having various features like ability to upload,
view and delete video, support for subtitles, language localization, country specific video
viewing rules and efficient search using trie data structure.]}

multiplication, division, exponentiation can be done very efficiently up to 10000 digits
Project Name: Holiday Destination website
]##Project_2:[Project_2_Domain@@Project_2_Created holiday destination website by using HTML, CSS, JavaScript for the front end.
• Implanted an SVG of the Indian map
•]##Project_3:[Project_3_Domain@@Project_3_Developed a search engine feature using Python
• The backend was coded by PHP
Project Name: Hex Game
• Conceptualized and developed a Hex game (Human vs Machine)
• Coded on C++ implementing Artificial Intelligence features
• Incorporated to Monte Carlo Algorithm
Machine Learning Project
•]##Project_4:[Project_4_Domain@@Project_4_Received a dataset of employees with a set of 14 attributes and used the dataset to classify whether an
employee earned more than INR 50,000
• Cleaned the dataset to remove the bad data and then pre-processed and normalized the data so that the
classifier can get the input in the standard format
]##Project_5:[Project_5_Domain@@Project_5_Divided the data into training and test data set and achieved an accuracy up to 82%
SelfieLess Acts
]##Project_6:[Project_6_Domain@@Project_6_ Built a photo sharing application on AWS using Microservices that enabled the users to upload pictures
of real-life heroes doing something good for the society. Real life heroes can be anybody - someone
from helping a blind man cross the road to helping a homeless puppy find a shelter.
]##Project_7:[Project_7_Domain@@Project_7_Used Amazon EC2 and load balancer services to build the application
The project was divided into 2 microservices ‘users’ and ‘acts’. The users microservice took care of registration
and logging into the site whereas the acts microservice took care of uploading/deleting an act, commenting,
likes and dislikes.
Search Engine
Developed the search engine using the Suffix Tree Data Structure by implementing the Ukkonen’s Algorithm]}

{Internship_1:[Internship_1_Company@@Internship_1_Distributed Machine Learning (ongoing research) Present

efficiently in order to reduce waiting time, thus reducing the average job completion time.
A machine learning model(collaborative filtering) would predict the resources required by the
Incoming job and this knowledge would be leveraged by our framework in allocating resources Android in M/s RockYou India Pvt Ltd. Jun 2017 to Jul 2017

]##Internship_3:[Internship_3_Company@@Internship_3_The front end was made using AngularJS and backend using PHP.
Ernst and Young LLP Jun 2019 to Aug 2019

JavaScript, Python and Microsoft Server SQL 2014

column37:
{Project_1:[Project_1_Domain@@Project_1_Railway Reservation System
2017 - Second Year
A robust, online ticket reservation system for Railways, with a user-friendly interface and attractive frontend. Powered by HTML, CSS and Java Script. Designed with a persistent back end using MySQL. Provided with a large database and real-time booking made possible. Features such as meals, cancellation and transactional
facilities included in the website. ]##Project_2:[Project_2_Domain@@Project_2_ Maximizing Yield of Rice Cultivation 2017 - Second Year
A project aimed at maximizing yield of rice cultivation in a particular region by analyzing the produce of seventeen years. A rigorous analysis of various other parameters such as rainfall, weather and soil fertility made to ensure an increase in produce. It also involves a comparative study of the surrounding region through regression analysis highlighting the influence of various parameters on the yield.
]##Project_3:[Project_3_Domain@@Project_3_ Predicting the outcome of a Cricket Match 2018 - Third Year
The project involves analyzing large sets of data (Pertaining to all previously played IPL Cricket Matches) to
extract the information regarding the performance of various players and analyzing them on various
parameters. Data stored in HDFS and worked upon using utilities such as Scala and Pyspark. Concepts such
as clustering and prediction put to good use to predict the outcome of a Cricket Match only based on the
available data.]}

column37:
{Project_1:[Project_1_Domain@@Project_1_A-ReLU as an Activation Function (Ongoing) Python, Tensorflow
Guide: Dr. Snehanshu Saha
· Undergraduate thesis: Conducted a mathematical analysis of the shape parameters and functional properties of a novel
activation function, A-ReLU, which is a variation of the ReLU activation function
· Derived optimal values for hyperparameters to train effectively; Outperformed ReLU during tests on the MNIST dataset
& PHL-EC exoplanet dataset based on metrics such as accuracy, f-score & iterations to convergence
]##Project_2:[Project_2_Domain@@Project_2_ Identification of At-Risk Students (Ongoing) Python, Scikit-learn, Seaborn
· Attempt to identify weak and ’at-risk’ students using data collected for Datathon ’19 based on attributes such as students’
self-reported pre-test confidence, post-test confidence and GPA to aid professors in identifying such students
· Used other telemetry (such as no. of compiles, score efficiency, time taken) to predict students’ final confidence as well as
reported question-wise difficulty
]##Project_3:[Project_3_Domain@@Project_3_ Genre Based Lyrics Generation (2019) Python, Tensorflow, Keras
· Created an application to generate song lyrics based on the genre requested by the user; Used different types of Recurrent
Neural Network (RNN) models trained on a dataset consisting of the lyrics of 10000+ songs
· Compared the results of bi-directional RNNs with conventional RNNs (using LSTM cells) in terms of sentence understandability, loss metrics, and computational power used (CPU & memory utilization, time taken)
]##Project_4:[Project_4_Domain@@Project_4_ Predicting Customer Churn (2019) Python, Scikit-learn, Keras
· Compared the performance of multiple machine learning classification algorithms to predict customer churn based on
customer-related attributes; Used the Telco Customer Churn dataset (from IBM Sample Datasets)
· Conducted extensive exploratory data analyses (EDA) to identify attributes indicative of users who have a higher
probability of churning and incorporated them in the classification step to create a highly robust model
]##Project_5:[Project_5_Domain@@Project_5_ Photo Sharing App (2018-19) Node.js, REST, AWS
· Developed the backend consisting of multiple REST APIs (made using Node.js) for an online photo-sharing app; hosted
the backend on AWS EC2 instances and included a custom load balancer to handle a large number of requests
· Containerized the service, making dynamic scaling of resources and replacement of unhealthy containers easy; Created a
container orchestration layer to ensure high availability, consistency and smooth experience for the end-user
]##Project_6:[Project_6_Domain@@Project_6_ Network Intrusion Detection System (2018) R, Python, Scikit-learn, Keras
· Created an ML-based network Intrusion Detection System based on the KDD’99 Cup dataset; Used a novel approach
implementing anomaly detection and misuse detection in a sequential manner
· Used a neural network and a random forest classifier to detect anomalies; Passed these anomalies to a clustering-based
algorithm to classify them into various known intrusion types or as a new unknown intrusion
· The draft paper can be found at https://arxiv.org/abs/1910.12074
]##Project_7:[Project_7_Domain@@Project_7_ FIFA World Cup & IPL Match Predictor (2018) R, Python, Hadoop, Apache Spark
· Created a predictive model (random forest) for the 2018 FIFA World Cup to predict the results of individual matches
using team and player attributes; Trained the model on the results of qualification matches as well as previous world cup
fixtures since 1998; Successfully predicted the result of 54 out of 64 matches at the World Cup
· Followed a slightly different approach and used batsmen-bowler interaction & individual player performances in the Indian
Premier League (IPL) cricket tournament to generate ball-by-ball predictions; Successfully predicted 16/20 matches
· Compared the results of decision tree and clustering approaches with Spark MLLib running on multiple Hadoop clusters.]}
column43:
{Internship_1:[Internship_1_Company@@Internship_1_Big Data - PES University August 2019 - November 2019 Python, Apache Spark, Hadoop
Teaching Assistant  
· Designed assignments for students based on course material which involved students scraping data from the web, loading it into HDFS and running MapReduce Jobs
· Conducted multiple hands-on sessions to familiarize students in these technologies - Hadoop, MapReduce & Spark
· Co-authored a short paper, Big Data Assignments; Accepted for presentation at the EduHiPC-2019 (mid-December 2019)
]##Internship_2:[Internship_2_Company@@Internship_2_ Walmart Labs May 2019 - July 2019
Software Development Intern Dialogflow, Node.js
· Part of the International Customer Technology team for Sam’s Club, Mexico (a Walmart subsidiary)
· Created the foundation for the customer-facing chatbot using Dialogflow and integrated internal APIs using webhooks
deployed on Heroku and integrated the service with Google Assistant & WhatsApp (using Smooch API); Built wrapper
classes around secured APIs for access by 3rd party services
]##Internship_3:[Internship_3_Company@@Internship_3_ PESU I/O October 2018 - December 2018
Subject Matter Expert R, MS Excel
· Mentored students as a Subject Matter Expert in the field of Data Analytics in PESU I/O, a peer-to-peer teaching initiative at PES University
· Developed and taught a course titled Data Analytics using MS Excel and introduced 20+ freshman year students to basic statistical concepts such as linear and logistic regression, hypothesis testing, and what-if analyses
]##Internship_4:[Internship_4_Company@@Internship_4_ PricewaterhouseCoopers (PwC) June 2018 - August 2018
Technology Consulting Intern Python, R, MS Excel
· Part of the Data and Analytics Department in the Advisory Line-of-Service
· Worked on multiple analytics related projects at the firm; Created a travel budget optimizer using a Decision Tree regressor in R and integrated it with an interactive PowerBI dashboard
]##Internship_5:[Internship_5_Company@@Internship_5_ Centre for Data Science and Machine Learning May 2017 - July 2017
Research Intern Python, Scikit-learn
· Worked on a project titled Disease Surveillance Using Twitter Data at the Centre for Data Science and Machine Learning (CDSAML) Labs at PES University
· Co-developed an ML and NLP based mechanism to identify locations vulnerable to the outbreak of dengue by analyzing Twitter data; Compared the performance of multiple classifiers to classify tweets as dengue-related/not related and used these to find places with high frequency of such tweets]}

column37:
{Project_1:[Project_1_Domain@@Project_1_Holiday Destination website
■ Used HTML, CSS, JavaScript for the front end and an SVG of the Indian map so that clicking any portion of the map
will open the webpage for that state
■ Implemented a search engine feature using Python. The backend was implemented using PHP.
]##Project_2:[Project_2_Domain@@Project_2_ SelfieLessActs
The project was divided into 2 modules ‘users’ and ‘acts’. The users module took care of registration and logging into the
site whereas the acts module took care of uploading/deleting an act, commenting, likes and dislikes.
■ Built a photo sharing application on AWS using Micro services that enabled the users to upload pictures of real life
heroes doing something good for the society, for example helping an old person cross the road, community services like
cleaning, and so on
■ Used Amazon EC2 and load balancer services to build the application.
]##Project_3:[Project_3_Domain@@Project_3_ BigINT Calculator in C
■ Developed the calculator where arithmetic operations like increment, decrement, addition, subtraction, multiplication,
division, exponentiation can be done very efficiently up to 10000 digits.
]##Project_4:[Project_4_Domain@@Project_4_ Hex Game (Human vs. Machine)
■ Used C++ which has Artificial Intelligence incorporated in it and the Monte Carlo Algorithm to incorporate the AI
While / If-else C Compiler
■ Used Lex and Yacc
■ Involved Lexical analysis, symbol table creation, syntax analysis, Building of an abstract syntax tree, Intermediate code
generation and code optimization.
]##Project_5:[Project_5_Domain@@Project_5_ Search Engine
■ Developed the search engine using the Suffix Tree Data Structure by implementing the Ukkonen’s Algorithm.
]##Project_6:[Project_6_Domain@@Project_6_ Sentiment Analysis
The project involved cleaning the dataset, removing stop words, stemming using NLTK libraries with the help of Python 3,
and cleaning the dataset after dividing it into training set and testing set.
■ Performed Sentiment Analysis on a dataset of 50000 IMDB. ]##Project_7:[Project_7_Domain@@Project_7_ Movie Reviews.
■ Used different classifiers to classify the review as positive or negative
■ Used techniques, such as bagging and boosting to try and increase the accuracy of classification; achieved an accuracy
of up to 80%
]##Project_8:[Project_8_Domain@@Project_8_ Machine Learning Project
■ Received a dataset of employees with a set of 14 attributes and used the dataset to classify whether an employee earned
more than INR 50,000
■ Cleaned the dataset to remove the bad data and then pre-processed and normalized the data so that the classifier can get
the input in the standard format
■ Divided the data into training and test data set and achieved an accuracy up to 82%.]}

]##Internship_3:[Internship_3_Company@@Internship_3_ M/s RockYou India Pvt Ltd.; Jun 2017 to Jul 2017 Industrial Trainee

{Project_1:[Project_1_Domain@@Project_1_Cloud Computing: SelfieLessActs- A cloud based scalable application. ● Built a web application with features like uploading, deleting ,upvoting images and captions and deployed it on AWS cloud. ● Implemented REST API’s for backend processing. ● Developed a Fault Tolerant Container Orchestrator with a load balancer, an autoscaling feature from scratch. ● Language Used:- Python. ]##Project_2:[Project_2_Domain@@Project_2_ Web Browser : A Software application for accessing information Online
● Language Used:- Python.
● Details- A Web browser which allows you to surf online and It consists of login and sign up to the
browser .
● The web browser retrieves the necessary content from a web server then displays the resulting web
page on the user's device. ]##Project_3:[Project_3_Domain@@Project_3_Smart street light system:
● A street light that automatically switches on when the lights falls and turns off when the sun
rises.
● Street lighrs are made smart by Placing motion sensor on them which unables them to detect
movement. When a passer-by is detected by motion sensor the street lights will brighten so
that the people are always surrounded by light.
● Benefits are energy saving,reduction in maintanance cost, reduction of light pollution and
maintanance of safety. ]##Project_4:[Project_4_Domain@@Project_4_Employee database management system
● Language Used:- Sql
● The proposed project has been developed to overcome the problems faced in the practicing of
manual system.This web application is reduced as much as possible to avoid errors while entering
data
● This project is used to manage the data of the employees such as personal details etc, which is
handled by admin
● XAMPP software is used for backend database.]}

column37:
{Project_1:[Project_1_Domain@@Project_1_1. Link Prediction in Facebook Social Graph
Predicted what new connections will be made between people in a social graph
Used their shared interests and network embeddings as features
Experimented with different binary classifiers, achieved 80% accuracy using a neural model.
]##Project_2:[Project_2_Domain@@Project_2_Reinforcement Learning based Recommender
Built a Deep Q Learning model that recommends movies to users
Used past 4 movies of user as history stack to make recommendation.
Achieved 70% precision based on ratings.
]##Project_3:[Project_3_Domain@@Project_3_Container Orchestration
Created a web service called Selfieless Acts which allows users to post selfies with captions.
Two microservices running on two instances which communicate through REST API. Created an
orchestration service which auto scaled the number of containers in the instances, performed load
balancing and fault tolerance.
]##Project_4:[Project_4_Domain@@Project_4_Book Genre Classifier
Classifying books based on title and author word vector into one of 22 classes.
Used both sparse TF-IDF and dense SVD vectors to train based on model.
Classifiers used were Naive Bayes, SVM and ANN which gave accuracies of 55-60%.
]##Project_5:[Project_5_Domain@@Project_5_Data Structure Library for C
Built a library in C to implement lists, vectors, stacks, queues and trees.
]##Project_6:[Project_6_Domain@@Project_6_Atari Taxi Agent
Created an agent that plays Taxi v3, an Atari game using Reinforcement Learning.
Trained the agent using Q learning and Epsilon greedy strategy.
Achieved highest possible score each level.]}

column37:
{Project_1:[Project_1_Domain@@Project_1_Semantic Segmentation using Resnet101 and FCDenseNet56 RBEI, June 2019
Worked on a semantic segmentation module built using deep learning architectures such as FCdenseNet56 on top of ResNet101.
Generated training data, and used data generated by the model to retrain the model. A reinforcement based training, which showed great
results after a number of epochs. Tried to track back on what basis the network learns and improved the model to get acceptable accuracy.
]##Project_2:[Project_2_Domain@@Project_2_ Kaggle Chest X-ray classification
Jan 2019 – May 2019
Worked on the Kaggle dataset of chest xray which has about 10 labels for classification. Used several supervised and unsupervised
techniques to classify based on data and evaluated the confusion matrix and noted results. ]##Project_3:[Project_3_Domain@@Project_3_ Pyradiomics Feature Extracrion and Filter Generation
Philips HealthCare, Jun 2018 – Jul 2018
Given a jpg of a x-ray, converted it into a medical format such as nrrd,dicom. Upon conversion, transform image into a 3D image. Ran
various image processing filters, and generated radiomic features with processed images.
]##Project_4:[Project_4_Domain@@Project_4_ PROJECTS
IPL match prediction using Unsupervised Learning
Aug 2018 – Dec 2018
Predicted IPL 2018 match outcomes using clusters of players with the help of Spark and Hadoop. Used K-means clustering algorithm and
Spark decision trees to predict ball by ball data for each batsman v bowler pair. ]##Project_5:[Project_5_Domain@@Project_5_ IMDb Movie Dataset Analysis Aug 2018 – Dec 2018
Worked on IMDb's official dataset of all movies-genres,actors,ratings etc. Found trends, key attributes and outliers in the dataset. Found correlation between unique attributes and made few predictions using a regression based model using R.]}

Plansform

similar to numpy in scikit learn for implementation of regression and classification algorithms
on top of it.

]##Project_2:[Project_2_Domain@@Project_2_Bot Generating Obama Tweets

embeddings for achieving higher Accuracy.
]##Project_3:[Project_3_Domain@@Project_3_Scalable Web Application

Django framework.

designed API for Contacting the Backend using

and Deployed it.

using the provided Characteristics]}

column41:
 Multi Scale Template Matching to denoise Epigraphical EstampagesProvide a novel method to denoise historical documents effectively with minimal character loss. A
combination of Machine Learning and Computer Vision techniques were used in order to create the algorithm.
[Publication accepted at ICICC-DSU 2019, Springer Journal]
#### Denoising and Segmentation of Epigraphical Estampages by Multi Scale Template Matching
and Connected Component Analysis
An algorithm developed to find the average area of a character in images with text. A pipeline of connected
component analysis with thresholded component area to classify noise. [Publication accepted at CoCoNet
2019, Procedia Computer Science journal (Elsevier)]
#### Extending The Performance of Extractive Text Summarization By Ensemble Techniques
The algorithm proposed in this paper gives a way to combine the strengths of all the existing algorithms to
make text summarization more robust. A voting classifier is employed for the purpose.
[Publication accepted at ICoAC 2019, IEEE Xplore]
column43:
{Internship_1:[Internship_1_Company@@Internship_1_Microsoft Research, Bengaluru, India (January 2020)
 One of the 20 Research Interns selected across the entire country.
]##Internship_2:[Internship_2_Company@@Internship_2_ CubeBioai & PES Center for Pattern Recognition, Bengaluru, India (August 2019 – Present)
 Development of de-novo drug design techniques using deep reinforcement learning with a predictivegenerative model that predicts the efficacy based on inhibition coefficient (plc50)
 Extending the models to a larger project on predicting the activation site features and test on various perturbagens
Languages/Tools: Python, Keras, TensorFlow, Pytorch
]##Internship_3:[Internship_3_Company@@Internship_3_ Lam Research, Bengaluru, India (June 2019 – August 2019)
 Developed a Machine Learning model for estimation of sales order life cycle time.
 Created a model for the classification of parts into different hardware categories using NLP and Machine Learning algorithms.
 Designed and developed several dashboards using BI tool (Qlik Sense) and SAP HANA for visualization of Key Performance Indicators (KPIs).
 Created a NLP model to assess the risk/reward scores of supplier contracts based on business rules set by the user and extraction of contractual terms such as date, contract classification type, etc.
Languages/Tools: Spyder, Qlik sense, SSMS, SAP HANA, Python, SQL.
]##Internship_4:[Internship_4_Company@@Internship_4_ SecurelyShare, Bengaluru, India (June 2018 – August 2018)

 Developed and implemented a desktop application to capture, link, and authenticate data including eMail Id,
User Id, Social Id, Images, Device Id and Biometric Id from different sources
 Utilized Electron framework to facilitate cross-platform support and extensively used functionalities including
Web Push Notifications (FCM), API calls, display of real-time data, OTP generation and verification etc.
Languages/Tools: Electron, NodeJS, Javascript, HTML, CSS, Jquery, AngularJS
Pandera Solutions Private Limited, Bengaluru, India (June 2016 – July 2016)]}

SOCIETY MEMBERSHIPS
IEEE Student Member
Member Number: 96238500
column37:
{Project_1:[Project_1_Domain@@Project_1_Handwritten Word Extraction and Recognition from Form Data
ONGOING
This project takes a scanned document as input and recognizes just the English handwritten
words as output. Full pipeline from segmentation to recognition is implemented to help in
digitizing handwritten forms that may be (semi-) structured or unstructured. The project uses a
pixel-level classifier to separate the handwritten and printed parts of the page, followed by a
custom segmentation strategy and Handwritten Text Recognition.
]##Project_2:[Project_2_Domain@@Project_2_ Solving Math Word Problems AUGUST 2019 - NOVEMBER 2019
A Natural Language Processing project. Implemented a parser as well as Recurrent Neural Networks to solve math word problems. The two approaches were compared - a parsing
approach versus unidirectional and bidirectional RNNs with LSTM and GRU cells. In addition, a
hybrid approach that used hidden representations of the RNNs with an SVM was explored.
]##Project_3:[Project_3_Domain@@Project_3_ Handwritten Telugu Character Recognition
JUNE 2019 - AUGUST 2019
Explored handwritten character recognition in Telugu using Visual Attention Networks. Also
created the largest dataset for the problem from scanned documents through an image processing driven extraction approach. The intent was to create a benchmark dataset to
evaluate future solutions to the problem. The dataset creation and character recognition approach was accepted for publication in the IEEE conference, INDICON.
]##Project_4:[Project_4_Domain@@Project_4_ Cloud Computing - SelfielessActs
JANUARY 2019 - APRIL 2019
Built a scalable website - both front-end and back-end with AWS. Built with Node.js and Express with MongoDB. The functionality of the website - like posting pictures, signing up, etc
- were implemented as microservices in Docker containers. Also implemented a load balancer with a custom strategy to spawn or destroy more containers, as required.
]##Project_5:[Project_5_Domain@@Project_5_ Suffix Trees
OCTOBER 2018 - NOVEMBER 2018
Implemented suffix trees for a large text corpus using custom terminators for efficient construction and retrieval. The custom terminators allow multiple documents to be represented by a single suffix tree and hence aid in quick searching of hundreds of documents (O(n) for creation and searching).
]##Project_6:[Project_6_Domain@@Project_6_ Restaurant Recommendation System for Groups
OCTOBER 2018 - NOVEMBER 2018
Built a recommendation system for groups of users. Implemented a mechanism to estimate
present score from similar users who have visited the restaurant recently. This present score
concept was used in conjunction with user and item similarity, and other Data Science tools
and practices with Yelp open source data.
]##Project_7:[Project_7_Domain@@Project_7_ Invoice Analysis with Region Proposal Networks
JUNE 2018 - AUGUST 2018
This project was done as part of an internship at the startup JNResearch. Developed a Deep Learning solution for Invoice Analysis. Part of the project involves extracting relevant regions from the image of the invoice, achieved through Region Proposal Networks (RPN), part of larger frameworks like Faster-RCNN.]}
column43:
{Internship_1:[Internship_1_Company@@Internship_1_Summer Research Fellowship Programme (SRFP) - Research Fellow
MAY 2019 - JULY 2019
● SRFP is a national-level fellowship offered by the Indian Academy of Sciences
(IAS) to select students (362 engineering students this year) interested in
research in STEM fields.
● Worked under Dr. Atul Negi, Professor at the University of Hyderabad, on
Handwritten Character Recognition (HCR) in Telugu.
● Experimented with Visual Attention Networks to produce compelling results on
real-world data from scanned documents. The dataset as well as recognition
approach were later published.
]##Internship_2:[Internship_2_Company@@Internship_2_ JNResearch - Research Intern
JUNE 2018 - JULY 2018
● Worked on developing a cutting-edge Invoice Analysis pipeline under Mr. Anantharaman
P.N, ex-Adobe Director- Engineering Manager.
● I was the only second-year student selected and was involved in all design and
implementation aspects of the pipeline from data generation to model
architectures. I have hence developed a thorough understanding of some types
of Deep Learning Networks.
● Worked mainly with Region Proposal Networks - a component of
Region-Convolutional Neural Networks - and Recurrent Neural Networks.]}

Robotics - eYantra
DECEMBER 2017
Finalist in the national-level robotics competition eYantra, organised by IIT Mumbai. Involved
automating a drone to land on a moving ground-bot by tracking optical markers using an
overhead camera. Finished in the Top 10 teams in India.
The Amateur Scientist - Volunteer
AUGUST 2016
Helped organize and run a workshop on electronics that creates music, called Song of
Sensors. Taught high school students how to build a musical keyboard with basic electronic
components.

 ● View the dataset as it is on the terminal window

]##Project_2:[Project_2_Domain@@Project_2_  Database Management Systems: Food Blog – A project made intense use of MySQL
 ● The database satisfies ACID Property.
 ● Concurrency of the database, allows multiple users to add and remove their recipes to the blog.
 ]##Project_3:[Project_3_Domain@@Project_3_ Design and Analysis of Algorithms: Developed a C library for integer of arbitrary length (intal)
 ● Efficient use of pointers, dynamic memory for integers of invariable length
 ● Implemented the library with the help of void pointers.
 ● Created functions to perform basic arithmetic operations on integers of size fits into a memory register
]##Project_4:[Project_4_Domain@@Project_4_ Big Data: IPL Data Analysis using Hadoop – Map Reduce
 ● Analyzed last 10 years IPL data to find the best batsman and bowler in the IPL career
 ● Predicted the winner based on the analysis of the previous matches
 ● Validated the results using decision trees and logistic regression
 ]##Project_5:[Project_5_Domain@@Project_5_ Cloud Computing: Building a micro-services application on AWS using Flask
 ● Developed a fully functional social media application and hosted it on a AWS instance
 ● Used Docker (Docker-Compose) images to bundle the application with all dependencies to a container
 ● Used SQLite3 as the database management system, instances connecting with the database for every API call
 ● Used Docker bind-mount – an alternative to Docker volume for all micro-services to communicate the database, Social Media Analytics – Disease Surveillance using Twitter
 PROJECTS ● Preprocessed tweets to get rid of required attributes
 ● Representing tweets as Sentence embedding using Word2vec
 ● Unsupervised learning for clustering diseases
 ● Month-wise analysis of disease tweets
 ● Visualization using Google Maps to analysis the spread of diseases across the globe
 Machine Translation – Kannada Named Entity Recognition using Bi-LSTM model
● Worked with TDIL annotated datasets
 ● Manually tagged few sentences of the dataset with Named Entities
 ● Trained huge corpus of Kannada words on GloVe
 ● Used word embedding, character embedding and POS tags to train the Bi-LSTM model to predict the Named entities]}

column37:
{Project_1:[Project_1_Domain@@Project_1_TWITTER FAKE NEWS NETWORK - An exploration of Twitter's Verified users and how likely is it
that an article shared by the user is fake. Used Graph Convolutional Networks to train a model
to learn graph embeddings and classify users based on their network neighbours and previous tweets.
Link - https://github.com/Aveek-Saha/TwitterFakeNet
CRICKET MATCH PREDICTOR - Use Apache Spark to predict the outcome of a cricket match
ball by ball. A probability model, and a decision tree model was trained using Apache Spark’s
MLLib module in Pyspark.
Link - https://github.com/Aveek-Saha/Cricket-score-predictor
YOUTUBE TRENDING VIDEO PREDICTOR - Given a video this model predicts whether the video
will feature on YouTubes trending page or not. Trained a Stacking classifier with KNN, Random
Forest and Naïve Bayes with Logistic Regression as the meta-classifier using scikit-learn.
CONTAINER ORCHESTRATOR - A container orchestration system that implements load balancing, auto scaling and fault tolerance, that can be used with any containerised application.
Made with Node.js and Docker
Link - https://github.com/Aveek-Saha/Orca-strator
SENTIMENT BASED STOCK PRICE PREDICTION - Trained various models in scikit-learn and
Keras to classify daily tweets and news articles about Apple as positive or negative. Each day
was given a sentiment score based on the overall sentiment. Using this stock price + sentiment
score data a LSTM was trained to predict future stock prices.
Link - https://github.com/Aveek-Saha/Sentiment-based-stock-price-forecasting
LIVE CHESS - Used Socket.io with NodeJS to make a website where people can join chess
game rooms and play with others around the world. The moves are reflected in real time.
Link - https://github.com/Aveek-Saha/Online-Chess
FUSE FILESYSTEM - A basic file system in user space written in C using FUSE. Supports
operations like create, open, read and write files. Creating, renaming and deleting folders is also
supported.
Link - https://github.com/Aveek-Saha/FUSE-Filesystem
DUSK PLAYER - A music player for desktop, which has over eight thousand downloads, built
with Electron and AngularJS.
Link - https://github.com/Aveek-Saha/MusicPlayer]}

column37:
{Project_1:[Project_1_Domain@@Project_1_1. DBMS
Project Title: Designed the front and back end for e commerce website which sells mobile phones.
Project Description: This project deals with the management of users and admin portal by creating tables for user information, product details and cart information. In the admin portal he/she can add, update, delete products and view user details. These added values by the admin will be displayed in the user section when she/he buys a phone. For the front end we designed the website where users could see various kinds of phones just like in Amazon or Flipkart. On purchasing the user has to login, but if the
user hasn’t registered then he/she has to register and proceed for the payment. Technology: HTML, Bootstrap, JQuery, PHP, Ajax MySQL db.
]##Project_2:[Project_2_Domain@@Project_2_ Operating System
Project Title: FUSE File System.
Project Description :In our project we implement system calls for file operations that can be issued by Linux for this we used FUSE, which provides a way to intercept system calls and redirect them to a handler function. We also implemented more system call namely: stat, mkdir, rmdir, rename and unlink. Lastly we made our file system persistent with the help of serialization and deserialization. The goal of this project is to implement a simple, fully functioning and persistent file system using FUSE.
Technology: FUSE( File system in User space)
]##Project_3:[Project_3_Domain@@Project_3_ SAN Project Title: Transferring files between iSCSI target and iSCSI initiator
Project Description : iSCSI works by transporting block-level data
between an iSCSI initiator and an iSCSI target. The iSCSI protocol
encapsulates SCSI commands and assembles the data in packets for the TCP/IP layer. Packets are sent over the network using a point-to-point connection. Upon arrival, the iSCSI protocol disassembles the packets, separating the SCSI commands, so the operating system (OS) will see the storage as a local SCSI device that can be formatted as usual. Technology: iSCSI network.
]##Project_4:[Project_4_Domain@@Project_4_ Cloud Computing
Project Title: SelfieLessActs App
Project Description: It is an Online photo sharing app, that is
containerized and orchestrated automatically. There are two instances of
AWS hosting two different parts of the app, users and acts. An orchestrator
running in acts instance automatically does load balancing, fault tolerance,
auto-scaling of the containers running in the same instance.
Technology: Dockers were used to build, run, manage, and orchestrate
the containerization of the containers in two components of the app’s
instances, users and acts. Docker SDK a python library was used to build
the orchestrator residing in the acts instance.
5. Compiler
Design
Project Title: Mini Compiler
Project Description: For the Lexical Analysis Phase we created the scanner
in C language using Lex. The Syntax Analysis is for verifying that the
sequence of tokens forms a valid sentence given the definition of our grammar. The parser will read the source program and construct an Abstract Syntax Tree. If no syntax errors are encountered, the code will print the completed parse tree as flat text. In the Semantic Analysis Phase we write appropriate rules to check for type checking. Further we write appropriate
rules in Parser to generate Three Address Code. Elimination of Dead code and implementation of Common sub expression elimination takes place in the Intermediate Code Optimization Phase.
Technology: Lex, Yacc and C language. ]##Project_5:[Project_5_Domain@@Project_5_ MINORS
• Minors in Principle of Management under the MBA Department, PES University.
• Minors in Marketing Strategies under the MBA Department, PES
University.]}

column43:
{Internship_1:[Internship_1_Company@@Internship_1_Company’s Name: A Money Tree
About The Company: A Money Tree based in Mumbai aims at building an
ethical mindset and reinforcing a sound value system. It deals with ideation,
setting up successful startups, implementing projects, setting deviations
right, mentoring and coaching.
Skills Learnt: During this period I learnt how to develop Training Program
Structures used in Corporate Operational Context.
I gained knowledge as to how to create operational compliance internally in
organizations.
By doing immense research on specific data, it gave me an exposure to the
method in which organizations start the process of identifying and fine tuning
the markets they intend to enter.
Duration: 2 months – Work from home (1st January 2019 – 1st March 2019)


2.
Company’s Name: Invenzo Labs India Pvt Ltd.
About The Company: Invenzo Labs based in Bengaluru, aims at
democratizing access to business critical technologies through SaaS platforms
to transform businesses, the way they run and achieve a holistic Digital
process Automation. The company has 3 Saas platforms:
1. Izowhiz : An intelligent Dispatch Platform
2. Izoleap : Digital Process Automation Platform
3. Izohealth : Ambulatory Service with EHR Mobility.
Skills Learnt: During this period I learnt to design the front end of
websites using Ajax, JQuery and JavaScript.
As Izoleap has partnered with Dunzo for the delivery of items, so my task
was to code public APIs for integrating Dunzo’s logistics network into our
application. Development of the APIs was done in Codeigniter which is based
on MVC.
For security purpose, Dunzo shares a unique client id and client secret with
each client. So the client will need to generate an access token to pass in the
request header for all the APIs. The Dunzo API uses HTTP status code to
indicate the status of our requests such as 200, 201, 304, 400, 401 etc.
Responses from the Dunzo APIs are in JSON format. If something goes
wrong, we get the error responses, which includes details about what went wrong.
APIs were developed to quote the price and pickup/dropoff eta estimate for a potential delivery based on query parameters like pickup latitude, pickup longitude, drop latitude and drop longitude.
Next API was to create a task on the Dunzo platform with the following POST
]##Internship_2:[Internship_2_Company@@Internship_2_ parameters : request_id, pickup_details, drop_details, sender_details,
receiver_details, special_instructions etc.
APIs are developed to track the status of the task such as created, queued,
runner_cancelled, runner_accepted, delivered etc.
All the responses from the APIs are decoded and stored in the database.
Duration: 2 months (10th June 2019 – 10th August 2019)]}

column37:
{Project_1:[Project_1_Domain@@Project_1_STOCK MARKET ANALYSIS | COMPARE AND CONTRAST IN ML
• The goal of this project is to compare and contrast the predictive
accuracy of multiple Machine Learning Models. As part of this, working
with models like Linear Regression, ARIMA, K-Nearest Neighbour and
Long short-term memory Neural Nets.
SELFIELESS ACTS | MICROSERVICES AND CLOUD COMPUTING
• Developed from scratch a web application using Python Flask and
Restful APIs. Also includes a simple microservice model with two
microservices - Acts and Users. Developing a simple load balancerfor
Acts Microservice as well to scale up and scale down containers.
Exposed to basic use of docker and docker-compose.
MACHINE TRANSLATION | VICTORIAN ENGLISH TO MODERN ENGLISH
• Making use of RNNs with GRU cells, we created a sequence to sequence
encoder-decoder model to translate Victorian English to Modern
English. To improve performance we used an Attention decoder. Apart
from this, Keras teacherforcing was used to help in faster convergence.]}
column43:
{Internship_1:[Internship_1_Company@@Internship_1_PES UNIVERSITY | CLOUD COMPUTING AND BIG DATA CENTRE

Worked with Prof. Nirupama Padmanabha and Dr. Dinkar Sitaram to create an
affordable solution to Home Monitoring for Pregnancy. We developed a device that

column37: {Project_1:[Project_1_Domain@@Project_1_Connected Living Spaces An IoT solution for measuring home conditions, controlling home access, monitoring and controlling home appliance and the household equipments.
