column37: {Project_1:[Project_1_Domain@@Project_1_Selfieless acts app deployment - Cloud (February 2019 - April 2019) Selfieless acts application is a platform to upload pictures and which can be viewed by clients through an integrated mobile app using REST APIs. Entire application is built on Amazon EC2 instances.This project includes building of custom orchestrator, docker container management for load balancing, auto scaling and fault tolerance. ]##Project_2:[Project_2_Domain@@Project_2_ Identification of User Query on Stack Overflow using Semantic Search (June 2019 - July 2018) Used Stack Overflow API to query questions and answers to form a corpus. Used GLOVE for the vector representation of words. For any input query, fetch top 3 related questions using vector similarity and fetch the most accurate answer based on sentiment, user rating and upvotes. ]##Project_3:[Project_3_Domain@@Project_3_ A Comparison on GVF and VFC on Leaf Images (June 2018 -Aug 2018) Worked on Active Contours(snake) by applying Gradient Vector Field (GVF) and Vector Field Convolution(VFC) on cotton leaf images by applying Sobel, canny, Laplacian and Gaussian filters, made extensive research on the comparison of these two external forces. ]##Project_4:[Project_4_Domain@@Project_4_ Automated Attendance System using Face Recognition (Jan 2019 -Feb 2018) Built a prototype to automate the attendance process using face recognition, used OpenCV to capture frames from live Video, Dlib to detect facial features and K - Nearest Neighbours for classification, this algorithm makes the training process faster. This was recognized as one of the Top 5 projects of Prakalpa 2019. ]##Project_5:[Project_5_Domain@@Project_5_ Perf analysis of Cache (June 2018 -Aug 2018) Analysis and performance with Cache-Calculation and providing complete analysis of cache hits, misses and branch misses.By using Technologies like Apache Spark, Map Reduce, Perf(for gathering data about cache), K-means clustering and Cosine similarity. ]##Project_6:[Project_6_Domain@@Project_6_ C Based MINI-COMPILER to Implement FOR and SWITCH constructs (Feb 2019 – Apr 2019) Developing a C compiler using Lex and Yacc by implementing all stages of compiler - lexer, symbol table generation, parser, syntax validation, code generation and code optimisation.]}
column41: DV Anudeep, Vijay Bhargav Eshappa, Bhagya M. Patil, A Comparison of GVF and VFC on Leaf Images, International Journal of Plant Research, Vol. 8 No. 2, 2018, pp. 34-39. doi: 10.5923/j.plant.20180802.02. http://article.sapub.org/10.5923.j.plant.20180802.02.html
column43: {Internship_1:[Internship_1_Company@@Internship_1_Data Science Intern at LAM Research (May 2019 - Present) Built a Deep Defect Learning algorithm that will categorize the hardware/process root cause. Created CNN models using InceptionV3 for Wafer, morphology and Mechanical Classification. Used contour techniques for extracting the point of interest on the image. Feature and defect extraction on wafer images like Mesa, Groove and Seal etc. ]##Internship_2:[Internship_2_Company@@Internship_2_ Research Intern at Centre for Cloud Computing and Big Data (June 2018 -Aug 2018) Worked in improvising the Architecture of Apache Spark - implemented a Master-Slave Architecture on a cluster of 4 machines and set up a Hadoop Distributed file system. We have implemented a few methods like Round Robin Scheduling, Least used CPU core to assign the multiple threads running on the Spark Job. ]##Internship_3:[Internship_3_Company@@Internship_3_  Android Developer at Karnataka For Employment (Oct 2017 - Jan 2018) Worked as the technical head for the Organisation Karnataka for Employment, Developed an Android App for making job searching easier in Rural Areas, generated many government and private jobs for those in need. We have used Firebase, Picasso, Dynamic entities to App. This is has been published in more than 10 Newspapers in Karnataka, successfully running in play store having over 41000 downloads and an excess rating of 4.7. ]##Internship_4:[Internship_4_Company@@Internship_4_ Teaching Assistant PES University (Jan 2018 - Mar 2018) A part of PESU IO Team. Worked as an SME(Subject Matter Expert) , taught Android App Development to over 80 students. Which included a recording of total 5 lectures and 8 live sessions in class and students were constantly given Assignments and Quizzes which was monitored on Edmodo. ]##Internship_5:[Internship_5_Company@@Internship_5_ Core Team Member of Developer Student Club(DSC) Powered by GOOGLE (Feb 2019 -Present) Currently Heading Android Domain. We conduct many workshops related to Android , Machine Learning and also fulfill the responsibility of being a Student facilitator. ]##Internship_6:[Internship_6_Company@@Internship_6_ Core Team Member of CSR(Collegiate Social Responsibility) (Aug 2016 -Present) Active member and organized events within campus like Blood donation camp, eats and beats (fund raiser) and off campus events like tree plantation, swachh bharath abhiyan in lalbagh , old age home visit and orphanage visit.]}

column37: {Project_1:[Project_1_Domain@@Project_1_Selfieless acts app deployment - Cloud (February 2019 - April 2019) Selfieless acts application is a platform to upload pictures and which can be viewed by clients through an integrated mobile app using REST APIs. Entire application is built on Amazon EC2 instances.This project includes building of custom orchestrator, docker container management for load balancing, auto scaling and fault tolerance. ]##Project_2:[Project_2_Domain@@Project_2_ Identification of User Query on Stack Overflow using Semantic Search (June 2019 - July 2018) Used Stack Overflow API to query questions and answers to form a corpus. Used GLOVE for the vector representation of words. For any input query, fetch top 3 related questions using vector similarity and fetch the most accurate answer based on sentiment, user rating and upvotes. ]##Project_3:[Project_3_Domain@@Project_3_ A Comparison on GVF and VFC on Leaf Images (June 2018 -Aug 2018) Worked on Active Contours(snake) by applying Gradient Vector Field (GVF) and Vector Field Convolution(VFC) on cotton leaf images by applying Sobel, canny, Laplacian and Gaussian filters, made extensive research on the comparison of these two external forces. ]##Project_4:[Project_4_Domain@@Project_4_ Automated Attendance System using Face Recognition (Jan 2019 -Feb 2018) Built a prototype to automate the attendance process using face recognition, used OpenCV to capture frames from live Video, Dlib to detect facial features and K - Nearest Neighbours for classification, this algorithm makes the training process faster. This was recognized as one of the Top 5 projects of Prakalpa 2019. ]##Project_5:[Project_5_Domain@@Project_5_ Perf analysis of Cache (June 2018 -Aug 2018) Analysis and performance with Cache-Calculation and providing complete analysis of cache hits, misses and branch misses.By using Technologies like Apache Spark, Map Reduce, Perf(for gathering data about cache), K-means clustering and Cosine similarity. ]##Project_6:[Project_6_Domain@@Project_6_ C Based MINI-COMPILER to Implement FOR and SWITCH constructs (Feb 2019 – Apr 2019) Developing a C compiler using Lex and Yacc by implementing all stages of compiler - lexer, symbol table generation, parser, syntax validation, code generation and code optimisation.]}
column41: DV Anudeep, Vijay Bhargav Eshappa, Bhagya M. Patil, A Comparison of GVF and VFC on Leaf Images, International Journal of Plant Research, Vol. 8 No. 2, 2018, pp. 34-39. doi: 10.5923/j.plant.20180802.02. http://article.sapub.org/10.5923.j.plant.20180802.02.html
column43: {Internship_1:[Internship_1_Company@@Internship_1_Data Science Intern at LAM Research (May 2019 - Present) Built a Deep Defect Learning algorithm that will categorize the hardware/process root cause. Created CNN models using InceptionV3 for Wafer, morphology and Mechanical Classification. Used contour techniques for extracting the point of interest on the image. Feature and defect extraction on wafer images like Mesa, Groove and Seal etc. ]##Internship_2:[Internship_2_Company@@Internship_2_ Research Intern at Centre for Cloud Computing and Big Data (June 2018 -Aug 2018) Worked in improvising the Architecture of Apache Spark - implemented a Master-Slave Architecture on a cluster of 4 machines and set up a Hadoop Distributed file system. We have implemented a few methods like Round Robin Scheduling, Least used CPU core to assign the multiple threads running on the Spark Job. ]##Internship_3:[Internship_3_Company@@Internship_3_  Android Developer at Karnataka For Employment (Oct 2017 - Jan 2018) Worked as the technical head for the Organisation Karnataka for Employment, Developed an Android App for making job searching easier in Rural Areas, generated many government and private jobs for those in need. We have used Firebase, Picasso, Dynamic entities to App. This is has been published in more than 10 Newspapers in Karnataka, successfully running in play store having over 41000 downloads and an excess rating of 4.7. ]##Internship_4:[Internship_4_Company@@Internship_4_ Teaching Assistant PES University (Jan 2018 - Mar 2018) A part of PESU IO Team. Worked as an SME(Subject Matter Expert) , taught Android App Development to over 80 students. Which included a recording of total 5 lectures and 8 live sessions in class and students were constantly given Assignments and Quizzes which was monitored on Edmodo. ]##Internship_5:[Internship_5_Company@@Internship_5_ Core Team Member of Developer Student Club(DSC) Powered by GOOGLE (Feb 2019 -Present) Currently Heading Android Domain. We conduct many workshops related to Android , Machine Learning and also fulfill the responsibility of being a Student facilitator. ]##Internship_6:[Internship_6_Company@@Internship_6_ Core Team Member of CSR(Collegiate Social Responsibility) (Aug 2016 -Present) Active member and organized events within campus like Blood donation camp, eats and beats (fund raiser) and off campus events like tree plantation, swachh bharath abhiyan in lalbagh , old age home visit and orphanage visit.]}

column37:
{Project_1:[Project_1_Domain@@Project_1_Cross Platform Application —
Android+web application addressing
hunger issues.
In a team of 4, We have built a cross platform
application using firebase as real-time
database for both the Web and Android
application addressing Hunger issues in India.
Skills used:Android programming,Web
developing,Gmaps.Google Firebase.
]##Project_2:[Project_2_Domain@@Project_2_ Automated Attendance System Using
Facial Recognition
Identifies faces of group of students in
classroom and marks their attendence.Modules
used:OpenCv,DLIB,Scikit Learn.Algorithm Used
K-Nearest Neighbours(KNN).
https://github.com/DeekshithGodavarthi
]##Project_3:[Project_3_Domain@@Project_3_ Hand gesture controlled robot using
arduino Using accelerometer we use to track hand
movements and transfer signals through Rf
modules to move a car.
]##Project_4:[Project_4_Domain@@Project_4_ Online pizza ordering Website with fully
functional backend
In a team of four, we have developed an online
pizza ordering site, using
HTML5,pHp,javascript,Bootstrap,JQuery,SQL.
Through this website customers can place an
order which when verified by authorities , is
delivered.
https://github.com/DeekshithGodavarthi
]##Project_5:[Project_5_Domain@@Project_5_ Implementation of Huffman encoding
using Data Structures
Implementation of Huffman Encoding using
trees, arrays and linked lists.
https://github.com/DeekshithGodavarthi
]##Project_6:[Project_6_Domain@@Project_6_ Flask Web Application on amazon Ec2.
Writing multiple api’s and working with
containers,microservices and implementing fault
tolerance,auto-scaling,load balancing through
container orchestration.
]##Project_7:[Project_7_Domain@@Project_7_ Question Answer system using simplified
Dynamic Memory Networks(DMN)
Building a QA system that is based on a simplified
version of Dynamic Memory Network, and sourced
using a closed domain(the questions have concrete
limitations, in that they relate to some predefined
source).Datasets:babi,Glove word vectors
https://drive.google.com/open?id=1POSUeJ8SAluZ2
_-tAKY9LpC0Y0MmOr_b
]##Project_8:[Project_8_Domain@@Project_8_ Social Network Analysis on book "Immortals
Of Meluha"
Extracting a social graph based on co-occurrence
and analysis of the social graph, build an implicit
social graph using co-occurrence from a literary
text(Immortals of Meluha), Analyzing the graph to
correlate findings with the story.Visualizing the
above social graph using Gephi. steps:
Pre-processing the text. Building adjacency matrix
or adjacency list for the extracted implicit undirected
graph using some co-occurrence algorithm.
Processing the extracted graph further by dropping
unnecessary nodes, isolates.Using Networkx in
Python, to perform the analysis. Using Gephi do a
visualization.]}

column37:
{Project_1:[Project_1_Domain@@Project_1_1. Project Title : Drug Application
Language : C
Data Structures : Singly linked list, Binary search trees, Circular linked list
Description : This application was mainly built to help patients to get alarms for a particular medicine which needs to taken at a particular time, also to help patients to take precautionary measures while taking medicine.
]##Project_2:[Project_2_Domain@@Project_2_ Project Title : Wedding Planner
Language : HTML, PHP, java script, CSS
Description : This app helps users to find the best wedding venues for perfect wedding where they could book party halls for engagement, cocktail ,reception, wedding .
]##Project_3:[Project_3_Domain@@Project_3_ Project Title : Railway Reservation system
Language : HTML,PHP, MySQL, JavaScript, CSS
Description : End-users can book tickets in advance to reach their destination, also provides information regarding the arrival and departure timings. They could even query for a given source and destination.
]##Project_4:[Project_4_Domain@@Project_4_ Project Title : File System using fuse
Language : Python
Description : File System Emulation using Fuse library. Operations such as creation and
deletion of files and directories, editing a file etc. File system even works for multilevel and it is also made persistent.
]##Project_5:[Project_5_Domain@@Project_5_.Project Title : Prediction of winning team in IPL Cricket (Big Data)
Language : Python
Description : Data such as previously played cricket commentaries, strike rate of cricket players. Machine learning algorithms such as K-means Clustering and Decision Trees are used to build a model which predicts the probability of winning team.
]##Project_6:[Project_6_Domain@@Project_6_ Project Title : Selfieless Acts App (Cloud Computing) and Container Orchestration
Language : HTML,PHP, CSS, Python
Description : App built on AWS Cloud , a backend server is built using Flask module in python and sqlalchemy as interface for database. Application is also divided into 2 micro services (i.e. Docker Containers). Container Orchestration is done using a Docker module, which does load balancing, auto scaling and health checks.
]##Project_7:[Project_7_Domain@@Project_7_  Project Title : Fake news Detection (Machine Learning)
Language : Python
Description : Machine Learning Algorithm such as Support Vector machine and Bayesian Leaning is applied to detect whether the news is fake or not. The paragraph is converted into vector form using bag of word techniques. Libraries such as sklearn , matplotlib, numpy are used.
]##Project_8:[Project_8_Domain@@Project_8_ Project Title : Mini C Compiler
Language : C,
Tools : Lex, Yacc
Description : Phases such as lexical analysis i.e. generation of tokens, syntax analysis fitting the grammar rules on the program , semantic analysis , symbol table creation, intermediate code generation, code optimisation using DAG.]}
column43:
{Internship_1:[Internship_1_Company@@Internship_1_Company : Ayotta
Tools : Python , NLTK
Title : Kannada Sandhi Splitting
Description : Given kannada paragraph, the program splits the complex word based on Sandhi rules and outputs the processed paragraph with less complex words. Initially stop words are removed. Each word in the paragraph is first searched in the dictionary , if it does not exists then word is stemmed and sandhi rules are applied to the word to split the word.]}

column37:
{Project_1:[Project_1_Domain@@Project_1_1. Container Orchestrator - Cloud Computing
● Created a container orchestrator capable of performing load balancing,
fault tolerance and auto-scaling.
● Used Amazon AWS and docker to create and replicate microservices to allow
scaling.
● Used FLASK to implement a basic cloud-based web application.
● REST API on AWS instances for backend processing of application.
]##Project_2:[Project_2_Domain@@Project_2_Poet Identifier
● A Machine Learning oriented project that recognises and classifies the
poetic style of 300 famous english poets.
● Qualities like Rhyme scheme, word usage, poem structure etc used to
identify the poet or poetic style.
]##Project_3:[Project_3_Domain@@Project_3_Tweet Analyser to predict stock values
● A NLP project that analyses tweets and previously available stock market
data to predict future changes.
● Gained experience in Sentiment analysis and also in the usage of keras.
]##Project_4:[Project_4_Domain@@Project_4_Social Network Clustering Algorithms
● A C++ project that demonstrates multiple algorithms used to cluster
social graphs in different ways, for example k-core, k-cliques etc.
● Comparison of the different clustering methods and their usefulness.
]##Project_5:[Project_5_Domain@@Project_5_Scholarkit
● A website with both front-end and back-end functionality that allows
students to view scholarships and internships that they are eligible for.
● It also allows students to apply for internships and companies to view
these applications and post internship opportunities.]}
column43: {Internship_1:[Internship_1_Company@@Internship_1_1. Microsoft India Development Center, Hyderabad — Software Development Engineering Intern MAY 2019 - JULY 2019 ● Worked on Edge on Chromium base to create a new feature. ● Did work that helped me gain knowledge about and experience with Azure speech-to-text.                  ]##Internship_2:[Internship_2_Company@@Internship_2_Renalyx, Bangalore — Programming Intern MAY 2018 - JULY 2018 ● Internship at Renalyx to build C modules for a Dialysis machine. ● Work involved creating Calibration modules for various components of the machine like heparin pump, blood pump etc. ● Used IDE Visual Studio 7 for programming and testing and debugging with JTAG interface.]}

column37:
{Project_1:[Project_1_Domain@@Project_1_1. Container Orchestrator - Cloud Computing
Created a container orchestrator capable of performing load balancing,
fault tolerance and auto-scaling.
Used Amazon AWS and docker to create and replicate microservices to allow
scaling.
Used FLASK to implement a basic cloud-based web application.
REST API on AWS instances for backend processing of application.
]##Project_2:[Project_2_Domain@@Project_2_Poet Identifier
A Machine Learning oriented project that recognises and classifies the
poetic style of 300 famous english poets.
Qualities like Rhyme scheme, word usage, poem structure etc used to
identify the poet or poetic style.
]##Project_3:[Project_3_Domain@@Project_3_Tweet Analyser to predict stock values
A NLP project that analyses tweets and previously available stock market
data to predict future changes.
Gained experience in Sentiment analysis and also in the usage of keras.
]##Project_4:[Project_4_Domain@@Project_4_Social Network Clustering Algorithms
A C++ project that demonstrates multiple algorithms used to cluster
social graphs in different ways, for example k-core, k-cliques etc.
Comparison of the different clustering methods and their usefulness.
]##Project_5:[Project_5_Domain@@Project_5_Scholarkit
A website with both front-end and back-end functionality that allows
students to view scholarships and internships that they are eligible for.
It also allows students to apply for internships and companies to view
these applications and post internship opportunities.]}

column37:
{Project_1:[Project_1_Domain@@Project_1_Virtual File System (VFS)
- Implemented a VFS from scratch including the mounting and initialization of a persistent file system, managing files and directories, and performing file read/write operations based on Unix concepts of I nodes, file tables and super blocks.
- Uses FUSE (File System in User Space) to integrate system calls with custom functionality.
Front - end compiler in C language(IF AND FOR LOOP)
- Uses Lex and Yacc tools to parse, and a C code base to generate a Symbol Table, Abstract Syntax Tree, Intermediate Code and perform optimizations such as dead code elimination and constant folding. SELFIELESS ACT
- Designed a SELFIELESS ACT where users can upload photos, like and comment.
- A cloud based app, deployped on Amazon’s E2 instance and used REST API ’s for queries.Tours and travel website
- Uses DBMS to store and retrieve the users information, and book the tickets. Uses MongoDB to connect back end and front end. Uses HTML, HTML5 and Java script to design the website.
]##Project_2:[Project_2_Domain@@Project_2_ Department Management System
- A web based department website.
- 3 tier client server architecture has been implemented uses HTML and Java Script
for the front end and Sqlite3 and REST web services for the back end.
- Follws iterative model and alpha and beta testing methods are performed for testing]}

column37:
{Project_1:[Project_1_Domain@@Project_1_SELFIELESSACT| CLOUD BASED WEB APP
January - March 2019 | Team Size 4
•	Implementation of Microservices in Web app using docker container.
•	Created docker volume to make persistent storage.
•	Implemented container orchestration such as fault tolerance, load balancing and autoscaling of containers based on requests.
•	Technology used: Flask, REST API, DOCKER,  Amazon EC2 Instance.

]##Project_2:[Project_2_Domain@@Project_2_ IPL ANALYSIS AND PREDICTION | GROUP PROJECT
August- December 2018 | Team Size 3
•	Analysis of IPL data of previous years and predicting match result.
•	Predicting the probability of player scoring and getting out using KMeans, probability of independent events and predicting score in spell(over) using decision tree algorithm. 
•	Accuracy with Kmeans was 85% and decision tree was 78%
•	Language used: Python 

]##Project_3:[Project_3_Domain@@Project_3_ SOCKET PROGRAMMING| BUS BOOKING
August – December 2018 | Team Size 3
•	Mainly our project aims to use socket and do a backend for a bus booking system.
•	Technology used: psychopg2, socket modules.

]##Project_4:[Project_4_Domain@@Project_4_ SPORTS WORLD | WEB DEVELOPMENT
January -April 2018 | Team Size 4
•	A web page for sports news and updates.
•	Language used: HTML, CSS, JavaScript.

]##Project_5:[Project_5_Domain@@Project_5_ TRAIN RESERVATION | LINKED LIST
August- December 2017 | Team Size 4
•	Implement the train reservation system using data structure in C.
•	It has features like add trains, book a ticket, cancel a ticket etc.  
HACKATHONS
]##Project_6:[Project_6_Domain@@Project_6_ SLAC-2019 | 11-54 DISPATCHER | WEB DEVELOPER
April 2019 -April 2019 | Team Size 4
•	A project for detecting stolen vehicles and reporting to police using Licence plate recognition and sends push notifications to free cops of nearest police stations. We can report stolen vehicles to firebase through Web page after logging in.
•	Our project has received honourable mention for idea. ]}
column43:
{Internship_1:[Internship_1_Company@@Internship_1_>Nu Labs | SOFTWARE DEVELOPER INTERN
May 2019 – July 2019 | 2 mos.
•	Understanding of C library(libcli) and using it to write command line interface for the product which uses telnet.
•	Understood the working and essence of ROBOT Framework for automated testing and wrote test library and test script for their product. 
•	Also written test library for probing their software with byte array and recording responses for their correctness.
•	Helped in serialisation of data and its communication across the TCP network.
•	I got an idea of how product’s framework is planned built and recurring corrections and people’s hardship in bringing the product.M2]}

column37:
{Project_1:[Project_1_Domain@@Project_1_1.SELFIELESS ACTS | Cloud Computing
● A cloud based web application built on Amazon AWS, that is used to share
information about anything that is good for the society as photos.
● We used rest APIs to automate the process.
]##Project_2:[Project_2_Domain@@Project_2_IPL ANALYSIS AND PREDICTION | Python, Big Data Tools
● Given two IPL cricket teams, we analysed and predicted the match results
using player’s order of play and their IPL career statistics.
● Used K-means to cluster players with similar statistics to obtained
batsman-bowler pair statistics.
]##Project_3:[Project_3_Domain@@Project_3_BUS BOOKING SYSTEM | Socket Programming
● We used sockets and established a client-server connection using TCP
between them and built a bus booking system.
]##Project_4:[Project_4_Domain@@Project_4_E-VOTING | Database Project
● We tried to make voting a simple online process with a web interface where
voter gets access to e-ballot paper to cast their vote.
● Further implementations like biometrics match is the heart of e-voting
process.
]##Project_5:[Project_5_Domain@@Project_5_TRAIN RESERVATION SYSTEM | Data Structures
● We implemented train reservation system using data structures in C
language.
● Features included are: book and cancel ticket, view trains between stations
and sign up.]}

generation of the portal.]}

column37:
{Project_1:[Project_1_Domain@@Project_1_1. Image Generation Using DCGAN
The project seeks to generate drawings using Google QuickDraw data which are
hand-drawn, The approach used is DCGAN (Deep Convolutional GANs).
Used Keras and Python for the project.
]##Project_2:[Project_2_Domain@@Project_2_Farmer’s Help: Robotfor Color detection, Image processing and Object
Grabbing
Using Arduino and OpenCV a robot which can detect whether a fruit is ripe or not,
depending on which it would go and collect the fruit and bring it back to the user.
]##Project_3:[Project_3_Domain@@Project_3_Theseus: An Acyclic Maze Solving Robot
Theseus is an Arduino based maze solving robot which could route a path from any acyclic
simple maze using A* Algorithm. The robot could later use the learnt knowledge of the
path and take an optimized route in further operations.
]##Project_4:[Project_4_Domain@@Project_4_Flix.io - A Movie And TV Show Recommendation Site
A full stack web-based movie recommendation website that includes its own database for
users and uses the TMDb for data and cookies for recommendation system.
]##Project_5:[Project_5_Domain@@Project_5_SelfielessActs
A Cloud based social media platform to share selfies or “selfieless” acts on an app backed
by AWS E2 instances with a REST based microservice architecture using Docker and a self
written orchestrator for fault tolerance and auto-scalability.]}

column43:
{Internship_1:[Internship_1_Company@@Internship_1_1. Data Science Intern/ Vantage Agora
June 2018 - August 2018
Automating the actuary part of insurance claims sector and the subsequent premium the
client pays using Machine Learning models.
]##Internship_2:[Internship_2_Company@@Internship_2_Creative Associate/ Vision India Foundation (VIF)
August 2018 - January 2019
Worked on Policy Watch: An initiative by VIF which seeks to convert Indian policy news to
bite-sized videos to spread awareness about government schemes. Led a team of 3 and
proactively worked to help increase audience engagement using demographic analysis.
]##Internship_3:[Internship_3_Company@@Internship_3_Policy In Action Fellow/ Young Leaders for Active Citizenship(YLAC)
January 2019- February 2019
A highly selective fellowship. Was one of the only three undergraduate fellows in the
program. Worked on a policy brief on ‘Institutional & Tech Support for MSMEs in India’ for a
Lok Sabha Member of Parliament (MP): K Kavitha.
]##Internship_4:[Internship_4_Company@@Internship_4_Global Shapers Fellow/ An initiative by World Economic Forum
July 2019 - Present
A six-month multidisciplinary program that brings together young dynamic social
impact-minded individuals with exceptional leadership potential from diverse backgrounds
to shape the present and future of Bangalore. Working on Tech for Mental Health.]}

column37:
{Project_1:[Project_1_Domain@@Project_1_1. Built Linux package manager
It is a client-server application built in Python. Web application for the product was built using the Flask
framework and python socket programming. It allows users to download commonly used Linux packages over the
network.
]##Project_2:[Project_2_Domain@@Project_2_Built a Music recognition software
It is a music recognition software application written in Python which can recognize song being played from any
point in the song. FFT algorithm was used to get the peak frequencies which were made as the signature of the
song.
]##Project_3:[Project_3_Domain@@Project_3_Built a cloud application
Our application was written in Python. It had two different AWS instances running and a path based routing load
balancer was used for routing into the correct AWS instance. Inside each instance, multiple containers were
launched which had core logic of the project along with the database. Inside each instance, a generic Orchestrator
was built which supported auto-scaling and fault tolerance. Our project was deployed in AWS.
]##Project_4:[Project_4_Domain@@Project_4_Compiler for C++ language
Created a compiler for C++ language. Lexical analyzer and grammar were written using lex and yacc. Syntax error
checking and type checking was done. Following which abstract syntax tree generation, intermediate code
generation and code optimization were also done as part of the project.
]##Project_5:[Project_5_Domain@@Project_5_Developed games in the area of Artificial Intelligence
 Built Sudoku solving game using AI techniques. It was solved using Constraint satisfaction problem
techniques. It was written in Python.
 Tic tac toe solving game using AI. It was implemented using the minimax algorithm and written in Ruby.
]##Project_6:[Project_6_Domain@@Project_6_Built a file system using FUSE
Used FUSE to implement a file system in C. It supports system calls like open, read, write, unlink, mkdir,
rmdir etc.
]##Project_7:[Project_7_Domain@@Project_7_Built a website for a car show
The web application was built using JavaScript, HTML and CSS for frontend. PHP and MySQL for the backend.
It’s for a public exhibition of current automobile models, debuts and concept cars. Some of our website features
were buying tickets for the exhibition and viewing videos of past events.
]##Project_8:[Project_8_Domain@@Project_8_Built a text editor using a doubly linked list in C
The text editor supports all the common operations provided by a command line interface text editor.
]##Project_9:[Project_9_Domain@@Project_9_Developed a C library
This library supports common mathematical operations for an arbitrary length of integers (greater than the size of
long). The numbers were stored as strings and all the common operations were implemented efficiently.
]##Project_10:[Project_10_Domain@@Project_10_Implemented Dijkstra’s shortest path algorithm
The objective of this project was to find the shortest path from the source node to all the nodes in a weighted
graph. It was written in C.]}
column43:
{Internship_1:[Internship_1_Company@@Internship_1_1. Research intern at the Centre for Data Science and Applied Machine Learning May-July’18
Pes University, Bangalore
I worked on auto-generating descriptive paragraphs for images. It is built using Convolutional Neural Network
and Hierarchical Recurrent Neural Network in Python.
]##Internship_2:[Internship_2_Company@@Internship_2_Software development intern at Lam Research, Bangalore June-July’19
I have setup ELK stack for searching, analysing and visualizing log data. I have also built custom parsers for various
types of log files using Ruby.]}

column37:
{Project_1:[Project_1_Domain@@Project_1_1. Docker Symphony -
Docker symphony is a simple orchestrator for docker containers running
REST API’s. It performs load balancing amongst containers, autoscaling (
Both scaling up and scaling down) and also implements fault tolerance.
Technologies used- Python, Flask, Docker SDK for python, Python
requests library.
Github- https://github.com/wolfharan/docker-symphony
]##Project_2:[Project_2_Domain@@Project_2_Lunchbox-Lunchbox is a food ordering application for a workplace or an institution.
The student or the employee can order food from the cafeterias or
canteens inside the institution and can pick it up when it’s ready. One can
also place an order from restaurants which will be delivered to them with
live tracking. The application has an institution view, canteen view and a
caterer view each with their own features and restrictions.
Github- https://github.com/hrishikeshSuresh/lunchbox

]##Project_3:[Project_3_Domain@@Project_3_Website for Premier League ( Football) -
This is a website built using basic web technologies - HTMl, CSS, PHP and
MYSQL. The front end can be hosted on apache2 and the backend is a
relational MySQL Database.
Githubhttps://github.com/wolfharan/web-tech-design-using-html-css-javasc
ript
]##Project_4:[Project_4_Domain@@Project_4_Selfielessacts- A social network built on Flask and deployed
on AWSSelfielessacts is a social network built using Flask and deployed on
Amazon AWS. It is a set of REST API’s that allow the following operations
- Create a user
- Delete a user
-Add a post
-Delete a post
-Upvote a post
-Add a category
- And a few more API’s required for the application.]}

column37:
{Project_1:[Project_1_Domain@@Project_1_1. Computer Network Security Simulated MITM attacks, DDoS attacks using virtual machines on Oracle VM VirtualBox. Nmap was also used to test
perimeter defences over a locally connected network.
]##Project_2:[Project_2_Domain@@Project_2_Filesystem using FUSE Implemented a file system on top of our existing filesystem using FUSE. Linked lists were used, my own structures were
developed for block storage.
]##Project_3:[Project_3_Domain@@Project_3_Google Play Store App Ratings
prediction
Data Analytics project evaluating different ML models in predicting app ratings, taking into account the various features
an app download would have.
Data Analytics As part of our course work, involves performing exploratory data analysis on various datasets, performing Principal
Component Analysis for instance. Example application: Prediction of price of property based on various attributes.
]##Project_4:[Project_4_Domain@@Project_4_Compiler for Python Completed implementing the lexer and yacc files for all the phases of designing a compiler (From the Lexer Phase to the
Intermediate Code Generation to the Machine Code Optimization). Included developing the symbol table, handling the
scopes as well, data structures of Python and loop constructs – for and while.
]##Project_5:[Project_5_Domain@@Project_5_Cloud based application for
“SelfieLess Acts”
Implemented a REST Interface with many different functionalities where the website would consist of users uploading
acts of good nature, along with insertion of a caption. (Platform: AWS)
Automatic Captioning of
Images Using Deep Learning
We combined both image and text processing to generate a textual description from an image. Convolutional Neural
Network (CNN) for extracting features from images. Followed by this, we make use of a Recurrent Neural Network to
Process text. ]}
column41:
PUBLICATION - Comparison Of
IOT Architectures Using A
Smart City Benchmark
Evaluated four architectures of IOT- Edge, Mist, Fog and Cloud by building simulation models for each using SimPy.
Using CityBench’s dataset for evaluation. Architectures for the four were studied and analysis is being made, accepted
at the conference COCONET ’19 (Scopus Indexed), and will be published in the Procedia Computer Science Journal.
Chaotic Machine Learning We are proposing a quantum theoretic approach for classification of text and image data, with the underlying math
being that of Chaos Theory, Quantum Theory and Hamiltonians. Shifted our focus to a new activation function which is a
modification of RELU to incorporate non-linear behaviour. Under Dr. Snehanshu Saha and Dr.Nithin Nagaraj (NIAS).
column44:
Data Structures, Design and Analysis of Algorithms, Data Analytics, Big Data, Computer Network Security, Machine
Learning, Cloud Computing by Microsoft MTA, Operating Systems, Database Management Systems.
column49:
Got accepted to the Carnegie Mellon University iRise program to work on the domain Cloud as a Research Intern for summer ‘19, but due to concerns
and funding, was unable to go.
GeeksforGeeks Ambassador for PES University, high rank on coding practice. HP Code Wars finalist.
Joint Technical Student Co-ordinator Prakalpa 2018, went on to bag the second place in the competition, for the department of CSE.
Co-Head of Marketing for the Technical and Cultural event Aatmatrisha’18.

column37:
{Project_1:[Project_1_Domain@@Project_1_To Deny or Not to Deny- Predicting Visa Status
Determining how visa status outcome of three most applied-to visacategories (H1-B, L1, and F1) to the United States are influenced by
attributes of user application metadata and thereby predicting the status. ]##Project_2:[Project_2_Domain@@Project_2_  Data Analytics Automated Essay Grading
Building an automated essay scoring system by rigorously analysing the essays, scoring system, and applying a wide range of transformations
which results in a unique two-step approach to the problem.
]##Project_3:[Project_3_Domain@@Project_3_ Natural Language Processing
The Book Store- An Exchange Portal For Students
Creating a website that facilitates exchange of books, course material
and informal notes between students and teachers.]}
column43:
{Internship_1:[Internship_1_Company@@Internship_1_Research Intern - Paper Published
Presented a single author paper 'Supervised Learning Model for
Accent Recognition in English Speech using Sequential MFCC
Features' at the International Conference for Artificial Intelligence
and Data Engineering, N.M.A.M Institute of Technology, Nitte,
Karnataka in May 2019.
The proceedings will be published in the Springer-Nature "Advances
in Intelligent Systems and Computing" by Springer International
Publishing.
Under the guidance of Dr. Shylaja SS, Chairperson CSE, PESU (2018)
Summer Intern
Worked on an industry given problem- To explore the application of
different machine learning and collaborative filtering techniques to
predict likelihood of the insurance claim amount and thereby
premium for a policy holder.
Vantage Agora, Dr. Shylaja SS (2018)
Summer Intern
Worked on a robotics project to develop a robot which is capable of
mapping an area two dimensionally and navigating through it semi
autonomously]}

RECOGNITIONS
Founder of 'Write Angle'- Official Literary
Club of PESU
The club has an active community of 200
people and is responsible for organising various
literary and co-curricular activities like 'Open
Mics' and 'Blackout Poetry', which have
witnessed an audience of 150 people.
Curator of 'START' - CIE's first newsletter

newsletter – START. Received a honorarium of
Rs. 6000.

Catalogue

on student activities – ‘Campus Culture’ for the
years 2018 and 2019.

Scholarship for being in the top 20% of the
cohort from years 2017-2019.
Student editor- TOI NIE

Edition in high school. Poems and articles
published from years 2011-2015

column37:
{Project_1:[Project_1_Domain@@Project_1_Android Application for Hands -free Telephone Dialling using Machine Learning at PES University
Period: September 2018 – Present
Description: Used Keras and Tensorflow in Python to prepare a Machine
Learning model to perform Offline Audio Digit Recognition for multiple
languages (English, Hindi). This model is being integrated into an Android
Application for Hands-free Telephone Dialling.
]##Project_2:[Project_2_Domain@@Project_2_ IPL Match Analysis and Simulation at PES University
Period: October 2018 – November 2018
Description: Using pandas and sklearn created a model for generating an
IPL match simulation. Did the same with a Decision tree classifier using
pyspark MLlib. ]##Project_3:[Project_3_Domain@@Project_3_ Ethnicity detection using Deep Neural Networks
Period: March 2019 – April 2019
Description: Model classifies image of person as Hispanic, Mongoloid,
Dravidian, Caucasian, African. Two machine learning models (CNN, ANN
built using Keras) are compared, arrive at which is the better model for
classification.
]##Project_4:[Project_4_Domain@@Project_4_ Automated Orchestrator for Cloud based web application to upload selfless acts (Implemented on AWS)
Period: March 2019 – April 2019
Description: Using an orchestrator the process of container creation ,
termination, request servicing and processing is automated. Fault-tolerance,
autoscaling and load balancing is implemented inside the orchestrator. The
application backend itself is built using Flask (in python) using REST API’s
which is packaged as separate aforementioned docker containers.]}
column43:

(COMPUTER VISION & MACHINE LEARNING) at In2IT Technologies Pvt. Ltd.
Period: May 29, 2019 to Jul 31, 2019
Description: Implemented an OCR pipeline using, OpenCV, EAST text detector and Tesseract-OCR to detect and recognise embedded characters on tyres.
 Offline Audio Digit Recognition For Multiple Languages.
]##Internship_2:[Internship_2_Company@@Internship_2_ (MACHINE LEARNING) at CDSAML, PES University.
Period: Jun 11, 2018 to Jul 25, 2018
Description: Used Keras and Tensorflow in Python to prepare a Machine
Learning model to perform Offline Audio Digit Recognition for multiple
languages (English, Hindi).]}

column21: Cloud computing##Operating System##Machine Learning##Web Development##Compiler Design##IoT##Big Data##Image Processing##Data Structures##Algorithms##Reinforcement Learning##Computer Networks##
column37:
{Project_1:[Project_1_Domain@@Project_1_1. Compiler Design
Designed a compiler for the if-else and for constructs of C programming language using
C. Used the Yacc and Lex tools for programming. The project included creation of the
symbol table, intermediate code generation, syntax tree and the optimized code (used
Dag Optimization).
]##Project_2:[Project_2_Domain@@Project_2_Music Player
A music player was made using C language and worked on an IDE. A linked list was used
for making this application.
]##Project_3:[Project_3_Domain@@Project_3_Pulse rate Detector
Had made a Pulse detector using an Arduino, which detected the pulse rate using a
sensor and displayed it on an LCD screen. It also created a visual representation of the
pulse rate using python.
]##Project_4:[Project_4_Domain@@Project_4_File System Management
Made a File System Implementation using FUSE.
]##Project_5:[Project_5_Domain@@Project_5_Computer Networking Mini Project
Made a two player game using Socket Programming.
]##Project_6:[Project_6_Domain@@Project_6_Big Data Project
Created a project which did an analysis on IPL matches to predict the score and winner
for a given test case.
Approach1: Using Clustering (Unsupervised Learning).
Approach2: It involved the use of decision trees (Supervised Learning).
]##Project_7:[Project_7_Domain@@Project_7_Created an e-commerce website
It was an online portal similar to OLX for buying and selling books for university students.
Had more focus on back end.
]##Project_8:[Project_8_Domain@@Project_8_Created an e-commerce website
It was an e-commerce website for buying stationary. Had more focus on front end.
]##Project_9:[Project_9_Domain@@Project_9_Cloud Computing Project
Created a cloud based web application called SelfieLessActs that is used to share
anything that is good for the society that we observe.
Allowed users to upload images of the act with a small caption and the category.
Took care of Load Balancing, fault tolerance and auto scaling.
]##Project_10:[Project_10_Domain@@Project_10_Machine Learning Project
The project aimed at predicting diabetes for people of age above 21. Created using SVM,
ANN, and the Naive Bayes Algorithm.]}

column37:
 Compiler Design
Designed a compiler for the if-else and for constructs of C programming language using 
C. Used the Yacc and Lex tools for programming. The project included creation of the 
symbol table, intermediate code generation, syntax tree and the optimized code (used 
Dag Optimization).
#### Music Player
A music player was made using C language and worked on an IDE. A linked list was used 
for making this application.
#### Pulse rate Detector
Had made a Pulse detector using an Arduino, which detected the pulse rate using a 
sensor and displayed it on an LCD screen. It also created a visual representation of the 
pulse rate using python.
#### File System Management
Made a File System Implementation using FUSE.
#### Computer Networking Mini Project
Made a two player game using Socket Programming. 
#### Big Data Project
Created a project which did an analysis on IPL matches to predict the score and winner 
for a given test case.
Approach1: Using Clustering (Unsupervised Learning). 
Approach2: It involved the use of decision trees (Supervised Learning).
#### Created an e-commerce website
It was an online portal similar to OLX for buying and selling books for university students. 
Had more focus on back end.
#### Created an e-commerce website
It was an e-commerce website for buying stationary. Had more focus on front end.
#### Cloud Computing Project
Created a cloud based web application called SelfieLessActs that is used to share anything that is good for the society that we observe.
Allowed users to upload images of the act with a small caption and the category.
Took care of Load Balancing, fault tolerance and auto scaling.#### Machine Learning Project
The project aimed at predicting diabetes for people of age above 21. Created using SVM, ANN, and the Naive Bayes Algorithm.
column43:
 June ’18- July’18 -
Completed a six weeks internship at Maruti Suzuki in the IT Department.
 - Worked with the Support Team and understood the advantages and
 problems arising with the softwares that were being used and tried to
 enhance them to cope up with the difficulties being faced.
#### June’19 –July’19 -
Completed a six weeks internship at a startup, Leena AI in the front end 
Department.
- Created and also edited the webpages for various websites using 
the React App Environment

column27:
Peer Teaching PES University
TEACHER 8 Sep 2017- 27 Oct 2017
#### A voluntary teaching assignment taken up to clarify the doubts of my batch mates on Data Structures.
Prakalpa PES University
VOLUNTEER 10 Feb 2018
#### An intra-college fest coducted every year in PES University among departments.
####  Represented CS department during the fest.
#### Was a part of the team which won first place in “most appreciated stall” award and was the runner up in the “overall award”
####  Was also responsible for queue management on the day of the fest.
column37:
{Project_1:[Project_1_Domain@@Project_1_Summer Projects and Research Activities
Center for Pattern Recognition Machine learning and Image processing (CPRMI) PES University 1 July 2017 - 1 Aug 2017
• Experimentally proved how whitening (a pre-processing method in facial recognition) is not effectively utilized. Also suggested an
alternative, which completely utilizes it.
• A technical paper highlighting the work was presented in SUSCOM 2019 and has been published.
• Link to the published paper - http://ssrn.com/abstract=3356197
]##Project_2:[Project_2_Domain@@Project_2_ PESU Academy PES University
1 June 2018-1 Aug 2018
• Implemented a code for segregating an MCQ question bank subject-wise, subtopic-wise and difficulty-wise for the ease of setting questions for computer based tests (which is the internals held twice every semester in PES University).
• Certificate obtained.
]##Project_3:[Project_3_Domain@@Project_3_ Selected projects as a part of college curriculum File System Introduction to Operating Systems 5th Semester
• Constructed a file system for an OS operating on small memory like Aurdino, older versions of Raspberry Pi etc.
• Basic fuctions of a filesystem such as readdir, mkdir, rmdir, read, write, unlink, chmod and many more were implemented. Persistence
was also implemented.
• File system was made persistent.
• Tested on Ubuntu 16.04. Green Bus Computer Networks 5th Semester
• Implemented client-server model to mimic the famous app red bus.
• Server and client communicate using socket programming in PHP.
• Length-controlled TCP communication implemented.]}
column41:
Shailaja S Sharath, shylaja.sharath@pes.edu
HOD of dept of CSE,
PES University
A. Vinay, a.vinay@pes.edu
Special Officer,
PES University
column43:
{Internship_1:[Internship_1_Company@@Internship_1_Larsen and Toubro Technology Services (LTTS) Bangalore
SOFTWARE ENGINEER 3 June 2019 - 31 Jul 2019
• To implement a chatbot framework for FAQs
• End-to-end memory networks used.
• Word2vec and LSTM used to encode the input sentence.]}
column51:
Television Broadcasting Kalkii TV
7 Dec 2016 - 27 Dec 2016
 #### Learned about all the equipments in the server room and their functioning.
#### Also learned about other aspects of a TV Channel including editing, graphics, photography, HR, event scheduling and finance and
accounting at a macro level.
####  Exposed to the working of recorded and live shows from a studio.
IOT Workshop PES University
24 Jun 2018 - 26 Jun 2018
#### Extra credit course conducted by PES University.
####  Exposed to usage of clouds, sensors and mobile app development using MIT AI2 Companion and their combinations to form useful apps.
Compumusic PES University
26 Jun 2017 - 1 Jul 2017
####  The course was about composing music using coding.
#### Conducted by a visiting faculty of PES University.
#### Later undertook a project under the same visiting faculty as a continuation, to program something which auto-generates a rhythm
based on given parameters.

column21: Cloud computing##Compiler Design##Image Processing##
column37:
{Project_1:[Project_1_Domain@@Project_1_Jun-Jul ’18 Question Paper Builder and Analyser
To determine the domain and subtopics of questions
given to us in multiples of thousand using keyword analysis and guess the most probable option based using
n-grams.Sub-topic wise segregation of assorted subject
question-bank with assessment of their level of trickiness
to build a question paper of a range of di_x001E_culties as required by the examiner.
]##Project_2:[Project_2_Domain@@Project_2_ Jan-May ’19 Simple C Compiler
A simple C compiler capable of compiling a C program
with "for", "if and if-else" and "switch" constructs.This
was done with he help of LEX and YACC tools. The compiler was built in four phases - the lexical analyser phase,
the symbol table generation, the intermediate code generation and the code optimisation using constant folding
and dead code elimination.
]##Project_3:[Project_3_Domain@@Project_3_ Jan-May ’19 SelfieLess Acts on Amazon AWS
Developed a back-end application, implemented container orchestration to perform load balancing, auto balancing and fault tolerance. Implemented REST APIs to
facilitate functionalities such as add user,delete user,add
category etc.Leveraged AWS Load Balancer to perform
load balancing between EC2 instances to serve huge number of HTTP requests.
]##Project_4:[Project_4_Domain@@Project_4_ Aug-Dec ’17 Fantasy Football Website
A football website showing top level English Premier
League Football teams and all their relevant information.
It is a website where a user can login and support a
team of his/her choice. This is done using HTML, CSS,
JavaScript and PHP.]}

column37:
{Project_1:[Project_1_Domain@@Project_1_1. Design and analysis of Medical Grade Network (Advance Computer Network)
Project aimed to analyze Business and Technical Goals of a medium sized hospital and to overcome the
constraints by designing and simulating a Medical Grade Network based on a white paper “Medical Grade
Network Design and Operation” by Chesapeake NetCraftsmen (2011) and “Cisco Medical-Grade Network” by
CISCO. The network designed was simulated on the CISCO Packet Tracer. The network was designed and
implemented for five 9 availability of the complete network, Intrusion Detection system (IDS), firewalls, DMZ,
dynamic routing protocol (OSPF), network management protocol (SNMP) and high scalability was provided by
implementing good hierarchy.
Team Size: 2. Role: Implemented all mentioned Protocols and services on CISCO Packet tracer and partly on
physical hardware (VMs).
a
]##Project_2:[Project_2_Domain@@Project_2_Container Orchestration Tool (Cloud Computing)
Project aimed to develop Container Orchestration Tool for fail safe scalability of web-services. Requirements
included
i) Load-Balancing the API Requests between the available containers.
ii) Handle crashes by spawning a new container depending on the locality and priority of the container.
iii) Scale the containers automatically using requests/sec data and threshold set by the user.
iv) Keep the tool generic to support various container types using configuration files.
Team size: 2. Role: Implemented load -balancing, crash handling, auto scaling, spawning of different VM
dynamically on AWS. Also implemented testing tool for automated Testing.
a
]##Project_3:[Project_3_Domain@@Project_3_QoS of Data Center using Mesos (CCBD)
Project aimed to Improve Quality of Service of a data center by dynamic resource allocation using mesos
Schedulers. DAG variance-based algorithm was developed to calculate inputs for the schedulers. The algorithm
was fine tuned based on the data (system resource usage values) extracted by running stressful workload suites
on the data center. Workload specific, fine-grained resource allocation was achieved.
Team size: 3. Role: Deploying Services on cluster, configuring and deploying the clusters, kernel modifications
to collect data, Running workloads.
a
]##Project_4:[Project_4_Domain@@Project_4_Memory Pre-fetchers using Engram clustering (SAFARI, CMU) (June 19 – till date)
Project aims to optimize Cache utilization in memory intensive applications. Clustering algorithm at the
memory address level was developed to use the correlation of distance between the addresses and the
frequency of their access as parameters to cluster and populate the LRU-Cache in the memory. This model
outperforms the basic LRU implementation in Linux Kernel for workload that are oriented towards statistical
applications.
Team size: 1. Role: Complete implementation, testing, analysis and report generation.  COURSE WORK PROJECTS
]##Project_5:[Project_5_Domain@@Project_5_Cloud computing services like Dockers, AWS, GCP
worked on a project Container and API Based Scalable Social website as a part of Cloud Computing course for
the duration of 16 weeks during which we implemented a cluster of Containers which communicate between
each other and client using secure API’s.
KIRAN HOMBAL 3
]##Project_6:[Project_6_Domain@@Project_6_Cyber Attacks (Computer Network Security)
Performed different types of attacks like
i) Denial of Service: SYN Flood Attack, Amplified DNS Attack, Application level DOS attack.
ii) Man in The Middle: ARP Poisoning, DNS Poisoning, Screen capture, Keylogger, JS injection using MITMF
iii) Password Cracking: using Hashcat and John the Ripper
iv) Intrusion Detection System (IDS): Setup Rules using SNORT, Built Dynamic Access Control Lists.
]##Project_7:[Project_7_Domain@@Project_7_Big data services like Hadoop, Spark, Zookeeper
Did a project named PageRank using Spark and Hadoop as a part of Big Data course for the duration of 16
weeks during which we implemented a cluster of VM where HDFS was the File system, Spark as the
computation service, Zookeeper for maintenance.
]##Project_8:[Project_8_Domain@@Project_8_Load-balancing, Virtual Private Network
Did a project VPN and Load-Balancing using VM’s as a part of Computer Networks course for the duration of
12 weeks during which we implemented a VPN service using Python, C, Nginx and Vagrant. We also
implemented Load-Balancing service using Werkzeug (Flask) and Nginx for master.
]##Project_9:[Project_9_Domain@@Project_9_Selection Sort using x86 Assembly level coding
Did a project to implement Selection Sort using x86 assembly level coding as a part of Digital Design and
Computer Organization course for the duration of 4 weeks during which we implemented Selection Sort using
x86 instruction set.
]##Project_10:[Project_10_Domain@@Project_10_Maze Solving ROBOT – Raspberry Pi
As a part of Microprocessor and Computer Architecture course we built a Robot using Raspberry Pi board and
Rover components which was capable of solving a maze given to it dynamically by the user. UI was built using
HTML, JS, CSS. Algorithm and Bot control using Python and RPi.GPIO library was implemented in 12 weeks.

]##Project_11:[Project_11_Domain@@Project_11_Operating Systems and Compilers
Did a project File System using Hash Tables as part of Operating System course for the duration of 12 weeks
during which we implemented a file system using FUSE and C. We used Hash table for tracking the next Data
Node which made it faster compared to the linked list implementation of the same.
Did a project C# Compiler for all stages of compilation as a part of Compiler Design course for the duration of
16 weeks during which we implemented all stages of the front end of the compiler using LEX, YACC and
python.
]##Project_12:[Project_12_Domain@@Project_12_Machine Learning, Artificial intelligence projects
Did a project to implement AI based Battleship game player as part of Artificial intelligence course for the
duration of 8 weeks. An AI algorithm was designed and implemented to play a Battleship board game with a
success (WIN) rate of 99.98% when played against random algorithm.
As part of Machine Learning course did a 12 weeks project to track Screen Time of an Actor. Each frame of
the video was extracted and was run with the trained machine learning model using TensorFlow, Keras and
CV2. The screen time of the actor was calculated based on the number of frames a particular character was
identified.
Did a project on Word Suggestion and Compression tool as a plug-in to a blogging site as part of Data
Structure course for the duration of 8 weeks during which we implemented word Suggestion in C algorithm
using Trie Data Structure. We also implemented Compression Algorithm in C using Huffman Coding.
KIRAN HOMBAL 4
]##Project_13:[Project_13_Domain@@Project_13_Data Scraping and Recommendation Systems
Did a project Auto News updating and clustering as part of Principles of programming language course for
the duration of 6 weeks during which we scraped the data from different News web-sites and aggregated them
according to a sub-domain using Perl and reorder the domain based on the user interest using python.
Did a project Game Cataloging and Recommendation System as a part of Web Technologies course for the
duration of 8 weeks during which we implemented a Reinforcement Learning based Recommendation system
using Python and PHP which took user data as its input and evolved as the users data base increased.
worked on a project Product review based Recommendation system as a part of CDSAML center for the
duration of 24 weeks during which we implemented a web scrapers using BeautifulSoup4 for review of a
specific type of product on multiple web-sites, build a feature extractor and analyzer using python.]}

column49:

University since 2018.
• Teaching Assistant for Big Data (2019) and Cloud computing (2019) courses.
• Teaching Assistant for Data structures (2018) and Design and Analysis of Algorithm (2018) course.
• Member of ISFCR (Center for Information Security, Forensics and Cyber Resilience) since 2019, FOS
(Free Open Source) since 2018, CDSAML (Center for Data Sciences and Applied Machine Learning)
since 2017.
• Published a paper “IoT Based Road Travel Time Detection” in IEEE’s ICACCI conference (2018).
• 2
nd rank for the state and 11th rank internationally in National Cyber Olympiad (NCO 2016). • CORE member (Technical Head) for AT-18.
• Lead Organizer Ethical Hacking workshop, AT-17, Epsilon2k17, Webbed 2017.
• volunteered for TAS-16.
• Captain of SDMCS soccer team from 2012-2014. Team was runners up in coco-cola cup 2013(under 16) and won
SMC 2014.
• Class Representative (E/C/S IIT class) in ALVA’S for the academic year 2015-2016.

column37:
{Project_1:[Project_1_Domain@@Project_1_1. Image processing
May 2017 - Aug 2017
Worked alongside Professor Mrs. Mamatha H R in the
field of image Processing. The main goal was to publish a
paper in which we highlighted the most efficient of the 3
algorithms namely SIFT, SURF and Multi-scale Template
Matching using OpenCV.
]##Project_2:[Project_2_Domain@@Project_2_IPL (Indian Premier League) Analytics using Big Data
Oct 2018 – Dec 2018
This project was undertaken under the guidance of Mrs.
Prafullata A.K. We implemented many predictive models
and compared the predictive precision and accuracy of
the models while running on traditional ecosystems Vs
Big Data ecosystems. Big Data components used: Spark,
HDFS and HBASE.
]##Project_3:[Project_3_Domain@@Project_3_Full Fledged Movie Website
This project was undertaken as a part of the Web
Technologies Course. The main objective was to design a
end-to-end website which can show all the movies that
the user prefers based on previous usage of the site.
Technologies used: HTML, CSS PHP for server side
scripting, Bootstrap and HTML 5 for improved
accessibility.
]##Project_4:[Project_4_Domain@@Project_4_“LIFE HACKS – An all in one solution for your day to day
Problems”
The goal of this project was to design a comprehensive
and interactive website which can help the user to get
instant access to the information regarding shopping,
hotels, and transport (mainly railways and flights).
Technologies used: DBMS, PostgreSQL, Día (for schema
design) 
]##Project_5:[Project_5_Domain@@Project_5_Movie Recommendation system using your Twitter
Account Data (Data model Building)
The primary aim to build this recommendation system
was to use the users twitter data such as Actors and
Celebrities followed by the users, recent activity such as
likes on a specific actor etc, to get a general idea of the
users likes and preferences. This data would later be
the bases of our recommendation engine.
Concepts and Technologies used: Twitter API , web
scraping using python, Knowledge based
recommendation systems, K-means , elbow curves etc.
]##Project_6:[Project_6_Domain@@Project_6_“SelfLessActs” (Cloud Computing)
This website was created as a cloud computing project
to showcase the good deeds done by people around
you. Initially it was developed by creating API’s
following the REST Programming style. The Second part
aimed at converting it from monolithic to Microservice
Architecture to facilitate more users and better code
editability. This was done using dockers to create
containers with different subsections of the code base.
Concepts and technologies used – REST Programming
style , Microservices, Service oriented architecture,
Load balancing and mongoDB. ]}
column43:
{Internship_1:[Internship_1_Company@@Internship_1_1. Data Analytics,
Ordell Ugo (Bangalore) Jun 1st 2017 - Sep 1st 2017
Worked with Prof. Nithin Pujari (HOD of PG department
at PES University) to analyze (Using Data Science) several
databases to arrive at substantial conclusions about the
Academic performance of the students of various
semesters.
]##Internship_2:[Internship_2_Company@@Internship_2_Financial Analyst and Content Developer,
Groww (Bangalore) June 1st 2018 – August 1st 2018
Worked as an intern analyst. Main tasks included
analysis of stocks and mutual fund data, creating
response models to predict possible outcomes,
generating reports using R/python. Also, developed
python code to perform mass analysis on support emails
in order to understand general issues/problems related
to beta releases of the app.
 
]##Internship_3:[Internship_3_Company@@Internship_3_CENTER FOR INFORMATION SECURITY, FORENSICS AND
CYBER RESILIENCE(ISFCR) at PES UNIVERSITY
(June 1st 2019 – August 1st 2019)
]##Internship_4:[Internship_4_Company@@Internship_4_Machine Learning Techniques in Modern Cybersecurity
Practices
My team and I worked to develop and implement certain
effective and powerful Machine learning algorithms such
as Decisions trees, Support Vector Machines, K-means
and Naïve Bayes classifiers Models were used to classify
and differentiate between Benign and malicious data
packets. These data models were primarily applied on
packet filtering systems such as Intrusion detection
systems (IDS’s). ]}
column51:
TRAININGS Analytics
Ordell Ugo (Bangalore)
Jun 2017 - Sep 2017
With the help of Data science, Data mining and Data
warehousing techniques, learnt how to analyze large
databases to conclude meaningful results. Also worked 
on a project that converts PDF's to text files, from which
a user can scrutinize the text easily.
JED-I (joy Of Engineering and Design)
PESU (Bangalore)
Jan 2016 - Apr 2017
Using Arduino to make automated robots that would
detect a fruit, and then determine if it is ripe or not. If
the fruit was ripe, the robot would extend its mechanical
arm and pluck the fruit.

column37:
{Project_1:[Project_1_Domain@@Project_1_HealthCare Analytics | CCBD(Cloud Computing and Big Data)
Research and Analysis about the Elephantiasis disease. Using various Data analytics
techniques, a model was created which could give suggestions to various patients
about what kind of treatment and how many days should they be practicing given their
medical and physical conditions with an accuracy rate of over 86%.Over 100 variables
were considered with over 20,000 data entries.Many Decision Trees were created to
help the model.
Project Under : Dr K.V. S ]##Project_2:[Project_2_Domain@@Project_2_ A Website about Games,Movies with Mini -Recommendation System|
Web Technology Project
A website was hosted on the local machine which basically had a catalogue of games
and movies and some related information about it. All the users had to create an
account and then choose some games and movies that they like and we provide similar
recommendations to them based on the user data available to us of others which are
similar to current users.]##Project_3:[Project_3_Domain@@Project_3_  Mirai Botnet and Network Traffic Analysis| CCBD
Currently working and analysing the working of mirai botnet which is used for DDoS
attack and determining the attacks and network traffic generated by the mirai botnet.]##Project_4:[Project_4_Domain@@Project_4_ Mini-Compiler for C language | Compiler Design Project
A Mini compiler for C language was created which had all basic stages like analysis
part which checks for syntax of the code and Intermediate Code generation (TAC)
code, optimisation of code and finally generating the assembly code with machine
dependent optimisation. This was done for if , while and for loop constructs of the C
language along with basic data definition and declaration. ]##Project_5:[Project_5_Domain@@Project_5_ Micro-services using REST API,Containers and Dockers
Using Dockers,Containers and REST api’s a page called selfieless acts was created
which was like Facebook where users could post their good deeds and others could
comment on it and like the post as well. Mongodb was used as the database and flask
was used to run the script on the backend.All the work was done on amazon EC2
instances which is cloud computing.
]##Project_6:[Project_6_Domain@@Project_6_ Load Balancer and Reverse Proxy using Nginx | CN Project
A load balancer and a reverse proxy was created in a small scale using nginx(software
load balancer) in a round robin method and reverse proxy was also implemented along
with it.]}
column55:

• Active Member of Centre for Pattern Recognition and Machine Intelligence
• Avid open source contributor via GitHub etc.
• Active Member of Game Development Club.
• Knowledge in Developing Android Applications and Games.
• Participated in various Coding Contests like ACM - ICPC and on Hackerrank.
• Aquaregia state level quiz competitor.

column37:
{Project_1:[Project_1_Domain@@Project_1_QEats Restaurant backend development-Crio
Build a demoable distributed, high availability Java backend for a mock food ordering app. The frontend sends an api request and RestController takes care of mapping request data to the defined request handler method.we have business Logic layer where logic of services are written.we have Data access layer which has repository services and entities for restaurant,menu and order are defined. we are using mongodb as our database storage and have used cache for implementation getrestaurantsnearBy.Have using multithreading to make
search queries request handling faster.Deployed the entire backend on aws ec2 instance in docker container.
libraries and tools used:JUnit, Jackson, Gradle, Spring Boot, Mockito, Postman, cURL, Java Annotations, Java Interfaces, HTTP Error Codes, Lombok, ODM, SpringData, Mongodb, Dependency Injection, Asserts, Redis, JMETER, MongoDb querying, Threading, Docker SelfiLessActs-Fully Orchestrated and Containerized Online Photo Sharing App
It is an Online photo sharing app, that is containerized and orchestrated automatically. There are two instances of AWS hosting two different parts of the app, users and acts. An orchestrator running in acts
instance automatically does load balancing, fault tolerance,auto-scaling of the containers running in the same instance. The backend of the application is built using Flask, a web framework for python.
]##Project_2:[Project_2_Domain@@Project_2_ Big Data
Match Simulation Using Decision Tree and Probability.
our goal to simulate the ipl matches and check with original results how accurate our model is with both traditional and big data approach and compare the results.Show which approach is good.
− 1)Using Probability
Simulating a match ball by ball using Probability Statistics
K-Means clustering is applied to batsmen statistics .10 Clusters for batsmen were created to resemble 10
batting positions .5 Clusters for bowlers were created .From the player vs player statistics a probability
list of possible runs is created .Cumulative frequency is computed for the probability list and a run is
obtained by checking the interval that a random number generated between 0 and 1 falls into .Each
batsman is given a certain confidence score between 0 and 100 .The confidence score of a batsman
implies the probability of him not getting out . The confidence score of a bowler implies the probability of
him bowling a wicket taking ball .
− 2)Using Decision Tree
Simulating a match over by over with the help of Decision Tree
Used pyspark.ml.classification to import the DecisionTreeClassifier.
We convert the data to SPARK DataFrames and then train the DecisionTreeClassifier by fitting the data
consisting of 2016 IPL over by over statistics.
- For the predictions we pass the Batting Lineup,Bowling Order and the corresponding values of the features specified above.
- We are predicting the scores over by over.
- Our predictions return (RUNS,WICKETS) in that OVER.
]##Project_3:[Project_3_Domain@@Project_3_ Project , Club — CORI in association with ISRO
Crime Analysis By Mapping
The project focused on building an open platform for citizens to know of the crimes in their city so that
they could take precautions during travel or stay . It involved a map based database for easy visualization
and analyzing newspaper articles to determine locations of crime .]}

column37:
{Project_1:[Project_1_Domain@@Project_1_◆ QRIDE
Created a REST-API based scalable, high-available back-end for a Cab Application. Created in Java
using Spring Boot framework, hibernate and a redis cache.
]##Project_2:[Project_2_Domain@@Project_2_ Collab-IDE
This project helps developers working on the same project, by providing them with a chatroom and an
online IDE along with version control, where other developers can see the work of their team mates in
real time.
Find a running instance of the project here : http://lambsteaklab.pythonanywhere.com
]##Project_3:[Project_3_Domain@@Project_3_ Yet-another-file-system
Completed as a part of the operating system course, created and implemented new file system, which was
mounted using FUSE. Created a custom inode structure and used that to store the files in a tree like directory
structure.
]##Project_4:[Project_4_Domain@@Project_4_ Highlight
A full fledged web interface for a AI based summarizer, which could take input in the form of a
image, pdf or a voice recording, convert it to text and extract the relevant details to summarize the text. It
used a flask back end with NLTK for summarization and OpenCV and tesseract for converting image to
text.
]##Project_5:[Project_5_Domain@@Project_5_ Gold-price prediction
Collected data from the world gold council and also by scraping the web, and performed time series analysis
to predict the gold prices in the next week and also find any trends in the prices.]}
column43:
{Internship_1:[Internship_1_Company@@Internship_1_Intern :Akamai Technnologies June 2019 - July 2019
Worked on an Enterprise Security product. Worked mainly on REST APIs and unittests. Used django with
tastypie for REST APIs and celery with RabbitMQ for async tasks. Used pytest for writing django unittests.
Research ]##Internship_2:[Internship_2_Company@@Internship_2_ Intern : Centre of Cloud Computing and Big Data, PES University August 2018- Dec 2018
Currently working on Cloud Computing and Big Data project for smart auto scaling of hybrid cloud servers.
The servers run openstack, which is programmed to scale up or down based on the utilization of its resources.
]##Internship_3:[Internship_3_Company@@Internship_3_ Peer Teaching : Data Structures, PES University August 2018 – Dec 2018
Engaging 2 nd Year students of computer science for lectures in Data Structures throughout the semester.
Covering topics such as Linked Lists, Graphs, Binary Trees, B Trees, Stacks, Queues etc in the class.
Summer ]##Internship_4:[Internship_4_Company@@Internship_4_ Intern : Getmeroof.com April 2018 - June 2018
Worked on Full Stack Web Development for the website http://getmeroof.com/ . This real estate startup
focuses on a personalized home buying experience for its users. The front end used Angular 5, while the
REST back end APIs were built on Ruby on Rails with MongoDB as the database.
Summer ]##Internship_5:[Internship_5_Company@@Internship_5_ Intern : Crucible of Research and Innovation, PES University May 2017-August 2017
Worked on Android and Desktop Application development for a thin film controller. The application could
establish bidirectional communication between the HC-05 slave module connected to the Arduino, using
Bluetooth.]}

column37:
{Project_1:[Project_1_Domain@@Project_1_◆ QRIDE
Created a REST-API based scalable, high-available back-end for a Cab Application. Created in Java
using Spring Boot framework, hibernate and a redis cache.
]##Project_2:[Project_2_Domain@@Project_2_ Collab-IDE
This project helps developers working on the same project, by providing them with a chatroom and an
online IDE along with version control, where other developers can see the work of their team mates in
real time.
Find a running instance of the project here : http://lambsteaklab.pythonanywhere.com
]##Project_3:[Project_3_Domain@@Project_3_ Yet-another-file-system
Completed as a part of the operating system course, created and implemented new file system, which was
mounted using FUSE. Created a custom inode structure and used that to store the files in a tree like directory
structure.
]##Project_4:[Project_4_Domain@@Project_4_ Highlight
A full fledged web interface for a AI based summarizer, which could take input in the form of a
image, pdf or a voice recording, convert it to text and extract the relevant details to summarize the text. It
used a flask back end with NLTK for summarization and OpenCV and tesseract for converting image to
text.
]##Project_5:[Project_5_Domain@@Project_5_ Gold-price prediction
Collected data from the world gold council and also by scraping the web, and performed time series analysis
to predict the gold prices in the next week and also find any trends in the prices.]}
column43:
{Internship_1:[Internship_1_Company@@Internship_1_Intern :Akamai Technnologies June 2019 - July 2019
Worked on an Enterprise Security product. Worked mainly on REST APIs and unittests. Used django with
tastypie for REST APIs and celery with RabbitMQ for async tasks. Used pytest for writing django unittests.
Research ]##Internship_2:[Internship_2_Company@@Internship_2_ Intern : Centre of Cloud Computing and Big Data, PES University August 2018- Dec 2018
Currently working on Cloud Computing and Big Data project for smart auto scaling of hybrid cloud servers.
The servers run openstack, which is programmed to scale up or down based on the utilization of its resources.
]##Internship_3:[Internship_3_Company@@Internship_3_ Peer Teaching : Data Structures, PES University August 2018 – Dec 2018
Engaging 2 nd Year students of computer science for lectures in Data Structures throughout the semester.
Covering topics such as Linked Lists, Graphs, Binary Trees, B Trees, Stacks, Queues etc in the class.
Summer ]##Internship_4:[Internship_4_Company@@Internship_4_ Intern : Getmeroof.com April 2018 - June 2018
Worked on Full Stack Web Development for the website http://getmeroof.com/ . This real estate startup
focuses on a personalized home buying experience for its users. The front end used Angular 5, while the
REST back end APIs were built on Ruby on Rails with MongoDB as the database.
Summer ]##Internship_5:[Internship_5_Company@@Internship_5_ Intern : Crucible of Research and Innovation, PES University May 2017-August 2017
Worked on Android and Desktop Application development for a thin film controller. The application could
establish bidirectional communication between the HC-05 slave module connected to the Arduino, using
Bluetooth.]}
