column37:
{Project_1:[Project_1_Domain@@Project_1_  Cloud Computing Jan 2019 - May 2019
  Developed backend application, implemented container orchestration to perform load balancing, auto scaling and fault tolarence
  Implemented REST API on backend application to facilitate the functionalities such as upload, upvote, create, delete etc.
  Leveraged AWS Elastic Load Balancer to perform load balancing between the EC2 instances to serve HTTP requests.
  Tools/Software: PYTHON, JSON, HTML, Flask, AWS.
  ]##Project_2:[Project_2_Domain@@Project_2_ Game development: Ping pong ball Aug 2018 - Dec 2018
  Designed and developed a basic Ping pong game using client-server architecture.
  Responsible for network con guration and IP address management to implement the game.
  Implemented the game using pygame(python library for multimedia experience), socket.io (for event based communication), Pickle
(for serializing and deserializing Python object structure).
  ]##Project_3:[Project_3_Domain@@Project_3_ STEMMING June 2018 - Aug 2018
  Collected data set (Emille Corpus) for the regional language (Kannada) using several approaches Ex: n-gram.
  Implemented algorithms: dataset, normal method and n-gram to  nd the stem(most repetitive word) in the given set of words.
  Tools Used: Python.
  ]##Project_4:[Project_4_Domain@@Project_4_ Blood Bank Management System Jan 2018 - May 2018
  Designed a database of hospitals in 5 di erent districts for the management of blood bank.
  Implemented an algorithm for management of blood unit count and billing based on the type of patient.
  Implemented a registration portal to access user account for patients
  Tools Used: Frontend - HTML , JavaScript , Flask (Python) Backend - sqlite3 (Python)
  ]##Project_5:[Project_5_Domain@@Project_5_ Collision Control Robot Aug 2017 - Dec 2017
  Objective: Design and development of the collision control robot based on arduino.
  Implemented an algorithm which changes the direction of robot based on the input from IR sensor (to sense obstruction).
  Tools used: Arduino, H-bridge, IR sensor
  ]##Project_6:[Project_6_Domain@@Project_6_ Web Development Aug 2017 - Dec 2017
  Objective: Design and develop a website which would serve users about sports news and information.
  Implemented user access control by requiring user id and password to access information.
  Tools Used: php (backend), html (frontend).]}

column37:
{Project_1:[Project_1_Domain@@Project_1_Words to Phonetic Transcription
(Feb 2019- May 2019)
Most continuous-speech recognition and generation systems are based on
phonemes and thus need phonetic transcription for words. Therefore, we
are in need of an automatic system that generates these transcriptions
from written words. Our project is to feature an approach to do machine
translation of words to phonetics, in standard
ARPAbet format. We used an RNN based LSTM model to accomplish this
task and tried improvising by adding different means of word embedding
and attention layer etc.
]##Project_2:[Project_2_Domain@@Project_2_ Auto Grader for short answers (Feb 2019- May 2019)
Short-answer questions can target learning goals more effectively than
multiple choice as they eliminate test-taking shortcuts like eliminating
improbable answers. We start in this project by tackling the simplest
problem where we attempt to make a machine learning based system
which would automatically grade one-line answers based on the given
reference answers.
Mini Compiler (Feb 2019- May 2019)
As a part of this project we have developed a mini compiler that takes
input as a C program and gives an optimised intermediate code as
output.
ResumeRise (Aug 2018- Nov 2018)
An NLP based tool running an SVM classifier and a summarization
algorithm that classifies any pdf Resume into one out of 25 different Job
Categories. It also provides a summary for the document based on Lexical
Scores given via frequency count. This tool is of great use in the industry
with thousands of resumes to be parsed.
]##Project_3:[Project_3_Domain@@Project_3_ Kennel (Automated Pet Feeder)
(Feb 2018- April 2018)
This project was intended to automate the feeding process of our pets.
Hence it is a smart automated pet feeder using Arduino Uno. The key
components of the model include RTC module to track time, distance
server to monitor food level, light sensor to distinguish day/night and an
RFID to identify our pets.
Cloud Sim Extensions
(Jun 2018- present)
This project is a part of our research internship in Cloud Computing and
Big Data, PES University. Cloud Sim is well-known framework and
simulation tool for cloud environment. Testing was limited to very few
granular elements from the real-life data centers. It supported only Data
centers servers and applications. The extended version of the simulation
model written in Java is a framework that supports a clear configurable
file to test various granular level. There has also been an inclusion made
to the Vm allocation policy keeping in mind the copies of an application
and failure zones if any.
The Store (Sept 2017- Nov 2017)
The project was an ecommerce website for online cloth shopping. It was a
part of our minor project for the Web Technologies course. Though our
main aim was to concentrate on the front end we ended up doing back
end as well for which we used phpMyAdmin. We included features like
cart, mu bag, login, signup etc.]}

column37:
{Project_1:[Project_1_Domain@@Project_1_1. Object Locator Robot: A robot that can find and reach an object of a particular shape in a
given environment.
Responsibilities - Designed the layout of components on the robot’s chassis, wrote code for
the object detection module and helped assemble all the physical components and make the
circuit connections.
Technology Used - Arduino Uno microcontroller, Open CV for object detection.
]##Project_2:[Project_2_Domain@@Project_2_Android Application to generate live graphs: An app that would take data transmitted from
the sensor in an Arduino via Bluetooth and generate a live graph for the sensor data.
Responsibilities - Designed and developed the entire application.
Technology Used - Arduino Uno microcontroller with the HC-05 Bluetooth module, Android
framework to make the app.
]##Project_3:[Project_3_Domain@@Project_3_Quiz Website - A simple trivia website with around 1500 questions on various topics.
Responsibilities - Designed the front-end and the back-end and implemented some parts of
the front-end. Developed the entire backend.
Technology Used - HTML, CSS and Vanilla Javascript for the front-end, PHP for the
backend.
]##Project_4:[Project_4_Domain@@Project_4_Dictionary - Built an efficient dictionary using the TRIE data structure as a part of the data
structures course. The dictionary was highly efficient once the TRIE was generated, it
contained nearly 200,000 words and the search queries were as fast as 0.03s. The dictionary
also showed synonyms and words which could be related to the given word.
Responsibilities - Developed parts of the TRIE and made the front-end for the application.
Technology Used - Python for the backend and Flask along with Jinja for the front-end.
]##Project_5:[Project_5_Domain@@Project_5_Stock Market Website - Built a small application to keep track of the stock market to explore
the various concepts of the operation of database systems.
Responsibilities - Designed and implemented the entire front-end. Setup the environment for
the development of the backend and developed parts of the backend.
Technology Used - HTML, CSS, Javascript, and Bootstrap for the front-end. Python for the
backend and PostgreSQL as the database system.
]##Project_6:[Project_6_Domain@@Project_6_Implementing Secret Sharing Algorithms - Blakley Secret Sharing Scheme and Peterson’s
technique for key distribution.
Responsibilities - Doing a literature survey to find the appropriate secret sharing techniques
and writing a report in the IEEE format to explain the implementation.
Technology Used - Java and Python to write the implementation.
]##Project_7:[Project_7_Domain@@Project_7_Basic Unix/Linux file system - Built a basic file system using as part of the operating systems
course. The file system was persistent because of object serialization and could recreate the
original file structure with the inodes and blocks.
Responsibilities - Implementation of the read, write and create folders operation, read file
operation and part of the serialization implementation.
Technology Used - FUSE library in C to complete the implementation.
]##Project_8:[Project_8_Domain@@Project_8_Basic Java Compiler - Built a basic Java Compiler which would evaluate basic expressions,
find syntax errors in programs.
Responsibilities - Made the Lexer and Tokenizer along with the expression-tree generator.
Technology Used - PLY(Python Lex and Yacc).
]##Project_9:[Project_9_Domain@@Project_9_Basic Load Balancer - Built a basic load balancer that would redirect traffic and could provide
proxy data servers in case of a server outage. The database servers were on Docker
Containers hosted on AWS EC2 instances, the load balancer was on a separate container and
also acted like a DNS server to match API calls sent by the front-end. The load balancer
would spawn new servers to scale-up and remove spurious instances when the traffic on the
system was less. The load balancer would also create back-up instances in case of a crash.
Responsibilities - Make the fault tolerance part and redirecting of requests module along with
testing of the Load Balancer for various use cases.
Technology Used - Python(Flask) for the backend and Docker for containerization. With the
containers present on Amazon EC2 instances.]}
column43:
{Internship_1:[Internship_1_Company@@Internship_1_1. Summer Intern (June - July 2018) at Infivention Technologies Pvt Ltd. (Android Developer,
Data Analyst, Web Developer).
Worked on multiple Android applications -
● SquareOff - App that interfaces with the SquareOff chessboard, to allow users to play
chess with people across the globe. I developed the screen which allowed the users to
select the difficulty level when playing against the engine.
● FollowChess - App that is used to follow the various international chess games
happening live or view results of old games. I developed the interface for selecting and
viewing the various chess moves during the game.
● FollowChess Admin - An internal app to monitor the user interactions and view the bugs
reported by the users on the forum. I built the feature which would allow the admin to
add new tournaments and change tournament status, view and reply to bug reports.
I was responsible for some code flows that were used to create a redundant data store to
overcome the limitations on the number of concurrent API calls in Google’s BigQuery service.
I set up a MySQL server on Google’s Compute Engine and then wrote a Java servlet to send data
to the company’s Google Datastore, BigQuery Database and the remote server so that the data
could be accessed quicker. The servlet was hosted on Google App Engine.
Made the backend using Flask(Python library) for the Analytics Dashboard used by the company
to present user and company stats to the shareholders and organization officials.
]##Internship_2:[Internship_2_Company@@Internship_2_Summer Intern(June - July 2019) at Lam Research India Pvt Ltd. (Front-End Developer)
I was responsible for user interface implementation and a few backend components of an
internal bug reporting system, using Angular.
I also developed a utility to automate the generation of PowerPoint presentations. The utility
was based on .NET Web API and the data in an API call, the presentations were generated using
the PowerPoint Interop library in C#.]}

column37:
{Project_1:[Project_1_Domain@@Project_1_1. SelfieLess App — A cloud based web app to
upload acts.
SelfieLess App was a cloud based web app to upload
photos of selfless acts like helping someone, cleaning
surroundings etc. REST Apis, Amazon AWS, Flask,
Sqlite, orchestrator are some of the technologies
associated with the app. The frontend was designed
using HTML, JAvascript and AJAX while the backend and
the orchestrator was developed using Flask module of
python.
]##Project_2:[Project_2_Domain@@Project_2_IPL Score Prediction — A Big Data project to
predict IPL Scores
This project aims to predict the outcome of IPL matches
by using the concept of Probability and Machine
Learning. It uses Big Data technologies like MapReduce,
Spark MLLib and clustering using Scala.
The overall efficiency of the project was pretty high. It
predicted 8/10 results. ]##Project_3:[Project_3_Domain@@Project_3_Restaurant recommendation system— A Data
Analytics project
Recommend restaurants to users based on attributes like
similarity, location etc. The data was collected from
Kaggle. It was then filtered and visualised. This included
bar graphs based on location, ratings etc. The data was
then given to different ML algorithms like decision tree,
linear regression etc. and a list of restaurant was
predicted for a user. If new user was encountered, the
recommendations included favourites of people around
that location.
]##Project_4:[Project_4_Domain@@Project_4_Employee Management App-An Android App
Built an android app to record and store employee’s
details, attendance and finances like advances. The
payroll is generated at the end of the month based on
the number of days and the advance. The app was
built using simple Java modules and DB on firebase.]}

{Internship_1:[Internship_1_Company@@Internship_1_1. IBM India Pvt. Ltd. — GTS Labs Intern
• Created an automated solution for the end-to-end deployment of a High
Availability (HA) Red Hat OpenShift Origin (OKD) cluster on IBM Cloud using Red
Hat Ansible.
• Created a YAML Ansible playbook that configured networking (including DNS),
installed packages and configured storage (including storage for Docker and
ETCD).
• Created an Ansible inventory file that provides the necessary cluster
specifications consumed by the Ansible playbooks.
• Created a workflow on Ansible Tower that can install a High Availability OpenShift
Origin cluster on clean RHEL hosts. ]}

column43:
{Internship_1:[Internship_1_Company@@Internship_1_1. PES Center for Pattern Recognition, PES University- Research Intern
JUL 2019 - PRESENT
● Working on application of deep reinforcement learning algorithms to
generate small molecules 1D enumerations active against known
protein targets.
]##Internship_2:[Internship_2_Company@@Internship_2_Morgan Stanley, Bengaluru- Program Intern, Summer Analyst
MAY 2019 - JULY 2019
● Worked on a project that involved full stack development for option
attribution procedure. Angular 7 is used for front end, python-based
web framework Flask for backend and DB2 database interaction.
]##Internship_3:[Internship_3_Company@@Internship_3_PESU I/O, PES University- Subject Matter Expert, Introduction to
Machine Learning
FEB 2019 - APRIL 2019
● Mentored and guided students for the “Introduction to Machine
Learning” course. Tasks included setting course structure, recording
weekly tutorial videos and preparing reference material, assigning
projects and assignments to students and evaluating the same.
]##Internship_4:[Internship_4_Company@@Internship_4_iBall Research Labs, Bengaluru- Data Analytics Summer Intern
JUN 2018 - AUG 2018
● Developed new, appropriate clustering algorithm to cluster similar time
series pattern for motif discovery. Data received from IoT sensors in
real time. Deployment done on AWS EC2 instance.
● Basic forecasting of time series patterns with AR, MA, ARIMA models
and LSTM RNNs.
]##Internship_5:[Internship_5_Company@@Internship_5_Center for Data Science and Machine Learning, PES UniversitySummer Research Intern
JUN 2017 - AUG 2017
● Worked on the problem of Human Pose Estimation, using deep CNNs,
following stacked hourglass architecture.]}

column37:
{Project_1:[Project_1_Domain@@Project_1_Online Shopping ( Web Development )
This project was done in a group of three members.
We used HTML to create the web page .
We used CSS to design the layout of the web page.
We used JavaScript to add special effects to our project and make it
dynamic.
We used PHP to access the Customer details from the database and
authenticate.
]##Project_2:[Project_2_Domain@@Project_2_ Individual's Data Storage ( Database Management
System )
Created an individual's data storage in a group of four members.
We can access all the details of an individual by typing his/her
name, which is stored in the database.
]##Project_3:[Project_3_Domain@@Project_3_ Handwritten Text Recognition ( Machine Learning )
This project was done in a group of four members.
We stored pictures of various texts in the database .
We used CNN algorithms to test and train the database.
]##Project_4:[Project_4_Domain@@Project_4_ File System Implementation
Implementation of a filesystem in a group of four members.
Implementation of system calls for file operations were done that
could be issued by Linux using FUSE.
Abstraction of filesystem.
Making the filesystem persistent.]}

For the Front End Development HTML And  Css was used for the static web pages.
For Dynamic Web pages Javascript was used.
For BackEnd development PHP was used to connect to the server.
]##Project_2:[Project_2_Domain@@Project_2_DBMS

Description:
Languages Used:  Postgresql   language for the interaction with the database .
Dataset was created manually and was stored in mysql database.
For the frontend Development Html and CSS and Javascript was used.
For the backend php was used.
]##Project_3:[Project_3_Domain@@Project_3_C Project 
 Quiz game in C Language .
Description:
Pointers in C and switch statements,for statements ,while loops were used. 

]##Project_4:[Project_4_Domain@@Project_4_MACHINE LEARNING PROJECT
Credit card fraud detection 
DESCRIPTION:
Dataset Description : Downloaded  Dataset from kagile.
Different ML Classification  techniques such as SVM Decision Tress and ANN algorithms applied.
To  detect whether a fraudulent transcation as occurred  or not time was used as the classification Parameter where the time interval between two transaction was considered. ]}

column37:
{Project_1:[Project_1_Domain@@Project_1_Natural Language Processing
Sentiment Analysis of Twitter Data Classification of twitter data into positive, negative and neutral.
Preprocessed the tweet data and encoded the categorical labelled data.
Comparative study on classifiers - XGBoost, Logistic Regression, Random Forest Classifier and Naive Bayes.
Recognition rate: 84.9% with the ensemble model XGBoost-Logistic Regression. ]##Project_2:[Project_2_Domain@@Project_2_ Machine Learning
Clustering documents using K-means Clustering of documents with an accuracy of 86.77% which requires no meta data of the input text documents.
Several independent features like TF-IDF, Word2Vec were used to make the system more generic.
K-means and Agglomerative clustering methods are used to cluster the documents. ]##Project_3:[Project_3_Domain@@Project_3_ Cloud Computing
SelfieLessActs on Amazon AWS SelfieLessActs is a web application deployed on cloud for sharing photos.
The app is containerized and orchestrated automatically which can perform load balancing, fault tolerance
and auto-scaling.
The backend is built using flask. ]##Project_4:[Project_4_Domain@@Project_4_ Data Structures C program Music Player Built a simple music player with features like play, next, stop, shuffle, previous track and create playlist.
Data Structures concepts used LinkedList, Queue and Arrays.]##Project_5:[Project_5_Domain@@Project_5_ DBMS
Online Restaurant Management, Online Restaurant management system using MySQL.
A full fledged website with front end and back end.
User Interface done using HTML, CSS and JavaScript.]}

column37:
{Project_1:[Project_1_Domain@@Project_1_1.SelfieLessActs
+ Micro-service model of photo sharing web application hosted on AWS cloud platform.
+ Built using Flask frame work and SQlite3 database system, linux dockers.
+ Load Balancing, Auto Scaling and Fault tolerance features are implemented to make the application flexible.
]##Project_2:[Project_2_Domain@@Project_2_Document Classification
+ A document classifier using unsupervised learning was built with an accuracy of 86.77% which requires no meta
data about the input text documents.
+ Several Domain independent features like tf-idf, word2vec were used to make the system more generic.
+ K-means clustering method was used to classify the documents.
]##Project_3:[Project_3_Domain@@Project_3_IPL Match Simulation
+ Simulation of IPL matches using 6 years of data. Prediction of score using Decision trees, This data was put in
HDFS.
]##Project_4:[Project_4_Domain@@Project_4_Saastha Educare
+ Developed a responsive educational website for an institute. The site gives necessary details of institute, facilities
provided, course info, different branches located, admission process, etc.
+ The technologies includes HTML5, CSS3, Javascript, PHP, and Bootstrap framework.
1/2
]##Project_5:[Project_5_Domain@@Project_5_ID Management System
+ Designed a database system to store Identity details of an individual. A nice Web-interfaced UI have been designed
along with backend running on local apache server.
+ It’s developed using PHP-MySql Database, and frontend includes HTML, CSS3.
]##Project_6:[Project_6_Domain@@Project_6_Knowledge Management Portal
+ Built a KM portal for the automotive entertainment industry, its monolithic web app.
+ Used Disqus plugin in the portal for writing reviews on the product, liking reviews and commenting it.]}

column37:
{Project_1:[Project_1_Domain@@Project_1_{ Neural Machine Translation for Dravidian languages: (Summer Research project) (May
2018- present)
Guide: Dr. Santwana Chimalamarri, Cloud Computing and Big Data center,PES University
  Literature survey shows that passing di erent levels of the parsed output of the corpus to
the multi layered recurrent neural network (using LSTM and attention mechanism) can give a
considerable raise in bleu score. Sequence to Sequence model has been built. Currently working
on Multi encoder model (to account for the rich morphology of the languages) ]##Project_2:[Project_2_Domain@@Project_2_
{ Cloud based web application
  A web application using 
ask for back end was built on Amazon EC2 instance.Implemented
micro services using REST interfaces on separate docker containers. Along with this, Container
orchestration(Load balancing, fault tolerance and auto-scaling) was also implemented. ]##Project_3:[Project_3_Domain@@Project_3_
{ A product recommendation system using Market Basket Analysis
  The system has been trained to personalize the recommendation for which customer segmenta-
tion has been used and has been done using k-means clustering and TF-IDF. Once the customer
clusters were formed, we used the market basket analysis rules to recommend the product to
the customer. ]##Project_4:[Project_4_Domain@@Project_4_
{ Developed a music library using di erent data structures
  A music library which was built to understand data structures better and the audio environment
built using VLC API and also created an own function for remix. ]##Project_5:[Project_5_Domain@@Project_5_
{ A Database management project for restaurant booking
  The project was carried on with postgreSQL along with a front-end and integrated with PHP.
It involved the stages of ER diagram and DB queries.]}
column43:
{Internship_1:[Internship_1_Company@@Internship_1_{ Data science Internship at Lam Research, (Summer Internship) (June 2019- August-2019)
  The goal of the project is to identify the redundant test cases from their testing platform TRACK
and a way to e ciently remove them.It also involves categorizing the test case hierarchy and
making buckets of the containers. Since there is no labelled data, clustering methods have been
used. ]##Internship_2:[Internship_2_Company@@Internship_2_
{ Interfacing and calibrating IMU sensor with SPI protocol, (Summer Research Internship)
(May 2017- August 2017)
Guide: Dr. Divya Rao,Assistant professor, Crucible of Research and Innovation,PES University
1
  The inertial Measurement unit sensor is interfaced with the onboard computer (for the satellite)
using the SPI communication.It was a 10 degrees inertial measurement sensor and was integrated
with Atmega micro-controller and was a single master-multi slave system.]}

{Project_1:[Project_1_Domain@@Project_1_1. Placement Coordination System
∗ Skills: Software Engineering, Software Development, Django, Machine Learning, Team
coordination, Data Analytics
∗ Project Link: https://github.com/NinaadRao/Pisces
∗ Description: Managing the Placement System at PES University by maintaining a
schedule system for companies, keeping track of students, Blog service, displaying placement statistics and analytics and a quiz platform. Coordinated a team of 10 members.
]##Project_2:[Project_2_Domain@@Project_2_Multi Label Image Classification of Cloud Images using Contractive Auto Encoder
∗ Skills: Deep Learning, Image Processing, Contractive Auto Encoder, Tensorflow
∗ Project Link: https://github.com/NinaadRao/Multilabel-Image-Classification-usingContractive-Autoencoder
∗ Description: Finding if a particular class of image is present by using the encoding
extracted from a contractive auto encoder. There were 4 classes and the accuracy
achieved was 62%.
]##Project_3:[Project_3_Domain@@Project_3_Low Light Object Detection for driving scenarios
∗ Skills: Image Processing, GAN, Image Filters
∗ Project:Created a GAN model for night to day image conversion to get better detection
of objects and experimented with different image filters. Stood in the top 12 from over
70 submissions.
]##Project_4:[Project_4_Domain@@Project_4_Deciding Bengaluru’s Favourite Car Color
∗ Skills: Image Processing, Deep Learning
∗ Project Link: https://github.com/NinaadRao/Bengaluru-Favourite-Car-Color
]##Project_5:[Project_5_Domain@@Project_5_Predicting the position of a star in a given star cluster and getting useful insights

{Internship_1:[Internship_1_Company@@Internship_1_1. Data Analytics Teaching Assistant , (June 2019 - Present)
Organisation: PES University, Bengaluru
Projects:
∗ Designed and evaluated programming assignments in R and Python and quizzes for 71
students of the Junior year for the Data Analytics course taught by Dr. Gowri Srinivasa
at PES University.
]##Internship_2:[Internship_2_Company@@Internship_2_Data Science Intern , (June 2019 - July 2019)
Organisation: redBus India
Projects:
∗ Developed a real time dashboard for business analytics of rPool.
∗ Achieved 85% accuracy for customer review analysis on a daily basis.
∗ Delivered a daily and weekly mail scheduler for reports and helped save 2 hrs.
]##Internship_3:[Internship_3_Company@@Internship_3_Machine Translation Model for Dravidian Languages , (June 2018 - June 2019)
Organisation: Center For Cloud Computing and Big Data (CCBD), PES University, Bengaluru
Skills: Machine Learning, Natural Language Processing
Tools: Shallow Parser, Python, Google Colaboratory, Kaggle
Overview:
∗ Enhanced parallel corpus data by 10%.
∗ Parsed shallow parser results for sentences to improvise machine translation.
∗ Designed a multi encoder-decoder approach for machine translation and achieved a
BLEU score of 0.51.
]##Internship_4:[Internship_4_Company@@Internship_4_Orientational Aspects of Objects in Text To 3D Scene Generation for
Interior Designing, (June 2017 - July 2017)
Organisation: Center For Data Science and Applied Machine Learning (CDSAML), PES
University, Bengaluru
Skills: Natural Language Processing, 3D Rendering of objects
Tools: Python, Stanford CoreNLP, Blender Rendering Engine
Overview:
∗ Customized Stanford CoreNLP parser for the purpose of interior designing.
∗ Optimized Algorithms for the orientations.
∗ Improvised accuracy by 50%.]}

column37:
{Project_1:[Project_1_Domain@@Project_1_1. Ball Tracking Robot (2016)
Designed and created a robot to grab a ball automatically. The ball was detected by the camera on the
robot by using image processing (implemented in Python). The robot was made to grab the ball by
finding the best possible path towards it.
]##Project_2:[Project_2_Domain@@Project_2_A C++ Library to Merge JSON Files Without Conflicts (2018)
Given two JSON files, one can use the library to merge the two json file into one single file. This is
widely useful in cases where multiple people are working on different parts of a single problem and
would need to merge the two configuration files needed for their respective parts. The process of
merging comes with a lot of conflicts. The library tries to resolve this conflict.
]##Project_3:[Project_3_Domain@@Project_3_Music Genre Detection (2019)
A machine learning project that could detect the genre of a song based on different features extracted.
]##Project_4:[Project_4_Domain@@Project_4_Orchestrator for a cloud application (2019)
Made a generic orchestrator for a cloud application that could scale out or in based on the number of
API calls made to the application, using Docker.]}

widely useful in cases where multiple people are working on different parts of a single problem and
would need to merge the two configuration files needed for their respective parts. The process of
merging comes with a lot of conflicts. The library tries to resolve this conflict.
]##Project_3:[Project_3_Domain@@Project_3_Music Genre Detection (2019)
A machine learning project that could detect the genre of a song based on different features extracted.
]##Project_4:[Project_4_Domain@@Project_4_Orchestrator for a cloud application (2019)
Made a generic orchestrator for a cloud application that could scale out or in based on the number of
API calls made to the application, using Docker.]}

{Internship_1:[Internship_1_Company@@Internship_1_1. [29th May 2017] – [6th August 2017]
Crucible of Research and Innovation (CORI) | PES University
Software Modules for PISAT 3
This project aims to decrease the execution time of routines by reducing the amount of repetitive code in
the software by replacing it with component-based modules. The approach to this involves thorough
documentation before implementation followed by methodical testing.
]##Internship_2:[Internship_2_Company@@Internship_2_[5th June 2018] – [Present]
Centre for Cloud Computing and Big Data (CCBD) | PES University
Machine Translation using Multitask Sequence to Sequence Model
This project aims to develop a multi-task sequence to sequence model that uses individual characteristics
of each word to increase the predictability through attention mechanism. This enables us to achieve a
higher efficiency and better results in translation.
2
]##Internship_3:[Internship_3_Company@@Internship_3_[27th May 2019] – [27th July 2019]

production line. Got familiarized with Kafka, Springboot and different search methods.]}

column37:
Bangalore’s Favorite Car Color:
This project aims to Detect, isolate and find the number of different colored cars on Bengaluru’s
roads. A caffe implementation of MobileNet-SSD detection network, with pre-trained weights was
used for detecting car which uses Deep Neural Network. OpenCV and K-Means Clustering was
used to get the most dominant color, and Hadoop Map Reduce was used to get the number of
cars of different colors.
#### English Dictionary Using Trie Data Structure:
An English using Tries Data Structure, Jinja And NLP was constructed. This was used to find
meanings and synonyms.
column43:
[29th May 2017] – [6th August 2017]
Crucible of Research and Innovation (CORI) | PES University
Software Modules for PISAT 3
This project aims to decrease the execution time of routines by reducing the amount of repetitive code in
the software by replacing it with component-based modules. The approach to this involves thorough
documentation before implementation followed by methodical testing.
#### [5th June 2018] – [Present]
Centre for Cloud Computing and Big Data (CCBD) | PES University
Machine Translation using Multitask Sequence to Sequence Model
This project aims to develop a multi-task sequence to sequence model that uses individual characteristics
of each word to increase the predictability through attention mechanism. This enables us to achieve a
higher efficiency and better results in translation.
2
#### [27th May 2019] – [27th July 2019]
Software Development Intern at Walmart Labs
Worked in CIA team under Merchant Technology Domain on Matcher Experiment bed –
Prayogshala, an experimental framework to test new search methods without disturbing the
production line. Got familiarized with Kafka, Springboot and different search methods.

column37:
Bangalore’s Favorite Car Color:
This project aims to Detect, isolate and find the number of different colored cars on Bengaluru’s
roads. A caffe implementation of MobileNet-SSD detection network, with pre-trained weights was
used for detecting car which uses Deep Neural Network. OpenCV and K-Means Clustering was
used to get the most dominant color, and Hadoop Map Reduce was used to get the number of
cars of different colors.
#### English Dictionary Using Trie Data Structure:
An English using Tries Data Structure, Jinja And NLP was constructed. This was used to find
meanings and synonyms.

column43:
Data Analytics and Machine Learning
BlogRecommendation System
Content Based recommendation System
● This is a content-based recommendation system built on a dataset
of 186 articles, which recommends top 5 articles given the article
currently being read by the user.
#### Offensive Text Detector
Developed hybrid Binary text detection model
● Built a hybrid binary text classification model. The text classification
problem here is to infer the probability of a given statement being
offensive.
#### Music Genre Prediction
Built a music Genre classification model
● Built a multi class classification model trained on FMA dataset
consisting of multiple audio files (.mp3) in order to make genre
predictions.
#### Smart Date Exploring the depth of Al in dating apps (Ongoing)
This is a research project dealing with various aspects of AI in
trending dating apps such as tinder and okcupid, currently focused
creating a recommendation system based on the various parameters
which could improve the user experience.
#### Cloud Computing Selfie less acts Developed an end to end cloud application in Python
● A complete end to end application developed as microservices
using docker and AWS EC2 in python.
#### Algorithms and Data Structures
Primitive Search Engine
Created a Search Engine using the concept of Suffix Arrays
● This is a primitive search engine built on the dataset of 100
Wikipedia documents which on searching for a query, returns top
k documents based on various relevance criteria
#### Socket Programming P2P Fshare Developed a Peer to Peer File sharing application
● A simple folder sharing tool created in Python that allows the users
to share a folder consisting of multiple files (.txt, .jpg, .png, etc.)
with their peers at one go.

column37:
● Data Structures - Implemented Huffman Coding using basic data structures to
compress text files .
#### Introduction to Data Science - Performance analysis of a cricket player profile (Virat
Kohli ).
#### Web Technologies - Built a Tourist Guide Website .
#### Database Management Systems - Built a Restaurant Franchise Management
database along with a frontend.
#### Microprocessors & Computer Architecture - Built a Pulse Rate Monitoring System
using Arduino and GSM module .
#### Introduction to Operating System - Built a persistent File System using FUSE .
#### Data Analytics - Stock Analysis using Crude oil (Forecasting the stock prices of crude
oil dependent companies considering the influence crude oil commodity fluctuations and analysing trends in stock prices as a function of crude oil trends ).
#### Big Data - IPL Analysis (Used pyspark and HDFS to predict score of each innings of an ipl match to predict the winning team by using statistical & a decision tree approach).
#### Machine Learning - Achieving a faster convergence rate to N-Queens Problem using
Reinforcement Learning. #### Natural Language Processing - Generation of Personalized Smart replies to Emails based on Organizational Hierarchy.
#### Conditioning WaveGan to generate speech based on gender.
#### Cloud Computing - Built a Container Orchestrator that could perform load balancing, fault tolerance, and auto-scaling using AWS-EC2 instances.
#### Research Credits - Emotionally aware Multimodal Conversational agent (Currently working).

column37:
● Data Structures - Implemented Huffman Coding using basic data structures to
compress text files .
#### Introduction to Data Science - Performance analysis of a cricket player profile (Virat
Kohli ).
#### Web Technologies - Built a Tourist Guide Website .
#### Database Management Systems - Built a Restaurant Franchise Management
database along with a frontend.
#### Microprocessors & Computer Architecture - Built a Pulse Rate Monitoring System
using Arduino and GSM module .
#### Introduction to Operating System - Built a persistent File System using FUSE .
#### Data Analytics - Stock Analysis using Crude oil (Forecasting the stock prices of crude
oil dependent companies considering the influence crude oil commodity fluctuations and analysing trends in stock prices as a function of crude oil trends ).
#### Big Data - IPL Analysis (Used pyspark and HDFS to predict score of each innings of an ipl match to predict the winning team by using statistical & a decision tree approach).
#### Machine Learning - Achieving a faster convergence rate to N-Queens Problem using
Reinforcement Learning. #### Natural Language Processing - Generation of Personalized Smart replies to Emails based on Organizational Hierarchy.
#### Conditioning WaveGan to generate speech based on gender.
#### Cloud Computing - Built a Container Orchestrator that could perform load balancing, fault tolerance, and auto-scaling using AWS-EC2 instances.
#### Research Credits - Emotionally aware Multimodal Conversational agent (Currently working).
column41:
● Stock Analysis Based on Trends in Crude Oil Prices - ICACCA 2019

column43:
Crio Summer Of Doing Jun 19 – Jul 19
CSODian
● Built backend APIs for a Food ordering android application called QEats using REST,
Spring Boot framework, MongoDB and containerized the application on an AWS EC2
instance.
#### ThoughtClan Technologies, Bangalore, KA, IN Dec 18 – Jan 19
Machine Learning Intern – Data Science Team
● Worked on Ad-Click prediction - Built a classifier using Tensorflow to predict if a user
would click on an advertisement based on few parameters .
● Built a Chatbot for a blood donation camp drive- A human style conversational bot to
resolve queries pertaining to the functioning of the camps .
#### CORI, PES University, Bangalore, KA, IN Aug 17 – May 18
CORI - Crucible Of Research and Innovation
● Worked on Crime Analysis by Mapping in association with ISRO- Built a map based
system to track crime in the city of Bangalore by using open source news articles to
understand crime location, type and other such aspects .
#### CDSAML, PES University, Bangalore, KA, IN Jun 17 – Aug 17
CDSAML - Center for Data Science and Applied Machine Learning
● Worked on Improving Sentiment Analysis through Emoticon Replacement - An NLP
based research project that aimed at improving accuracy of sentiment analysis on
tweets by replacing emoticons by appropriate phrases .

{Project_1:[Project_1_Domain@@Project_1_1. Photo Sharing App - Container Orchestration
○ Co-developed an online photo sharing app that allows users to upload images in different
categories.
○ The backend(Flask server | REST APIs) of this application is hosted on AWS EC2 instances.
○ The application is containerised making dynamic scaling of resources and replacement of
unhealthy components/containers. The orchestrator takes care of the duties mentioned to
ensure high availability, scalability and a smooth experience for the end user.
]##Project_2:[Project_2_Domain@@Project_2_Virtual File System Using Fuse
○ Co-developed a persistent file system using FUSE, Filesystem in Userspace, in C language.
○ Used a large Unix file to emulate a disk to ensure persistency of the file system and to
preserve its state across reboots.
]##Project_3:[Project_3_Domain@@Project_3_Mini C-Compiler
○ Developed a mini C compiler for the constructs, for loop and ternary operator.
○ Implemented front-end of a compiler which includes lexical, syntax, semantics and
intermediate code generation along with machine independent code optimization techniques,
using Lex and Yacc tools.
]##Project_4:[Project_4_Domain@@Project_4_Hearts: Artificial Intelligence
○ Simulation of a popular four players card game, Hearts, using Python.
○ A single AI player is developed to play against three other opponents(AI) using the minimax
algorithm incorporated with desired heuristics. The player with the lowest score in the end
wins the game.]}

column37:
Photo Sharing App - Container Orchestration
○ Co-developed an online photo sharing app that allows users to upload images in different
categories.
○ The backend(Flask server | REST APIs) of this application is hosted on AWS EC2 instances.
○ The application is containerised making dynamic scaling of resources and replacement of
unhealthy components/containers. The orchestrator takes care of the duties mentioned to
ensure high availability, scalability and a smooth experience for the end user.
#### Virtual File System Using Fuse
○ Co-developed a persistent file system using FUSE, Filesystem in Userspace, in C language.
○ Used a large Unix file to emulate a disk to ensure persistency of the file system and to
preserve its state across reboots.
#### Mini C-Compiler
○ Developed a mini C compiler for the constructs, for loop and ternary operator.
○ Implemented front-end of a compiler which includes lexical, syntax, semantics and intermediate code generation along with machine independent code optimization techniques, using Lex and Yacc tools.
#### Hearts: Artificial Intelligence
○ Simulation of a popular four players card game, Hearts, using Python.
○ A single AI player is developed to play against three other opponents(AI) using the minimax algorithm incorporated with desired heuristics. The player with the lowest score in the end wins the game.
column43:
Peer Teaching at PES University, Bengaluru, August-September 2018 (2 months)
○ Guided my juniors after college hours to help them improve their academic performance.
#### Interned at Ernst & Young LLP, Bengaluru, July 2018 (1 month)
○ Gained mentorship on Cloud Computing and Information Security.
#### ACM India Summer School Scholar, June 2018 (3 weeks)
○ Privileged to have been one of the only 40 women selected across India to participate in the ACM Summer School on Information Security and Cyber Forensics hosted by ACM India.
#### Research Intern at Centre for Data Science And Machine Learning (CDSAML), PES
University, June-July 2017. (2 months)
○ Worked on the project ‘Disease Surveillance Using Twitter Data’ at the CDSAML Labs at
Pes University under the guidance of professors and mentors in the University.
○ Co-developed a mechanism to identify the outbreak of Dengue at different locations by
analyzing Twitter Data with the help of NLP and Machine Learning concepts.

column37:
{Project_1:[Project_1_Domain@@Project_1_1. Data Analytics
• Prediction of Black Friday Sales using R
programming language. Involved
regression, classification, time series
analysis.
]##Project_2:[Project_2_Domain@@Project_2_Big Data
• IPL match score prediction using
decision trees, we trained the decision tree
using the large csv file containing ball by
ball analysis of all the balls played in IPL
throughout the seasons. We predicted the
nearby scores using feature extraction for a
specific bowling and batting attributes. The
second approach was by using K-means
clustering and using cluster to cluster and
instance to instance calculations.
]##Project_3:[Project_3_Domain@@Project_3_Knowledge Management
• Created a knowledge management portal
for an IOT based agricultural company using
HTML, CSS, PHP, Java script, MySQL.
]##Project_4:[Project_4_Domain@@Project_4_Machine Learning
• Designed a model for weather prediction
using algorithms such as SVM classifier,
KNN classifier, ARIMA times series model
and Decision Trees with highest accuracy of
81%.]}

column37:
{Project_1:[Project_1_Domain@@Project_1_1. Automated Trouble Ticket Routing
• Built a model for online shopping portals to
automatically route reviews from social media
to enhance customer support.
• Trained a named entity recogniser to identify
the product and related information. The system automatically generates questions based
on entities recognised, prompting the user to
supply any missing information that would be
necessary for the executive to resolve the customer’s complaint and thus reduces manual
work in the customer service domain.
• References : git repository Video PPT
Python Natural Language Processing
]##Project_2:[Project_2_Domain@@Project_2_SelfieLessActs
• Developed a cloud-based web application
that allows users to upload images of selfless
acts along with a caption to the server and
containerized it to deploy in a micro service
architecture.
• Deployed on Amazon EC-2 instance and implemented load balancing to route requests
among different containers.
• References : git repository
Flask REST AWS Docker
]##Project_3:[Project_3_Domain@@Project_3_Compiler for C language
• Developed the front end of a compiler for C
language using the PLY tool. This compiler
parses and converts the code into an optimised 3-address intermediate code.
• References : git repository]}
column41:
Mispronunciation Detection for spoken isolated words using segmentation and classification under low resource conditions for Kannada Language
Published in : IJRTE, 2019
• Employed unsupervised techniques for the segmentation of Kannada words
and recognition of these syllables using Machine Learning approaches.
Faster Convergence to N-Queens Problem using Reinforcement Learning
Published in : MMLA, 2019
• Used Q-Learning and Deep Q-Learning to reduce the number of steps required for a solution to the N-Queens problem compared to traditional algorithms like Back Tracking and Monte-Carlo.
IoT Based Travel Time Detection
Published in : IEEE, 2018
• IoT based model to collect the input data using sensors to predict travel time.
This paper presents four varieties of approaches to measure the time taken
for the journey

column37:
{Project_1:[Project_1_Domain@@Project_1_1. Twitter Analysis on Climate Change
 PES University August 2019- December 2019
• Social Network Analysis to detect main influencers and communities in the climate change dataset.
• Analysis of “community” behaviour based on a global issue, that impacts societies all over the world.
• Environments used: Anaconda for python, Twitter API’s (tweepy)
 ]##Project_2:[Project_2_Domain@@Project_2_Restaurant Management System
 PES University August 2019- December 2019
• Aim of the project was to get familiarized with Software Engineering Concepts, of working, planning,
communicating within a team of 6.
• Modules: Booking tables, managing orders placed, Managing multiple views (Chef, Waiter, Diner/
Customer, Manager)
• Schedules were made for, developing, testing, debugging, reviewing and handling corner cases in the
project.
• Environments used: GCP (Firebase), HTML, JavaScript, CSS
 ]##Project_3:[Project_3_Domain@@Project_3_Audio Genre Classifier using machine learning techniques
 PES University January 2019- May 2019
• Used KNN and Logistic Regression algorithm to classify audio samples of songs into their respective genres
and used audio feature extraction methods for generating training models.
• Environments used: Anaconda for python
 ]##Project_4:[Project_4_Domain@@Project_4_Dehazing of Hazy Images
 PES University August 2018 - December 2018
• Removal of haze from images using two approaches, GAN (Generative Adversarial Neural Network) in
Machine Learning, and Dark Channel Prior Method
• Observed and made comparisons from the two methods used.]}
column43:
{Internship_1:[Internship_1_Company@@Internship_1_1. Interned at VeCrear Technologies Private Limited India
 Bengaluru, KA June 2019 - July 2019
• Worked as a backend developer, implementing MVC architecture for developing modules using Spring Boot
framework.
• Developing RESTful services used to create, update, delete and query Mongo DB.
• Environments used: Java, MongoDB Compass, Postman, Spring Tool Suite
]##Internship_2:[Internship_2_Company@@Internship_2_Interned at Unisys India
 Bengaluru, KA June 2018 - July 2018
• Learned about Microservices architecture and patterns; High level re-architecture document for a product.
• Presented a tech talk, as part of internal knowledge sharing on basics of Microservices architecture and patterns.
• Worked on an Android application project using Android Studio as per the specifications of the product.]}

column37:
{Project_1:[Project_1_Domain@@Project_1_1. Movie Revenue Prediction/Recommendation System — Data
Analytics Project
An analysis of movies,popularity,IMDb scores, budgets, and other
important features and their relationships to the revenues that movie
make. Built movie recommendation system using collaborative and
content based filtering.
Link : https://github.com/rahul-shiv/DA-2018
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yimiWfwKKMY
]##Project_2:[Project_2_Domain@@Project_2_Very Simple File System - Using FUSE and C
Simple and efficient file system built using C and FUSE libraries for the
purpose of demonstration of simple file system calls like read, write,
create,open and delete files and directories and build file structure trees
along with persistence.
Link : https://github.com/prajwalkirankumar/File-System
]##Project_3:[Project_3_Domain@@Project_3_JAVA Compiler - Using PLY
Mini compiler for Java , written in PLY (Python Lex and Yacc) for
generating output optimized intermediate code for Java.
Link : https://github.com/rads284/java_compiler
]##Project_4:[Project_4_Domain@@Project_4_Container Orchestration Engine- Docker and Flask
Built a fault tolerant, auto-scaling, load balancing system to create,
maintain and destroy Docker Containers from scratch. The containers
serve an application, also built from scratch , written in NodeJS, ExpressJS
along with MongoDB.
Link : https://github.com/prajwalkirankumar/selfielessacts_new
]##Project_5:[Project_5_Domain@@Project_5_Histopathologic Cancer Detection - Python, Keras, Machine
Learning
Cancer tissue recognition using traditional ML algorithms and through
deep learning methods. Implemented SVM, Naive Bayes, Random Forest
on image features extracted through openCV and also performed CNN -
Neural Net Model to classify cancerous tissues.
]##Project_6:[Project_6_Domain@@Project_6_Next Word Prediction - Python, Keras, Natural Language
Processing
Built an Ngram Model to predict the next best word given a set of words in
a sentence and improved the accuracy through an RNN based LSTM
model. Analysed and compared the two methods of prediction.
]##Project_7:[Project_7_Domain@@Project_7_KCET Counselling System - PostgreSQL Database
Built a counselling system, which allots colleges and branches to students
based on their individual rank, scores in subjects mimicking the Common
Entrance Test Counselling system, using PostgreSQL.
]##Project_8:[Project_8_Domain@@Project_8_Home Automation IOT - Arduino, Sensors, Raspberry Pi
Built a complete home automation system using RaspberryPi 3 including
- Automatic Plant Watering System, Lighting System, Garage Door
Opening System.]}
column43:
{Internship_1:[Internship_1_Company@@Internship_1_1. Samsung R&D Research Institute, Bangalore — Summer
Intern
May 2019 - July 2019
Worked on Automatic Driver Detection as part of SmartCars at the IoT
Division by building Machine Learning engines to detect passenger vs driver
differences using inertial Android sensors and audio processing.
]##Internship_2:[Internship_2_Company@@Internship_2_GE Digital, Bangalore — Digital Technology Intern
May 2018 - July 2018
Built a Proof of Concept and worked on Baselining for AWS Lambda
Serverless Architecture and evaluating the cost benefits as the first goal.
Scratch Web Application - Engine LCC - using AngularJS, Java Spring Boot
and Guava Caching as part of the second goal.
]##Internship_3:[Internship_3_Company@@Internship_3_Microsoft Innovation Labs, PES University B’lore —
Research Intern
May 2017 - July 2017
Worked on an IoT Project called “Tap To Order” which is a fully functioning
ecosystem for inventory management in industries with both hardware and a
web application.]}

column37:
{Project_1:[Project_1_Domain@@Project_1_1. Movie Revenue Prediction/Recommendation System — Data
Analytics Project
An analysis of movies,popularity,IMDb scores, budgets, and other
important features and their relationships to the revenues that movie
make. Built movie recommendation system using collaborative and
content based filtering.
Link : https://github.com/rahul-shiv/DA-2018
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yimiWfwKKMY
]##Project_2:[Project_2_Domain@@Project_2_Very Simple File System - Using FUSE and C
Simple and efficient file system built using C and FUSE libraries for the
purpose of demonstration of simple file system calls like read, write,
create,open and delete files and directories and build file structure trees
along with persistence.
Link : https://github.com/prajwalkirankumar/File-System
]##Project_3:[Project_3_Domain@@Project_3_JAVA Compiler - Using PLY
Mini compiler for Java , written in PLY (Python Lex and Yacc) for
generating output optimized intermediate code for Java.
Link : https://github.com/rads284/java_compiler
]##Project_4:[Project_4_Domain@@Project_4_Container Orchestration Engine- Docker and Flask
Built a fault tolerant, auto-scaling, load balancing system to create,
maintain and destroy Docker Containers from scratch. The containers
serve an application, also built from scratch , written in NodeJS, ExpressJS
along with MongoDB.
Link : https://github.com/prajwalkirankumar/selfielessacts_new
]##Project_5:[Project_5_Domain@@Project_5_Histopathologic Cancer Detection - Python, Keras, Machine
Learning
Cancer tissue recognition using traditional ML algorithms and through
deep learning methods. Implemented SVM, Naive Bayes, Random Forest
on image features extracted through openCV and also performed CNN -
Neural Net Model to classify cancerous tissues.
]##Project_6:[Project_6_Domain@@Project_6_Next Word Prediction - Python, Keras, Natural Language
Processing
Built an Ngram Model to predict the next best word given a set of words in
a sentence and improved the accuracy through an RNN based LSTM
model. Analysed and compared the two methods of prediction.
]##Project_7:[Project_7_Domain@@Project_7_KCET Counselling System - PostgreSQL Database
Built a counselling system, which allots colleges and branches to students
based on their individual rank, scores in subjects mimicking the Common
Entrance Test Counselling system, using PostgreSQL.
]##Project_8:[Project_8_Domain@@Project_8_Home Automation IOT - Arduino, Sensors, Raspberry Pi
Built a complete home automation system using RaspberryPi 3 including
- Automatic Plant Watering System, Lighting System, Garage Door
Opening System.]}

column37:
{Project_1:[Project_1_Domain@@Project_1_1. Cloud Computing Project: Container Orchestration
The project was focused on building container orchestrator that can perform load
balancing, fault tolerance, and auto-scaling. We were provided with an app wherein
pictures can be uploaded, deleted, and upvoted. Each of these operation would call
specific APIs which were implemented by us. This was to be done on AWS using Docker
containers.
]##Project_2:[Project_2_Domain@@Project_2_Image Outpainting Using Generative Adversarial Networks
Model has two neural networks one works as generator, which generates new data
instances, while the other, the discriminator, evaluates them for authenticity, both of
which are built using Tensorflow and Keras. The trained model predicts the boundary of
an image i.e, 25% to the left and right of the given image.
2019
Jan-May
2019
]##Project_3:[Project_3_Domain@@Project_3_Mini-Compiler for C: if-else and for constructs
Project was to build a mini-compiler which would parse the given code based on the
grammar written using lex and yacc, and populate the symbol table which was
implemented using structures, generate intermediate code, construct abstract syntax tree. Few
error handling techniques and optimizations have been implemented.
]##Project_4:[Project_4_Domain@@Project_4_Implementation of Generic Binary Search Tree Using Containers
The project was to implement binary search tree using C++ containers. Each BST can
be seen as a collection of nodes of same data type which are placed in the tree
structure based on some predicate. Each node contains unique key. Forward iterator is
used to iterate through elements of tree.
]##Project_5:[Project_5_Domain@@Project_5_Visiting places guide map for Bangalore
A map which could tell the shortest path from current location to the any of the
visiting places in Bangalore using A- star algorithm.
]##Project_6:[Project_6_Domain@@Project_6_File System Implementation
The project is to create our own file system. FS is implemented using linked list
structure. We can do most of the operations that are done by normal file system like
creating a file, directory, writing and reading a file or directory etc.
]##Project_7:[Project_7_Domain@@Project_7_Big Data Project

column37:
2019 Jan-May Cloud Computing Project: Container OrchestrationThe project was focused on building container orchestrator that can perform load 
balancing, fault tolerance, and auto-scaling. We were provided with an app wherein pictures can be uploaded, deleted, and upvoted. Each of these operation would call  specific APIs which were implemented by us. This was to be done on AWS using Docker containers. #### 2019 Jan-May  Image Outpainting Using Generative Adversarial Networks
Model has two neural networks one works as generator, which generates new data 
instances, while the other, the discriminator, evaluates them for authenticity, both of 
which are built using Tensorflow and Keras. The trained model predicts the boundary of 
an image i.e, 25% to the left and right of the given image. #### 2019 Jan-April  Mini-Compiler for C: if-else and for constructs Project was to build a mini-compiler which would parse the given code based on the grammar written using lex and yacc, and populate the symbol table which was implemented using structures, generate intermediate code, construct abstract syntax tree. Few error handling techniques and optimizations have been implemented. #### 2019 April-May Implementation of Generic Binary Search Tree Using Containers
The project was to implement binary search tree using C++ containers. Each BST can 
be seen as a collection of nodes of same data type which are placed in the tree 
structure based on some predicate. Each node contains unique key. Forward iterator is 
used to iterate through elements of tree. #### 2018
Oct-Nov Visiting places guide map for Bangalore
A map which could tell the shortest path from current location to the any of the  visiting places in Bangalore using A- star algorithm. #### 2018 Oct-Dec File System Implementation
The project is to create our own file system. FS is implemented using linked list  structure. We can do most of the operations that are done by normal file system like creating a file, directory, writing and reading a file or directory etc. #### 2018
Nov-Dec Big Data Project
The project is to simulate the IPL match based on model based and big data approach. Given two teams the program would predict ball by ball runs and the final result. #### 2018
Nov-Dec Hangman Game using Lua Love2d framework
Implemented real hangman game in Lua language using Love2D as game engine. #### 2018
June-July CDSAML Project 
As a part of college’s Centre for Data Science and Applied Machine Learning  (CDSAML), I’ve worked on gesture recognition project. The project would recognize the digit drawn by the user on a client page using Convolution Neural Networks. #### 2018
Feb-April DBMS Project 
The project was to populate the Database for a Supermarket and provide the details about products, discounts to customers.  2018 
Feb-April Bike Locking System 
The project was to create secured password locking system for bikes when key is inserted and inform the owner through a message using GSM, if password doesn’t  match. #### 2017
Aug-Nov Data Structures and Algorithm Project
Implemented scrabble board game using linked list and trees data structures, text editor using linked list, new data structure to do basic arithmetic operations on large  numbers(1000digits) efficiently in C language. #### 2017
Aug-Nov Web-Technology 
The project was to build a website using JavaScript, HTML, MySQL and PHP. The website was on college fest management, which included the details of all events. Registration and booking concert tickets were implemented using MySQL. 2016  Aug-Nov JED-I Project 
The project was to create an Automated Robot using Arduino, OpenCV to identify and  pluck a particular coloured ball, which can then be implemented to pluck ripened fruits from trees.

ATC.

A map which could tell the shortest path from current location to the any of the  visiting places in Bangalore using A- star algorithm. #### 2018 Oct-Dec File System Implementation
The project is to create our own file system. FS is implemented using linked list  structure. We can do most of the operations that are done by normal file system like creating a file, directory, writing and reading a file or directory etc. #### 2018
Nov-Dec Big Data Project
The project is to simulate the IPL match based on model based and big data approach. Given two teams the program would predict ball by ball runs and the final result. #### 2018
Nov-Dec Hangman Game using Lua Love2d framework
Implemented real hangman game in Lua language using Love2D as game engine. #### 2018
June-July CDSAML Project 
As a part of college’s Centre for Data Science and Applied Machine Learning  (CDSAML), I’ve worked on gesture recognition project. The project would recognize the digit drawn by the user on a client page using Convolution Neural Networks. #### 2018
Feb-April DBMS Project 
The project was to populate the Database for a Supermarket and provide the details about products, discounts to customers.  2018 
Feb-April Bike Locking System 
The project was to create secured password locking system for bikes when key is inserted and inform the owner through a message using GSM, if password doesn’t  match. #### 2017
Aug-Nov Data Structures and Algorithm Project
Implemented scrabble board game using linked list and trees data structures, text editor using linked list, new data structure to do basic arithmetic operations on large  numbers(1000digits) efficiently in C language. #### 2017
Aug-Nov Web-Technology 
The project was to build a website using JavaScript, HTML, MySQL and PHP. The website was on college fest management, which included the details of all events. Registration and booking concert tickets were implemented using MySQL. 2016  Aug-Nov JED-I Project 
The project was to create an Automated Robot using Arduino, OpenCV to identify and  pluck a particular coloured ball, which can then be implemented to pluck ripened fruits from trees.

ATC.

column37:
{Project_1:[Project_1_Domain@@Project_1_• Automated Trouble Ticket Routing:
– Built a model for online shopping portals to automatically route reviews and complaints from
social media to enhance customer support.
– Trained a named entity recogniser to identify the product and related information. The system automatically generates questions based on entities recognised, prompting the user to supply any missing information that would be necessary for the executive to resolve the customer’s complaint and thus reduces manual work in the customer service domain.
]##Project_2:[Project_2_Domain@@Project_2_ SelfieLessActs:
– Developed a cloud-based web application that allows users to upload images of selfless acts along with a caption to the server and containerized it to deploy in a micro service architecture.
– Deployed on Amazon EC-2 instance and implemented load balancing to route requests among different containers.
]##Project_3:[Project_3_Domain@@Project_3_ Compiler for C language:
– Developed the front end of a compiler for C language using the PLY tool. This compiler parses and converts the code into an optimised 3-address intermediate code. Tools: Lex, Yacc, Ply, Python
– A symbol table is displayed and an abstract syntax tree is generated. The compiler recognises syntax errors and performs type checking. ]##Project_4:[Project_4_Domain@@Project_4_ File System for Ubuntu Operating system:
– Created a simple File System using the FUSE API. Supports basic system calls which include directory
and file operations. Gained an understanding of system calls and mapping between user and kernel
space.
]##Project_5:[Project_5_Domain@@Project_5_ Multimodal Emotion Recognition:
– Built a model that is capable of recognising emotion in a dyadic conversation using data from three
modes: text,audio and video.
]##Project_6:[Project_6_Domain@@Project_6_  Query Search:
– Implemented Relevance Based Search on a collection of documents(more than 10,000) using Ukkonen’s
Suffix Tree in C.]}
column43:
{Internship_1:[Internship_1_Company@@Internship_1_Mispronunciation Detection for spoken isolated words using segmentation and
classification under low resource conditions for Kannada Language ; Published in :
IJRTE, 2019:
– Employed unsupervised techniques for the segmentation of Kannada words into their constituent
syllables and performed recognition of these syllables using Machine Learning approaches.
]##Internship_2:[Internship_2_Company@@Internship_2_ Faster Convergence to N-Queens Problem using Reinforcement Learning ; Published in :
MMLA, 2019:
– Used Q-Learning and Deep Q-Learning to reduce the number of steps required for a solution to the
N-Queens problem compared to traditional algorithms like Back Tracking and Monte-Carlo.
]##Internship_3:[Internship_3_Company@@Internship_3_  IOT based Road Travel Time Detection ; Published in : IEEE, 2018:
– IoT based model to collect the input data using sensors to predict travel time. This paper presents four
varieties of approaches to measure the time taken for the journey.]}

Head and core team member of the ‘Collegiate Social Responsibility
Club’ at PES University, Bengaluru.

Botanical Garden, Bengaluru in the years 2017 and 2018.

column37:
{Project_1:[Project_1_Domain@@Project_1_1. Analysis of Happiness among youth
• Analysed the patterns in youth that are happy
using FSEV UK dataset.
• We predicted the class of a person between
happy or sad based on other features. Various
clustering methods (K means, Hierarchical) and
supervised learning methods(SVM, Decision
Trees) were used.
• Upon ensemble, achieved an increase in accuracy.
• References: Report, Video Presentation and
Git Repo.
R Classification Data Visualisation
]##Project_2:[Project_2_Domain@@Project_2_Container Orchestration Engine
• Developed a web application that allows user
to upload images to the server and containerized it to deploy in a micro service architecture.
• Implemented a custom orchestrator to enable
dynamic load management of containers.
• References: Git Repo, Blog
MongoDB REST Express Docker
AWS
]##Project_3:[Project_3_Domain@@Project_3_Multi-cloud auto scale with prediction using delta correction
• Developed an OpenStack Middle-ware Framework for handling of cloud burst at peak load,
using default OpenStack services.
• My goals included achieving maximal network
bandwidth utilisation within and across availability zones and suggesting scaling and migration.
• Presented at ICICICT 2019 IEEE Conference.
Cloud Computing OpenStack Network
]##Project_4:[Project_4_Domain@@Project_4_Front end of Compiler for Java
• Developed the front end of a compiler using
ply.The compiler could parse and translate to
intermediate code for various constructs such
as while, do-while, if, etc.
• References: Git Repo]}
column43:
{Internship_1:[Internship_1_Company@@Internship_1_Summer Technology Analyst
1. Morgan Stanley
_x005F_x0011_ May 2019 – July 2019
• Built a full-stack application for the purpose of rule recommendation for accounts data set using Angular, Flask and Python.
• Performed data analysis to determine and generate association rules between two data sets to identify discrepancies between money leaving an account and the actual money spent.
• Simplified the process of rule selection by making recommendations on the go. It reduced manual work hours from days to
mins.
Python Flask Angular Agile TDD
]##Internship_2:[Internship_2_Company@@Internship_2_Web Development Intern
Planetworx Technologies Private Ltd.
_x005F_x0011_ June 2018 – July 2018
• Remodeled the UI of their product Trapyz. Developed data
cleansing tools to help clean data fetched from third party
sources.
• Wrote a script to query DDB and dump after segregation into
S3 buckets involving large data sets. I also gained an understanding of the dev-ops cycle.
• Wrote queries in Elastic Search to aggregate multiple set s of
data. To automate search queries I programmed a JSON to ES
query converter.
Python NodeJS React AWS Data Mining DDB]}

column37:
Analysis of Happiness among youth
• Analysed the patterns in youth that are happy
using FSEV UK dataset.
• We predicted the class of a person between
happy or sad based on other features. Various
clustering methods (K means, Hierarchical) and
supervised learning methods(SVM, Decision
Trees) were used.
• Upon ensemble, achieved an increase in accu_x0002_racy.
• References: Report, Video Presentation and
Git Repo.
R Classification Data Visualisation
#### Container Orchestration Engine
• Developed a web application that allows user
to upload images to the server and container_x0002_ized it to deploy in a micro service architecture.
• Implemented a custom orchestrator to enable
dynamic load management of containers.
• References: Git Repo, Blog
MongoDB REST Express Docker
AWS
#### Multi-cloud auto scale with prediction us_x0002_ing delta correction
• Developed an OpenStack Middle-ware Frame_x0002_work for handling of cloud burst at peak load,
using default OpenStack services.
• My goals included achieving maximal network
bandwidth utilisation within and across avail_x0002_ability zones and suggesting scaling and migra_x0002_tion.
• Presented at ICICICT 2019 IEEE Conference.
Cloud Computing OpenStack Network
#### Front end of Compiler for Java
• Developed the front end of a compiler using
ply.The compiler could parse and translate to
intermediate code for various constructs such
as while, do-while, if, etc.
• References: Git Repo

• Remodeled the UI of their product Trapyz. Developed data
cleansing tools to help clean data fetched from third party

query converter.

column37:
Analysis of Happiness among youth
• Analysed the patterns in youth that are happy
using FSEV UK dataset.
• We predicted the class of a person between
happy or sad based on other features. Various
clustering methods (K means, Hierarchical) and
supervised learning methods(SVM, Decision
Trees) were used.
• Upon ensemble, achieved an increase in accu_x005F_x0002_racy.
• References: Report, Video Presentation and
Git Repo.
R Classification Data Visualisation
#### Container Orchestration Engine
• Developed a web application that allows user
to upload images to the server and container_x005F_x0002_ized it to deploy in a micro service architecture.
• Implemented a custom orchestrator to enable
dynamic load management of containers.
• References: Git Repo, Blog
MongoDB REST Express Docker
AWS
#### Multi-cloud auto scale with prediction us_x005F_x0002_ing delta correction
• Developed an OpenStack Middle-ware Frame_x005F_x0002_work for handling of cloud burst at peak load,
using default OpenStack services.
• My goals included achieving maximal network
bandwidth utilisation within and across avail_x005F_x0002_ability zones and suggesting scaling and migra_x005F_x0002_tion.
• Presented at ICICICT 2019 IEEE Conference.
Cloud Computing OpenStack Network
#### Front end of Compiler for Java
• Developed the front end of a compiler using
ply.The compiler could parse and translate to
intermediate code for various constructs such
as while, do-while, if, etc.
• References: Git Repo
column43:
Summer Technology Analyst
Morgan Stanley
_x005F_x0011_ May 2019 – July 2019
• Built a full-stack application for the purpose of rule recommen_x005F_x0002_dation for accounts data set using Angular, Flask and Python.
• Performed data analysis to determine and generate associa_x005F_x0002_tion rules between two data sets to identify discrepancies be_x005F_x0002_tween money leaving an account and the actual money spent.
• Simplified the process of rule selection by making recommen_x005F_x0002_dations on the go. It reduced manual work hours from days to
mins.
Python Flask Angular Agile TDD
#### Web Development Intern
Planetworx Technologies Private Ltd.
_x005F_x0011_ June 2018 – July 2018
• Remodeled the UI of their product Trapyz. Developed data
cleansing tools to help clean data fetched from third party
sources.
• Wrote a script to query DDB and dump after segregation into
S3 buckets involving large data sets. I also gained an under_x005F_x0002_standing of the dev-ops cycle.
• Wrote queries in Elastic Search to aggregate multiple set s of
data. To automate search queries I programmed a JSON to ES
query converter.
Python NodeJS React AWS Data Mining DDB

column37:
{Project_1:[Project_1_Domain@@Project_1_1. Study on communication between microservices — Cloud
Research Project (Ongoing)
A comparative analysis of REST, Google gRPC and Apache Thrift when used for
communication between microservices.
]##Project_2:[Project_2_Domain@@Project_2_Movie Revenue Prediction/Recommendation System — Data
Analytics Project
An analysis of movies,popularity,IMDb scores, budgets, and other important
features and their relationships to the revenues that movie make. Built movie
recommendation system using collaborative and content based filtering.
Link : https://github.com/rahul-shiv/DA-2018
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yimiWfwKKMY
]##Project_3:[Project_3_Domain@@Project_3_Very Simple File System - Using C
Simple and efficient file system built using C libraries for the purpose of
demonstration of simple file system calls like read, write, create,open and delete
files and directories and build file structure trees along with persistence
]##Project_4:[Project_4_Domain@@Project_4_JAVA Compiler - Using PLY
Mini compiler for Java , written in PLY (Python Lex and Yacc) for generating
output optimized intermediate code for Java.
Link : https://github.com/rahul-shiv/java_compiler
]##Project_5:[Project_5_Domain@@Project_5_Container Orchestration Engine- Docker and Flask
Built a fault tolerant, auto-scaling, load balancing system to create, maintain
and destroy Docker Containers from scratch. The containers serve an
application, also built from scratch , written in NodeJS, ExpressJS along with
MongoDB.
Link : https://github.com/rahul-shiv/selfielessacts_new
]##Project_6:[Project_6_Domain@@Project_6_Histopathologic Cancer Detection - Python, Keras, Machine
Learning
Cancer tissue recognition using traditional ML algorithms and through deep
learning methods. Implemented SVM, Naive Bayes, Random Forest on image
features extracted through openCV and also performed CNN - Neural Net Model
to classify cancerous tissues.
]##Project_7:[Project_7_Domain@@Project_7_Next Word Prediction - Python, Keras, Natural Language
Processing
Built an Ngram Model to predict the next best word given a set of words in a
sentence and improved the accuracy through an RNN based LSTM model.
Analysed and compared the two methods of prediction.]}

column37:
{Project_1:[Project_1_Domain@@Project_1_1. Built an AI for Self-Driving Car by implementing Deep Q-Learning Model. This is a modelled version
of car in which car figures everything on its own, without any rules given it to how to operate in the
GUI environment with mazes beforehand. The states of the environment are encoded by a vector
which is passed as input into the Neural Network. Then the Neural Network will try to predict which
action should be played, by returning as outputs a Q-value for each of the possible actions.
Eventually, the best action to play is chosen by either taking the one that has the highest Q-value,
or by overlaying a Softmax function.
]##Project_2:[Project_2_Domain@@Project_2_Developed a cloud based web application on AWS called SelfieLessActs,which allow users of the
application to upload image of the act with a small caption and a categories.Used microservice
architecture with REST API’s. Used load balancer that supports path based routing.
]##Project_3:[Project_3_Domain@@Project_3_Built simple file system in userspace using FUSE,a software interface for Unix-like computer
operating systems that lets non-privileged users create their own file systems without editing kernel
code. This is virtual file system which supports basic system calls and persistence.
]##Project_4:[Project_4_Domain@@Project_4_Built Android Apps by implementing various data structures,algorithms and GUI,as a part of course
“Applied CS with Android” by Google in Java on Android Studio.
 Following are the apps I have built:
 1). Anagrams: Used Arraylists, Hashsets and Hashmaps.
 2). Wordstack: Used Stack data structure.
 3). Scarne’s Dice: Implemented GUI and logic.
 4). Ghost1: Used binary search and dictionary class where words are stored in arraylists.
 5). Ghost2: Used dictionary class where words are stored in tries for better performance.
]##Project_5:[Project_5_Domain@@Project_5_Designed and developed a Database for project “Amusement Park Management System” in
PostgreSQL and also implemented GUI for easier access of data for users and modification of data
for administrator.
]##Project_6:[Project_6_Domain@@Project_6_Arithmetic expression Calculator using C:
 Used SHUNTING YARD algorithm to evaluate infix arithmetic expressions entered.]}
