column41:
Saliency Driven Video Motion Magnification
Presented at NCVPRIPG 2017, IIT Mandi. Published in Springer’s CCIS Proceedings in
Computer Vision, Pattern Recognition, Image Processing, and Graphics, NCVPRIPG 2017.
column43:
{Internship_1:[Internship_1_Company@@Internship_1_1.Cisco Systems (India) Private Ltd. – Software Engineering Intern May-July, 2019
Worked on a “Virtual Infrastructure Solution” which is an internal application of CISCO for
efficiently managing resources in the enterprise networking team.
]##Internship_2:[Internship_2_Company@@Internship_2_IIT Gandhinagar – Summer Research Intern May-July, 2017
Magnification of spatial and temporal changes that are invisible to the naked eye in the
salient regions of video using Eulerian and phase based techniques. Code implementation
in MATLAB, under the mentorship of Dr. Shanmuganathan Raman. The research was
presented at the SRIP 2017 poster presentation.
]##Internship_3:[Internship_3_Company@@Internship_3_Department of Design, IIT Guwahati – Research Intern May-July, 2018
Interned under Prof. Pradeep Yammiyavar, working in the Usability Engineering and
Human-Computer Interaction Lab. Developed the UI prototype of an application in Unity
for easy and efficient indoor navigation using augmented reality to direct the user. Also
performed a study on the education techniques used in kindergarten and how augmented
reality can result in a more effective and enjoyable experience. Developed a simple
alphabet teaching augmented reality game.]}

efficiently managing resources in the enterprise networking team.
]##Internship_2:[Internship_2_Company@@Internship_2_IIT Gandhinagar – Summer Research Intern May-July, 2017
Magnification of spatial and temporal changes that are invisible to the naked eye in the
salient regions of video using Eulerian and phase based techniques. Code implementation
in MATLAB, under the mentorship of Dr. Shanmuganathan Raman. The research was
presented at the SRIP 2017 poster presentation.
]##Internship_3:[Internship_3_Company@@Internship_3_Department of Design, IIT Guwahati – Research Intern May-July, 2018
Interned under Prof. Pradeep Yammiyavar, working in the Usability Engineering and
Human-Computer Interaction Lab. Developed the UI prototype of an application in Unity
for easy and efficient indoor navigation using augmented reality to direct the user. Also
performed a study on the education techniques used in kindergarten and how augmented
reality can result in a more effective and enjoyable experience. Developed a simple
alphabet teaching augmented reality game.]}

column37:
{Project_1:[Project_1_Domain@@Project_1_1. Persistent File System Implementation using FUSE
A functional filesystem for Linux using Filesystem in Userspace(FUSE)
API. The project included several phases like system calls
implementation, filesystem abstraction, disc interface development, and
persistence using secondary storage. ]##Project_2:[Project_2_Domain@@Project_2_Bengaluru’s Favorite Car Color
An OpenCV project for detecting the color of cars, and determining the
most common color of the collected 1000 real-time car images. K-means
clustering was used to determine the dominant color in the image and
different shades of the same color were clubbed together and counted
using Hadoop MapReduce.
]##Project_3:[Project_3_Domain@@Project_3_Sign Language Alphabet Recogniser
A project to recognize the characters in English using Python, OpenCV,
TensorFlow for training InceptionV3 model and a Convolution Neural
Network framework to classify the images.
]##Project_4:[Project_4_Domain@@Project_4_Implementation Of Mini C compiler
A mini c compiler was built for C language using Yacc and Lex tools. The
compiler generates a symbol table, intermediate code, abstract syntax
tree and performs optimization.
]##Project_5:[Project_5_Domain@@Project_5_E-Library Website:
A Basic website was built using HTML and CSS in the front-end and
Javascript and PHP in backend with MySQL for storing database. The
website had options to login, read, and review various books from
different categories.]}
column43:
{Internship_1:[Internship_1_Company@@Internship_1_1. Hewlett Packard Enterprise— Research Intern
APRIL 2019 - JUNE 2019
Auditing and Forensic analysis for cloud-based deployments - Building a
simple application to implement the best practices that are auditing and
forensic ready when deployed on a public cloud. Various security practices
on AWS were employed.
]##Internship_2:[Internship_2_Company@@Internship_2_Center for Cloud Computing and Big Data, PES University —
Research Intern
JUNE 2018 - JULY 2018
Green Swift Power Modeling - A research project based on the object
storage component of OpenStack, the Swift. Implementing a few
functionalities to evaluate data center storage policies from a power
consumption point of view.]}

column37:
{Project_1:[Project_1_Domain@@Project_1_1. Movie Revenue Prediction/Recommendation System: Using concepts of Data Analytics, a
movie revenue prediction system was built. Features such as movie rating, popularity, IMDb
score and budget were used for this purpose. Employed the usage of keyword analysis by
using movie descriptions. Also, a movie recommendation system was built using user ratings
(collaborative and content based filtering).
Link : https://github.com/rahul-shiv/DA-2018
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yimiWfwKKMY
]##Project_2:[Project_2_Domain@@Project_2_Very Simple File System: A simple and efficient file system built using C. FUSE library
was used to provide the interface between the linux commands and the user defined code.
Implemented simple file system calls like read, write, create, open and delete files and
folders. Directory structures were created and persistence was implemented.
]##Project_3:[Project_3_Domain@@Project_3_Dog Adoption website: A website for finding dogs that need a family, called “Adogtion”.
Dogs were categorized on the basis of breed, age and location. Used SQL to create and store
the database. Back end scripting was done using PHP. The website has been designed using
HTML and Javascript.
]##Project_4:[Project_4_Domain@@Project_4_Event Organizer: A virtual “to-do list” on which the user can add and delete tasks of
varying priorities. The application will send reminders for upcoming tasks. The priority
queue is being implemented using C.
]##Project_5:[Project_5_Domain@@Project_5_Voice Recognition & Home Automation: Home automation was done using Arduino
Genuino Board. It was done on a model house made of cardboard. It involved the use of
Google Voice Assistant API to perform actions such as switching lights on/off, opening a
door and watering plants. The same actions were also performed using sensors as well.
]##Project_6:[Project_6_Domain@@Project_6_Wildlife Sanctuary Database Management System: A database for a wildlife sanctuary
was created from scratch for this project. It had several entities such as animals, location,
location manager, employees and so on. Database queries were written using SQLite.
Interface with the front end was done using Flask.
]##Project_7:[Project_7_Domain@@Project_7_Crime Activity Recognition and Safer Navigation: Created an app to recognize criminal
activity in various parts of Bangalore and accordingly find the shortest and safest path from
point A to point B. Web scraped data from online news papers using BeautifulSoup.
]##Project_8:[Project_8_Domain@@Project_8_Created a Sudoku game (Sudoku Board generator) using Python.
]##Project_9:[Project_9_Domain@@Project_9_Created a Pokémon game using turbo C++ for project in class 12.]}
column43:
{Internship_1:[Internship_1_Company@@Internship_1_1. Interned at Cisco: Worked on a “Build Analytics” project. The aim was to analyze the build
files and find out which repositories were taking a lot of time to get built. This data was then
pumped to a tool where it could be used to pinpoint which part of the code was taking too
long to build.
]##Internship_2:[Internship_2_Company@@Internship_2_Interned at Nanyang Technological University, Singapore: Interned at Energy Research
Institute at NTU (ERIAN) on a project in collaboration with Siemens as a Data Analytics
intern. Mainly worked on collecting raw data from online resources using REST API and
preprocessing the data to bring it to a usable format. These processes were done using
various Python libraries such as pandas, requests, os and so on.
]##Internship_3:[Internship_3_Company@@Internship_3_Interned at Microsoft Innovation Laboratory: Worked in a team of four on a project titled
“Wise Net”. We attempted to create a self aware network that would discover all the nodes in
the network and create corresponding paths to transfer data through the network. We used RF
modules (NRF24L01) to transfer the data from one node to the other, and transferred
temperature data using temperature sensors. The neighbour discovery algorithm was
implemented using Arduino Uno boards. We hope to implement this network to analyse
crowds in different areas.]}

● Secured first place 2 years in a row in Horlicks Wizkids Battle of the Bands event

column37:
Movie Revenue Prediction/Recommendation System: Using concepts of Data Analytics, a movie revenue prediction system was built. Features such as movie rating, popularity, IMDb
score and budget were used for this purpose. Employed the usage of keyword analysis by using movie descriptions. Also, a movie recommendation system was built using user ratings
(collaborative and content based filtering).
Link : https://github.com/rahul-shiv/DA-2018
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yimiWfwKKMY
#### Very Simple File System: A simple and efficient file system built using C. FUSE library
was used to provide the interface between the linux commands and the user defined code.
Implemented simple file system calls like read, write, create, open and delete files and folders. Directory structures were created and persistence was implemented.
#### Dog Adoption website: A website for finding dogs that need a family, called “Adogtion”.
Dogs were categorized on the basis of breed, age and location. Used SQL to create and store the database. Back end scripting was done using PHP. The website has been designed using
HTML and Javascript.
#### Event Organizer: A virtual “to-do list” on which the user can add and delete tasks of varying priorities. The application will send reminders for upcoming tasks. The priority
queue is being implemented using C.#### Voice Recognition & Home Automation: Home automation was done using Arduino
Genuino Board. It was done on a model house made of cardboard. It involved the use of Google Voice Assistant API to perform actions such as switching lights on/off, opening a
door and watering plants. The same actions were also performed using sensors as well.
#### Wildlife Sanctuary Database Management System: A database for a wildlife sanctuary was created from scratch for this project. It had several entities such as animals, location,
location manager, employees and so on. Database queries were written using SQLite.
Interface with the front end was done using Flask.
#### Crime Activity Recognition and Safer Navigation: Created an app to recognize criminal activity in various parts of Bangalore and accordingly find the shortest and safest path from
point A to point B. Web scraped data from online news papers using BeautifulSoup.
● Created a Sudoku game (Sudoku Board generator) using Python.
● Created a Pokémon game using turbo C++ for project in class 12.
column43:
● Interned at Cisco: Worked on a “Build Analytics” project. The aim was to analyze the build files and find out which repositories were taking a lot of time to get built. This data was then pumped to a tool where it could be used to pinpoint which part of the code was taking too long to build.
#### Interned at Nanyang Technological University, Singapore: Interned at Energy Research Institute at NTU (ERIAN) on a project in collaboration with Siemens as a Data Analytics intern. Mainly worked on collecting raw data from online resources using REST API and preprocessing the data to bring it to a usable format. These processes were done using various Python libraries such as pandas, requests, os and so on.
#### Interned at Microsoft Innovation Laboratory: Worked in a team of four on a project titled
“Wise Net”. We attempted to create a self aware network that would discover all the nodes in the network and create corresponding paths to transfer data through the network. We used RF modules (NRF24L01) to transfer the data from one node to the other, and transferred temperature data using temperature sensors. The neighbour discovery algorithm was
implemented using Arduino Uno boards. We hope to implement this network to analyse crowds in different areas.

column43:
● Interned at Cisco: Worked on a “Build Analytics” project. The aim was to analyze the build files and find out which repositories were taking a lot of time to get built. This data was then pumped to a tool where it could be used to pinpoint which part of the code was taking too long to build.
#### Interned at Nanyang Technological University, Singapore: Interned at Energy Research Institute at NTU (ERIAN) on a project in collaboration with Siemens as a Data Analytics intern. Mainly worked on collecting raw data from online resources using REST API and preprocessing the data to bring it to a usable format. These processes were done using various Python libraries such as pandas, requests, os and so on.
#### Interned at Microsoft Innovation Laboratory: Worked in a team of four on a project titled
“Wise Net”. We attempted to create a self aware network that would discover all the nodes in the network and create corresponding paths to transfer data through the network. We used RF modules (NRF24L01) to transfer the data from one node to the other, and transferred temperature data using temperature sensors. The neighbour discovery algorithm was
implemented using Arduino Uno boards. We hope to implement this network to analyse crowds in different areas.

column37:
Movie Revenue Prediction/Recommendation System: Using concepts of Data Analytics, a movie revenue prediction system was built. Features such as movie rating, popularity, IMDb
score and budget were used for this purpose. Employed the usage of keyword analysis by using movie descriptions. Also, a movie recommendation system was built using user ratings
(collaborative and content based filtering).
Link : https://github.com/rahul-shiv/DA-2018
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yimiWfwKKMY
#### Very Simple File System: A simple and efficient file system built using C. FUSE library
was used to provide the interface between the linux commands and the user defined code.
Implemented simple file system calls like read, write, create, open and delete files and folders. Directory structures were created and persistence was implemented.
#### Dog Adoption website: A website for finding dogs that need a family, called “Adogtion”.
Dogs were categorized on the basis of breed, age and location. Used SQL to create and store the database. Back end scripting was done using PHP. The website has been designed using
HTML and Javascript.
#### Event Organizer: A virtual “to-do list” on which the user can add and delete tasks of varying priorities. The application will send reminders for upcoming tasks. The priority
queue is being implemented using C.#### Voice Recognition & Home Automation: Home automation was done using Arduino
Genuino Board. It was done on a model house made of cardboard. It involved the use of Google Voice Assistant API to perform actions such as switching lights on/off, opening a
door and watering plants. The same actions were also performed using sensors as well.
#### Wildlife Sanctuary Database Management System: A database for a wildlife sanctuary was created from scratch for this project. It had several entities such as animals, location,
location manager, employees and so on. Database queries were written using SQLite.
Interface with the front end was done using Flask.
#### Crime Activity Recognition and Safer Navigation: Created an app to recognize criminal activity in various parts of Bangalore and accordingly find the shortest and safest path from
point A to point B. Web scraped data from online news papers using BeautifulSoup.
● Created a Sudoku game (Sudoku Board generator) using Python.
● Created a Pokémon game using turbo C++ for project in class 12.

#### Interned at Nanyang Technological University, Singapore: Interned at Energy Research Institute at NTU (ERIAN) on a project in collaboration with Siemens as a Data Analytics intern. Mainly worked on collecting raw data from online resources using REST API and preprocessing the data to bring it to a usable format. These processes were done using various Python libraries such as pandas, requests, os and so on.
#### Interned at Microsoft Innovation Laboratory: Worked in a team of four on a project titled
“Wise Net”. We attempted to create a self aware network that would discover all the nodes in the network and create corresponding paths to transfer data through the network. We used RF modules (NRF24L01) to transfer the data from one node to the other, and transferred temperature data using temperature sensors. The neighbour discovery algorithm was
implemented using Arduino Uno boards. We hope to implement this network to analyse crowds in different areas.

column37:
{Project_1:[Project_1_Domain@@Project_1_Implementation of a Municipality Administrators Citizen Web application (Team Size: 6)
Aug 2019 - Oct 2019
Built a web application using PHP & JavaScript to store and view the records of the citizens of the 
locality
● Learned and followed the chronological method of software development such as requirement
gathering, design, implementation, testing, deployment, and maintenance
● The results of the testing phase gave us a perfectly working software which carried out all the functions required C++. ]##Project_2:[Project_2_Domain@@Project_2_ Compiler (Team Size: 3)
Apr 2019 - May 2019
● Designed & implemented a C++ compiler for do-while and for loop using lex and yacc.
● Designed the context-free grammar and developed the lexical analyzer, symbol table, syntax
analyzer, semantic analyzer, intermediate code generator, and code optimizer phases.
]##Project_3:[Project_3_Domain@@Project_3_ Chat application (Team Size: 3)
Oct 2018 - Dec 2018
● Designed & implemented a chat application using socket programming in python
● This particular setup could connect any number of clients and had 1 server; a message sent by a
client would be sent to the server IP and the server would forward the message to all the other distinct users.
]##Project_4:[Project_4_Domain@@Project_4_ Linux File System using FUSE (Team Size: 3) Jan 2018 - Apr 2018
● Designed & implemented a Linux file system with multiple system calls such as creation & removal
of directories, open, read, write, unlink, read directory, create a file, remove file & stat
● Designed the inode, data, and supernode bitmap to store metadata & files respectively
● Observed the system working analogously to the predefined Linux system with ~85% similarity.
]##Project_5:[Project_5_Domain@@Project_5_ COMPETITIONS
Self-Surveillance Robot with Live Video Streaming Feb 2019
(Secured 3rd prize among 50 entries in Prakalpa Science Fest, PES University Bangalore)
● Built using Raspberry Pi & scripted in bash for I/O pins configuration; used a Pi cam with an I2C software to view surrounding & SSH to set up server; controlled robot wirelessly via web page controlling & live-streamed the same
Team Lead, Web Development, Data Analytics & Electrical team (team size: 30)
]##Project_6:[Project_6_Domain@@Project_6_ Aug 2017 - Jan 2019
Formula Bharat, India
● Designed team website & worked on manufacturing electrical wiring, display & pneumatic shifter
of the car using Raspberry Pi and an Arduino
● Designed a data acquisition system to analyze & predict real-time data (tire pressure, fuel level,
engine temperature) of the formula car; obtained a 50% increase in performance.]}

{Internship_1:[Internship_1_Company@@Internship_1_Research Assistant, Centre for Cloud Computing and Big Data (CCBD), PES University

Big Data, Database Management Systems, and Cloud Computing Developed database models for efficient storage of  Modeled MySQL, MongoDB & Apache Cassandra using Google Cloud to test real-world medical scenario queries (registration of new patient, retrieval of patient details, retrieval of patients'
observations) Analyzed records & compared working of databases as per space, loading time, single-node system vs. a cluster of nodes, indexing vs. non-indexing & caching vs. no caching  It was noticed that MongoDB was the most efficient database management system in almost 85% of the tasks carried out.
]##Internship_2:[Internship_2_Company@@Internship_2_ Intern (Product Development), Compitoplus Consultancy and Services Jun

registered device using Raspberry Pi and servo motor
]##Internship_3:[Internship_3_Company@@Internship_3_ Intern (Web Development), Compitoplus Consultancy and Services Jun

]##Internship_4:[Internship_4_Company@@Internship_4_ RESEARCH EXPERIENCE

achieved 92% accuracy with RNN & 87% accuracy with ARIMA at an epoch value of 100 & batch size of 3.

● Designed & coded load balancing, scaling, fault tolerance & orchestration of cluster of containers
using Python.]}

different functionalities and core part based on the arguments given.

parameters and paginate. Also wrote Rspec Unit tests

to server]}

column37:
{Project_1:[Project_1_Domain@@Project_1_On Cloud and Web Development
1. Selfielessacts(web site and server with custom load balancer)
Built a website to upload pictures using ReactJS and backend using NodeJS to save user
and picture data. Created a docker image with an alpine OS and all the files copied and
running. Built a load balancer which deployed the docker images onto containers and scaled
up and down as necessary and also checked the health of these containers and restarted
them when required.
]##Project_2:[Project_2_Domain@@Project_2_Employee Management System (on going)
Built a complete web application on ReactJS to let employees give attendance, Check their
salary status, Apply for leave, Book shared cab rides, refer new employees to the company
and get reimbursements. Worked with Flask at the backend and mongoDB. Used Mlab to
provide reliability and host the data.
On Machine Learning and Data Analytics
]##Project_3:[Project_3_Domain@@Project_3_SDSS CASJOBS heavenly body classifier
Used various models (ANN, KNN, SVM, etc.) to classify the SDSS Cass jobs data set of
heavenly body radiation into galaxies, quasars and stars excluding the fuv parameter.
]##Project_4:[Project_4_Domain@@Project_4_Weather Modelling
trained various models on a labelled Kaggle-dataset with extensive range of features to
predict rainfall, evaporation and sunlight of the next day. Applied PCA on the large list of
attributes to eliminate the redundant ones. SARIMA, KNN, SVM were among the techniques
used.
]##Project_5:[Project_5_Domain@@Project_5_NLP-Toxic comment filter for English language
created a new dataset by choosing required parts of multiple existing datasets. Used 1-hot
encoding to create a dictionary. Trained a CNN using this data and saved the model onto a
python server. Built a telegram bot to format the message data and encode it into the
dictionary format. Applied the model on the incoming messages to filter and block it if
necessary.
]##Project_6:[Project_6_Domain@@Project_6_IPL Prediction
Used big data algorithms on data acquired by analyzing the data created from player and
match data of the last 10 years. Applied Decision tree model on the recent data and
achieved high degree of accuracy. Used a stochastic approach by building a probability
table using all the game data.]}

- Built an AR Mechanical design manual using the unity engine and C#. Allowed the
user to browse various projects and interact with the components of each project in
various ways.
- Implemented LOTO (lockout-tag out) with raspberry pi and pi-camera.
]##Internship_2:[Internship_2_Company@@Internship_2_Organization: Centre for Pattern Recognition and Machine Intelligence

- Used PCA, SVD, LU, QR and other matrix decomposition techniques to

- Used SIFT, SURF and ORB to extract features.
- Used KNN to check facial feature retention after each decomposition method
]##Internship_3:[Internship_3_Company@@Internship_3_Organization: Quiklearn

Building.
- Built a question generation engine using NLP techniques for their application.]}

{Project_1:[Project_1_Domain@@Project_1_1. RESEARCH INTERN | CENTER FOR DATA SCIENCES AND APPLIED MACHINE
LEARNING | JUNE, 2017 – AUG, 2017
· My responsibility included coming up with an efficient, accurate and unique approach to solve the
problem of Scene Understanding and Image Captioning using Modern Machine Learning Techniques.
The expected result was the publishing of a research paper in this field. I was not successful in
achieving this and utilized the time to understand the existing techniques and contribution by various
other institutions in this domain. Used Tensorflow with existing model package for object detection.
]##Project_2:[Project_2_Domain@@Project_2_STUDENT INTERN | NAAVINYA CAD SOFT PVT. LTD. | 21ST MAY, 2018 – 31ST JUNE, 2018
· Implementation of a simple 2D-bin packing algorithm for optimal placement of Printed Circuit
Boards(PCB) on larger panel boards used in manufacturing. The project titled “PCB layout Optimizer”
involved using web technologies HTML, CSS and Javascript for web UI layout and Spring Boot server for
implementing the placement logic in JAVA.
]##Project_3:[Project_3_Domain@@Project_3_STUDENT INTERN | QLES TECHNOLOGIES PVT.LTD. | 18TH JUNE, 2018 – 31ST JULY, 2018
· Worked on the frontend design for the official website of Qles Technologies – www.goqles.com .
· Worked on PHP for Word Press and web technologies HTML, CSS and Javascript for UI development.
Implementation of a responsive design for the same.
· Had a great experience to understand the management and organization of a start-up system.]}
column49:
• Participated in a Data Science Hackathon conducted by PES University in 2017.
• Participated in Code Wars conducted in various online platforms like Codechef, HackerEarth and
HackerRank
• Participated in MI-7 Code War conducted by RV College of Engineering in 2018.
• Was part of the organization and management team in various fests conducted in college such as
Epsilon (Science Fest) 2017, The Amateur Scientist 2016 and Prakalpa (Science Expo) 2018.
• College projects –
o 2048 game implementation in Python language.
o UI interface to visualize the tree data-structure and demonstrate it’s properties and
traversal techniques.
o Artificial Intelligence project to build an autonomous agent to a solve a maze using A*-
algorithm with comparison of two distance heuristics.
o Machine Learning project using RCNN+Inception trained on COCO dataset with 90 classes
to detect emergency vehicles in traffic image data and label them as Emergency and others
(Binary classification).
Page 3
o Mini-compiler written in C and Python-3.4 to recognize and operate on C++ code files.
Tools Lex and YACC were used to design the complier. Constructs dealt with were FOR,
WHILE loop, ternary operator and IF-ELSE ladder. Demo and Code available on Github
profile. Different stages of Compiler- Syntax check, AST, symbol table, intermediate code
generation and code optimization are demonstrated.
o An Employee Management System application (web-based) done using ReactJS, Flask and
MongoDB. It provides facilities for leave application, salary and bonus credit, referrals
through a NLP machine, Cab Booking using a scheduling algorithm and bill
reimbursements. It was a 10-member project which was done by following the principles
of Software Engineering.
o A Music Generator which uses a Bidirectional RNN done using only Tensorflow.
o Online Courses – Ethical Hacking (Beginner) from Udemy, Machine Learning from
Stanford University from Coursera
• Extra-Curricular Achievements – B.A degree in Kathak from Prayag Sangeet Samiti, Allahabad.
Presently pursuing Grade 4 of ISTD syllabus based in London for Kathak.

· Aptitude for development of website theme designs. Worked on many different designs which helped in

Page 2
PRESENTATION AND COMMUNICATION
· Presentation being a very essential factor to provide support to an idea or a product, having good style
of communication and delivery is inevitable. I have worked on developing this soft skill to a fair extent.
· Ability to deliver good quality of presentations which explain clearly the product or proposal in picture.

column37:
{Project_1:[Project_1_Domain@@Project_1_1. Created a server-based code evaluation platform primarily built for lab automation. Tested in C, Python and
DBMS(SQL) college labs. Wrote a research paper on the
same.(https://ieeexplore.ieee.org/abstract/document/8590145)
]##Project_2:[Project_2_Domain@@Project_2_Machine Learning Project
Auto-tagging of Stack Overflow queries, April 2019 - May 2019
Built an auto-tagging system for stack overflow queries using ANN(own model) algorithm and compared its
accuracy with that of Naïve Bayes in Python.
]##Project_3:[Project_3_Domain@@Project_3_AI project
Genetic algorithm to solve equations, November 2018 - December 2018
Used genetic algorithm to solve a mathematical linear equation.
]##Project_4:[Project_4_Domain@@Project_4_Big Data project
Distributed Key-value Store, August 2018 - December 2018
Built a distributed key-value store using Apache Zookeeper's master node-slave node architecture and socket
programming (to maintain a client-server architecture). Implemented concepts like high availability and fault
tolerance in this project.
]##Project_5:[Project_5_Domain@@Project_5_Computer Networks project
Real-time Application Monitor, August 2018 - December 2018
Built a real-time application monitoring tool that terminates unauthorised applications(that are specified by a
server) running on clients systems using socket programming, and Tkinter for front end UI. Wrote a research paper
on the same.
]##Project_6:[Project_6_Domain@@Project_6_Cloud computing project
Cloud based web application, January 2019 - May 2019
The website runs on an Amazon EC2 instances. The front end was built using HTML and backend using the REST
API in Flask(Python). Used docker containers and load balancer to increase efficiency.
]##Project_7:[Project_7_Domain@@Project_7_Data Structures project
Library Management System, August 2017 - December 2017
Implemented a library management system using linked lists in C.]}

column37:
{Project_1:[Project_1_Domain@@Project_1_1.CLOUD COMPUTING PROJECT 2019
Created end-to-end web based social media application with REST APIs, MongoDB as
database and deployment on AWS, split into microservices with the help of Docker containers.
Also implemented health monitoring, load balancing and auto scaling for management of the
microservices.
]##Project_2:[Project_2_Domain@@Project_2_MINI COMPILER FOR C LANGUAGE 2019
Implemented a mini compiler for C language using Lex and Yacc tools, with support for
basic data types and focus on ‘if’ and ‘while’ constructs
]##Project_3:[Project_3_Domain@@Project_3_FILE SYSTEMS 2018
Implemented a file system using FUSE on C language, to support basic commands such
as read, write, mkdir, rmdir, stat, etc.
]##Project_4:[Project_4_Domain@@Project_4_SHELVING BOOKS USING MARKET BASKET ANALYSIS 2018
Created an application to shelve books in book stores using Apriori Algorithm to
maximize sales based on user ratings obtained from goodbooks-10k dataset. This application
also generated ‘gift baskets’ based on customer preferences]}

column37:
{Project_1:[Project_1_Domain@@Project_1_6
th Semester STATEMENT DUPLICATE DETECTION
+ Detection of pairs of statements that have similar meaning
+ Created to assist in management of large database of MCQ type
questions which different individuals could freely contribute to
+ Final model uses Gradient boosted trees to analyze hand-picked textual
features with accuracy of 85%
+ Technology used : Ipython with xgboost, word2vec in gensim, whoosh,
pandas and numpy modules
]##Project_2:[Project_2_Domain@@Project_2_6
th Semester CONTAINER ORCHESTRATION FOR PHOTO SHARING
+ Container orchestration using python-flask on Amazon Web Services to
design a page for uploading, rating and viewing images
+ Uses Representational State Transfer (REST)
+ Application performs scaling in and scaling out, and uses AWS load
balancer based on API calls
+ Technology used : Amazon Web Services (ec2 instances, AWS Load
Balancer), Docker-Containers (ALpine Base Image), python-flask

]##Project_3:[Project_3_Domain@@Project_3_6
th Semester MUSIC GENERATION
+ Generation of unique musical harmonies as MIDI files using Generative
Adversarial Network (GAN)
+ MIDI preprocessed to get required features from input files
+ Technologies used : Python, Scikit Learn pymidi (for preprocessing MIDI
Files)
]##Project_4:[Project_4_Domain@@Project_4_3
rd & 5th Semester MAP GENERATOR AND ORGANISM OCCUPANCY SIMULATOR
+ Randomized creation of geographical terrain based on provided
parameters
+ Simulation of organism population using agent-based Artificial Intelligence
that makes decisions based on current population, surrounding terrain,
available resources, organism needs and other agents close by
+ Technologies used : jupyter-python, tkinter GUI module
]##Project_5:[Project_5_Domain@@Project_5_5
th Semester IPL MATCH ANALYSIS USING SINGLE LOCAL HADOOP CLUSTER
+ Predict outcome of IPL match based on previously played matches
+ Data from cricsheet.org used for training
+ Probabilistic approach and Decision tree approach used to get ball -byball progression of game
+ Technologies used : Python, Hadoop-HDFS, Spark ML Library
]##Project_6:[Project_6_Domain@@Project_6_1
st Semester 2D-PLATFORMER
+ A short platforming game
+ Player utilizes multiple available powers to take on different obstacles
+ Technologies used : Blender3D, Python, Music in onlinesequencer.net
]##Project_7:[Project_7_Domain@@Project_7_1
st Semester FRUIT PICKING ROBOT
+ Robot that picks ripe fruits
+ Robot uses servo motor to move arm, webcam to detect position of fruit
+ Technologies used : Python, OpenCV, Arduino, Webcam, Robot Chassis]}

Won many prizes at School and Inter-School Level for Spelling Bee, Group Singing, Science
and Literary Quizzes, English and Hindi Creative Writing, Collage making and Poster
Making. Respresented the School at the IPSCE Table Tennis Competition and was
interviewed on Doordarshan in Class VIII for winning a Carricature Competition, adjudged
by Cartoonist Irrfan in Gwalior among 80 participants. Was part of the School Athletics
Team. Won medals for the same, and for Discus Throw

column21: Cloud computing##Operating System##Machine Learning##Big Data##Data Sience##Image Processing##Data Structures##
column37:
{Project_1:[Project_1_Domain@@Project_1_• Cloud Computing Project using the AWS platform, creating the backend and front-end of
a photo uploading application, where users can upload any good act of theirs, under
various categories. The backend involved REST API implementations using Flask and Python
and deployment of the same on the Amazon Web Services Platform, while implementing
Fault Tolerance, Load
Balancing, Auto-Scaling and Docker Containerisation. Health Checks for the EC2
instances were also done continuously.
]##Project_2:[Project_2_Domain@@Project_2_Big Data Project - Analysis on extensive IPL Matches Dataset from the year
2018 of espncricinfo.com. The project involved the use of methods like Kmeans
clustering, Decision Trees and SparkML library among others to analyse the data,
and Predict the outcome of a match and the probable no. of runs a player will
score, based on data from his previous matches. We also compared the calculated
results with the actual results of the match to judge the accuracy of our model.
]##Project_3:[Project_3_Domain@@Project_3_ Data Analytics Project on Kaggle Dataset of all Movie data from 19902017 – making
predictions and inferences using techniques like cumulative probability distributions,
Chi-square tests and Correlation plots, along with other data visualisations. We used IMDb
ratings and data on Actors, Directors , Genres among other things to predict the 
success/failure of an upcoming movie, likelihood of award nomination/winning and
probability of an actor doing a particular Genre of movie.
]##Project_4:[Project_4_Domain@@Project_4_Machine Learning Project on Song Generation using GANs(Genertive
Adversarial Networks). We made use of tools like TensorFlow and used
Midi(Musical Instrument Digital Interface) files of songs, then fed it to a GAN in
order to generate new songs from exisiting audio files. The
implementation, conversion to tuple format and images from midi files were done
using Python coding with tensorflow and pymidi libraries.]}

column43:
{Internship_1:[Internship_1_Company@@Internship_1_Summer Internship 2019:
Project Intern at Tata Consultancy Services, Bangalore - from May 20 to July 20,
2019 Summer. Worked in Analytics and Insights Domain on Optimisation of AWS
Resource Utilisation and developed a model which can takes as input the usage of
various resources on AWS by a user- using GoogleCloud Watch and returns
recommendations on how the user can achieve his goals with a more optimised use
of resources and hence lower bills. Also did an analysis on various Cloud Computing
Platforms such as Microsoft Azure, AWS and Google Cloud Platform to arrive at the
best and most feasible platform for a given requirement at an enterprise level.]}
column49:
• Student Delegate at International Round Square Conference, Kenya 2012 Was sent
to represent the School at the International Round Square
Conference held at the Brookhouse International School, Nairobi, Kenya in 2012. 42
countries from around the World were part of the Conference, held on
Human-Wildlife Coexistence. The conference involved Barrazza Group Discussions,
Social Activities, Wildlife Sanctuaries and Research Centre visits, and various
competitions and KeyNote Speaker addresses.
Was announced 2nd place by the Vice President of Kenya at the
RoyMcCommish Artwork Auction held at the Conference, from among the 42
countries and 150 schools. The funds of which were donated for the Education of
poor children in Africa.
• Science Model Presentation at the Defense Research and Development
Organisation, Gwalior
Created a High-rise farming model in Class IX, with eco-friendly and efficient crop
growing methods, waste management and nutrient management integrated together. Was
adjudged the 2nd Prize winner by the Director of MIT, Gwalior at the Scindia School. Got an
opportunity to present the same at Science Project Display at DRDO, Gwalior – Ministry of
Defense, India.
• Olympiads :
• Got a National Rank of 4 in the International Level Science Talent Search Examination in
Class VI and National Rank of 6 in Class VII.
• Got a State Rank of 13 in NBTO (National Biotechnology Olympiad ) in Class X.
• Was selected for State Level National Maths Olympiad in Class IX.
column54:
Won many prizes at School and Inter-School Level for Spelling Bee, Group Singing, Science
and Literary Quizzes, English and Hindi Creative Writing, Collage making and Poster
Making. Respresented the School at the IPSCE Table Tennis Competition and was
interviewed on Doordarshan in Class VIII for winning a Carricature Competition, adjudged
by Cartoonist Irrfan in Gwalior among 80 participants. Was part of the School Athletics
Team. Won medals for the same, and for Discus Throw
column55:
Social Activities:
• Was part of the Swachh Bharat Abhyaan Drive held by TCS at the Bannerghatta National Park, and
helped in cleaning the plastics and other litters left in the park, and spread awareness about the
importance of cleanliness in our country.
•Provided Free of Cost Art Classes to slum children in Mulund, Mumbai during Summer Vacations in
2011, and helped prepare them for a local art competition.
• Visited a Local orphanage in Kenya, during the Round Square Conference and helped paint their
school walls and planted saplings, followed by interaction and spending time with the children.
• Taught at a local school in Uttarakhand after completion of a trekking programme at the
Himalayan Outward Bound Camp, Uttarakhand

   ]##Internship_2:[Internship_2_Company@@Internship_2_DATA SCIENCE OF INDIA | INSTRUCTOR
   JULY – SEPTEMBER 2017 | BANGALORE, INDIA

]##Internship_4:[Internship_4_Company@@Internship_4_PHARMEASY| SOFTWARE DEVELOPER ENGINEER INTERN

column37:
Distributed client server architecture December 2018
•Built a distributed client/server mechanism which mimicked Hadoop using socket programming.
•It included 3 separate severs which handled a number of responses about 1000.
•Built-in fault tolerance, replication and failover control for any of the servers.
#### Image Inpainting | August – June 2020
•Currently working on building a Generative Adversial network for determining the unwanted pictures of any images and rendering them as a whole.
•Includes two encoders one local and global which helps in determining the overall loss of the image and generates them
Genetic algorithm | November 2018
•Applied the genetic algorithm taking into consideration the selection, mutation and crossover for determining the unknown constants in a polynomial equation.
#### Network Arcade | October 2018
•Implemented a cross network gaming arcade which included games like Blackjack, mastermind and nuts and crosses.
•Supported parallel gaming for around 100 users at the same time.
Cloud Computing | May 2019
•Built an orchestrator engine for a website in which we could upload media and any form of text all hosted on Amazon webservices
•The orchestrator scaled up and down by creating new docker images and deleting them depending on the number of users, and the frequency of use.
#### Automobile website | November 2019
•Created a website for my father’s business as part of the advanced web tech course.
•Included features like streaming, predictive fetch and dynamic server-side events.
Image Processing | December 2017
•Using the kernel data and manipulating them created an image processing and editing application.
#### Grey-scale to color image conversion | June 2019
•Built a convolutional neural network which learned how images are colored and based on which colors the input image.
•Accuracy of about 85% obtained.
column43:
#### VIRTUSA CONSULTANCY SERVICES, BANGALORE, INDIA| INTERN
   MAY – JUNE 2018 | BANGALORE, INDIA
•	Worked on BIG Data concepts exploring how the various languages of Hadoop work. Created and managed various databases which was required for the 5G support which Virtusa was working on in building in the United Kingdom.

####   DATA SCIENCE OF INDIA | INSTRUCTOR
   JULY – SEPTEMBER 2017 | BANGALORE, INDIA
•	Was an instructor at the organization in a team of 20 students which involved in teaching the various aspects of data science and introduction to python. Taught about 120 students in the SSB International school in Bangalore, India.
•	This is a Berkeley based organization started in 2017 which aims at bringing data science to every student in the country
•http://datascienceforindia.com/

#### PES UNIVERSITY| Research INTERN
   JUNE – JULY 2018 | BANGALORE, INDIA
•	Worked with Professor N S Kumar on building a C tutor which is beneficial for any student and teacher to analyze the various aspects of a C program and learn the language 
•	Waiting for the approval of a research paper submitted on the same

#### PHARMEASY| SOFTWARE DEVELOPER ENGINEER INTERN
JANUARY-JUNE 2020 | BANGALORE, INDIA
•	Develop algorithms for optimizing the supply chain of the leading pharmaceutical company in India. Deals with over 6 million customers with over 5 million downloads on the play-store.

column43:
{Internship_1:[Internship_1_Company@@Internship_1_Machine Learning Intern, GlobalEdge Software Ltd. June 2019 - July 2019
Worked on a Project to determine the drowsiness of a driver. Helped in extracting the eye
features from the video dataset provided using Computer Vision techniques. Using this extracted eye patches,re-trained the Inception V3 model which was able to correctly classify
sequence of consecutive frames from unseen videos into alert or drowsy. While doing this
project, briefly learned the concepts in computer vision and technologies like Tensorflow
and keras.
]##Internship_2:[Internship_2_Company@@Internship_2_Research Assistant, PES University, Bengaluru
Working under the guidance of Dr. Mamatha HR at PES University. Working on the problem of Document Classification for Indian Regional Language of Kannada using various NLP
techniques such as Term frequency and Inverse Document Frequency]}

column37: {Project_1:[Project_1_Domain@@Project_1_● Title: Predicting IPL Batsmen and Bowler Vulnerabilities Using Hadoop Team size: 3 Description: In this project we pre-process the previous year’s IPL data from YAML to CSV format, merge all the CSV files into one CSV file. Input data is uploaded onto Hadoop. Implementation is done using Map-Reduce and the outputs are to store back to Hadoop. Role: Conversion of YAML to CSV, Implementation of map-reduce Technology: Python, Hadoop ]##Project_2:[Project_2_Domain@@Project_2_Title: Simple File System using FUSE Team size: 3 Description: Implementing basic functionalities such as creating, modifying and deleting files/directories and making the file system persistent. Callbacks like getattr, readdir, open, read, rmdir, create, write . Role: Coding for the callbacks. Technology: FUSE - interface that lets non-privileged users create their own filesystem without having to modify kernel code. ]##Project_3:[Project_3_Domain@@Project_3_ Title: Cloud based web application - SelfieLessActs Team size: 3 Description: Built an application named “SelfieLessActs” on an Amazon EC2 instance, used to share information about anything encountered that is good for society. Implementing the backend processing using REST API on the AWS instance. Splitting up the monolithic REST service into microservices. A container orchestrator was built that can perform load balancing, fault tolerance and auto-scaling. Role: Implementing the backend processing using REST API on the AWS instance. Technology: Amazon EC2 instances, Flask web framework API: REST ]##Project_4:[Project_4_Domain@@Project_4_ Title: Hospital Management System Team size: 3 Description: The project is to build a Hospital Management website where all the roles in the hospital like the doctor, receptionist, pharmacist, and the patients are able to access with respective needs and all of them controlled by an admin. Role: Design of database and implementation of the logic. Technology: HTML, CSS, PHP, Javascript, Database: MySQL Ongoing Projects Title: Tag orphan answer to the question Description: A suggestion tool that aids the role of the admin to categorize the wrongly marked answers to their respective question that they might belong to. The categorized answers would next go for the respective evaluation.]}

column37:
{Project_1:[Project_1_Domain@@Project_1_JULY 2018 - PRESENT PES University
Timetable Scheduler
An SQL and Python based tool was developed
to maintain a database of the various timetables for the working year of 2018-19 to generate timetables in required formats for all classes
and teachers. Using a Genetic Algorithm coupled with Graph colouring, the problem was
modeled as constraint optimization.
]##Project_2:[Project_2_Domain@@Project_2_ MAY 2019
Amazon Campus Mentorship Series
Video Streaming Portal
Developed a WebApp similar to YouTube that
met the basic requirements of a video streaming service.
]##Project_3:[Project_3_Domain@@Project_3_ FEBRUARY 2019
Personal Iterator support for graphs
Development of BFS and DFS Iterator for a
generic graph stored as an adjacency list. A
user can create a graph containing nodes and
undirected edges. These nodes and edges will
be simulated using structures to mimic an adjacency list.
]##Project_4:[Project_4_Domain@@Project_4_ NOVEMBER 2017
Personal Gift Registry
Interface for acquaintances and close friends
alike to ease the obligation of exchanging gifts.
Implemented as a WebApp that maintained a
database of wish-lists and other related details.
]##Project_5:[Project_5_Domain@@Project_5_ MAY 2019
PES University MSDF Multiplication on FPGA
Implementation of MSDF Multiplication of radix
2 numbers using a redundant digit set on an
FPGA. The logic was developed in Verilog.
]##Project_6:[Project_6_Domain@@Project_6_ MARCH 2019
PES University Pattern matching on FPGA
Implementation of NFA Logic to recognize specific patterns on an FPGA.]}

column21: Cloud computing##Machine Learning##Database Management System##Big Data##Image Processing##Deep Learning##Artificial Intelligence##Computer Vision##
column37:
{Project_1:[Project_1_Domain@@Project_1_Akamai Technologies (Jun 2019 - Aug 2019)
Interned at ​ Akamai Technologies with a team that is responsible for developing,
maintaining and operating tools that reduce the amount of time spent by Technical
Support Engineers to resolve customer cases]##Project_2:[Project_2_Domain@@Project_2_Center for Cloud Computing and Big Data (Jan 2019 - till date)Integrating power-aware cooling technologies and efficient Virtual Machine allocation
policies into CloudSim, a Java ​ framework used for modeling and simulation of cloud
computing infrastructures and services]##Project_3:[Project_3_Domain@@Project_3_Mu Sigma Inc. (Summer Intern: June – Aug 2018)Food Order Quantity Optimization SystemAt Mu Sigma, meals for the employees are catered from external vendors. Heuristic
methods were used to estimate the amount of food to be ordered - this often led to
significant wastage/shortage of food. As part of this project, historical data was collected,
cleaned and analyzed. A dashboard was created showing the trend of food consumption
across various segments. This dashboard helped them estimate the optimal quantity offood to be ordered based on menu, day of the week and season (recruitment season,
employee attrition season etc.). This is currently in use at Mu Sigma. A multiple
regression model was also fitted.
Technologies used​ : Python, R, Microsoft Power BI, MS-Excel]##Project_4:[Project_4_Domain@@Project_4_Computer Science Department – PES University (June – Aug 2018 Timetable Generator
At PES University, the timetables were manually drawn. The objective of the project is to
automate the entire process, end-to-end. During the summer of 2018, an application was
developed that helped the department generate various views of the timetable (per
teacher, per classroom etc.). This involved designing and deploying an effective database
back-end and a user friendly front-end. This is currently deployed and in use at the
university. The application is currently being enhanced to include a scheduling system
based on various constraints.
Technologies used:​ Python, HTML, JavaScript, CSS, MySQL]##Project_5:[Project_5_Domain@@Project_5_Centre for Data Science and Applied Machine Learning (Summer Intern:
June – Aug 2017)
Human Pose Estimation
Pose estimation is a problem in computer vision where human joints are detected and
categorized. As part of this project, a deep neural network was built and trained on the
MPII dataset.
Technologies used​ : ​ Python]}

column37:
{Project_1:[Project_1_Domain@@Project_1_PROJECTS
Built a proxy server cluster
Project Link : https://gitlab.com/bharath-123/ProxyServerCluster-CCBD_vinayak_bharath
 Worked in a team of 2 to build a cluster of proxy servers from scratch in python. We were able to cache static and dynamic content from the web on the proxy servers and distribute heavy loads among the servers.
]##Project_2:[Project_2_Domain@@Project_2_ Built a persistent file system in UNIX using FUSE
Project Link : https://github.com/bharath-123/OS_FS
 Designed and implemented a persistent file system in user space using FUSE. FUSE is a user-space interface for the Linux Virtual File system which is the standard for implementing file systems in the Linux Kernel.
  ]##Project_3:[Project_3_Domain@@Project_3_ Built persistence into the file system.
Linux Kernel Programming
Project Links: https://github.com/bharath-123/char-driver-fs, https://github.com/bharath-123/usb-hotplug
● Built USB device drivers and character device drivers in the Linux Kernel. Added user space support for each of the drivers.
● Wrote a system call in the Linux Kernel. Wrote a basic file system which directly interfaced with the Linux Virtual File system
● Wrote a read-write lock using architecture-specific atomic instructions like cmpxchg.
● Improved my Engineering skills tremendously.
]##Project_4:[Project_4_Domain@@Project_4_ OPEN SOURCE WORK
Linux Kernel
● Contributor to the Linux kernel since January 2019. (Email Id: linux.bhar@gmail.com)
● Regularly test the stable Linux kernel releases by building and booting up the kernel.
● Have submitted patches to the memory management subsystem, reiserfs filesystem. ]##Project_5:[Project_5_Domain@@Project_5_ subsystem and staging device driver subsystem.
Openstack Swift
● Reported issues in documentation and test suites of Openstack Swift.
]##Project_6:[Project_6_Domain@@Project_6_ HACKATHONS DotSlash
● Hackathon sponsored by Hackerearth, HP Enterprises and Infoblox. Worked in a team of 3.
● Built an application which enables blind people to recognize objects by taking a photo on their smartphones and publish it on the Internet where a group of volunteers can identify the object for the blind person.
● The Application was made blind people friendly. Used Android, JavaScript and Flask to build it.
● Was responsible for building the backend REST APIs and setting up cloud infrastructure.
● Ended up in the top 5 finalists.
Kludge
● An Electronics hackathon. Worked in a team of 3.
● Built a smart room where user can operate lights by voice and through an app.
● Used Arduino for building the hardware and MIT app inventor to build the app.
● Ended up in the top 10 finalists.]}
column43:
{Internship_1:[Internship_1_Company@@Internship_1_Summer Intern, June 2019 - Sept 2019
Linux Foundation
● Was selected for the Linux Kernel Mentorship Program.
● Implemented a predictive algorithm in the Linux kernel which can detect memory exhaustion and proactively reclaim/compact
memory as required.
● Proposed new predictive algorithm to the Linux kernel mailing lists.
]##Internship_2:[Internship_2_Company@@Internship_2_ Research Intern, May 2018 - Present
Center for Cloud Computing and Big Data, PES University, Bengaluru
● Successfully deployed an Openstack Swift private cloud in University’s data center.
● Working on a project to reduce the power consumption in Openstack Swift data centers using the power saving characteristics of
hard disks.
● Modified Swift to use a low power non-volatile memory cache to reduce the power consumed by hard disks in a Swift cluster.
]##Internship_3:[Internship_3_Company@@Internship_3_ Research Intern, May 2017 - Aug 2017
Akshara Foundation, Bengaluru, Karnataka
● Built visual representations of public data representing the schools of Karnataka in R.
● These visualizations were used in reports written by the team.
]##Internship_4:[Internship_4_Company@@Internship_4_ Subject Matter Expert on Linux, Aug 2019 – Oct 2019
 PES University, Bengaluru, Karnataka
● Teaching a 4 week course on Linux.
● Course covers Linux commands, Linux Kernel modules, System calls, Device drivers etc]}

column37:
{Project_1:[Project_1_Domain@@Project_1_ Generic Container Orchestration
Selfie-less acts a social media application built to upload selfless acts, add acts to category and view other acts
on the server. The server can be queried using REST API calls. On the server side of the code, there exists
containers that handle acts and user related queries. We created a generic orchestrator which can be used to
manage multiple containers that cater to the same requests. All containers will run the same docker image. The
orchestrator implements the following features: Manage and Monitor Containers(fault tolerance), Load Balancing,
Auto scaling containers.
]##Project_2:[Project_2_Domain@@Project_2_ Recommendation System
Attempted to analyse how the sentiments regarding a product has changed over time. Used a user-based
collaborative filtering model to make recommendations. Alternating Least Squares model was used to fit our data.
Used RMSE to evaluate our model and it turned out to be 2.218.
]##Project_3:[Project_3_Domain@@Project_3_ File System for Unix builtin user space using Fuse
A filesystem in userspace built using FUSE, a software interface for Unix- like computer operating systems that
lets non-privileged users create their own filesystem without editing kernel code. Creating a filesystem has been
achieved by writing a Virtual Filesystem which is nothing but an abstraction layer above a more concrete filesystem
to provide custom access to users.
]##Project_4:[Project_4_Domain@@Project_4_ Detecting Phishing Websites using ML Techniques
To detect phishing websites we proposed a system which is based on using classification algorithm. We
implemented classification algorithm and techniques to extract the phishing data sets criteria to classify their
legitimacy. The phishing website can be detected based on some important characteristics like URL, Domain
Identity, security, encryption criteria in the final phishing detection rate.]}
column43: {Internship_1:[Internship_1_Company@@Internship_1_Wipro Limited - Research & Development Intern June/2019 – July/2019 ]##Internship_2:[Internship_2_Company@@Internship_2_ Using a Content Management Microsoft tool, Sharepoint, which provided a well developed user interface with features like Auto-trigger events, automatic report generation and other alluring features for developers. ]##Internship_3:[Internship_3_Company@@Internship_3_ Front-End developed using HTML, CSS and Bootstrap framework ]##Internship_4:[Internship_4_Company@@Internship_4_ Back-End developed using Javascript for function calls and REST API’s were created using JQuery.]}

column37:
{Project_1:[Project_1_Domain@@Project_1_Analysis of Happiness among Youth
Sep'18 - Nov'18
The project focuses on predicting the behaviour of happy youth, predicting whether an individual is
happy or not based on his personality and other traits, stating insights with visualisations.
K-means clustering, hierarchical clustering ,Decision Tree, SVM and Random Forest were implemented for the
prediction in R.
Literature Survey, Paper, R code : ​ http://bit.ly/2FnS4EV
Video Presentation : ​ http://bit.ly/2HtRyai]##Project_2:[Project_2_Domain@@Project_2_Selfieless Acts
Jan'19 - May'19
Full Stack web development using Node.js and MongoDB. The application has micro-service based
architecture and has been hosted on AWS across instances and containers.
Built container orchestrator engine that performs load balancing, fault tolerance, and auto-scaling using Flask
framework. A generic deployment engine was also developed which accepts con guration of microservice via XML le
given the docker image.
Git Repository : https://github.com/Yaminiag/SelfielessAct]##Project_3:[Project_3_Domain@@Project_3_Complier for PHP
Feb'19 - Apr'19
Designed the front end of the compiler in Python using PLY tool.
It generates the symbol table , abstract syntax tree and intermediate code for to parse PHP language and constructs
such as while and for-each.
Constant folding and propagation, copy propagation optimization techniques were also implemented.
Git Repository : https://github.com/Yaminiag/php_compiler]##Project_4:[Project_4_Domain@@Project_4_Sarcasm Detection in Newspaper Headlines
Feb'19 - Apr'19
The project aimed to nd the best model to detect subtle,formal sarcasm presented in Newspaper
Headlines. Naive Bayes,SVM, Random Forest and LSTM with GloVe embeddings models were implemented and
performance was compared.]##Project_5:[Project_5_Domain@@Project_5_Socialyte
Mar'18 - Apr'18
Developed a social networking website as a Database Management Project which allows users to
create pro le ,add friends and upload images and status that can only be viewed by friends. This was done using Sqlite
and Flask framework.Financial Distress Prediction
Feb'19 - Apr'19
Predicted whether the company is distressed or healthy based on nancial and non- nancial
features. We used Logistic Regression,Decision Trees, SVM and ANN to predict the status and precision and recall were
compared.]##Project_6:[Project_6_Domain@@Project_6_Rhapsody
Developed a music streaming website using HTML5 ,CSS3 and JavaScript for frontend and PHP and
MySql for backend and hosted on Apache Serve]}
column43:
{Internship_1:[Internship_1_Company@@Internship_1_Research Intern June'18 - July'18
Centre for Cloud Computing and Big Data
Developed a middle-ware framework to establish access to local and remote cloud using Openstack APIs. The project
focuses on handling of cloud burst at peak loads and suggests migration and scaling of instances based on traf=c monitoring. I worked in a team to achieve maximum network bandwidth utilisation within and across availability zones. The framework is compatible with Openstack Queens and later. Accepted in ICICICT 2019 IEEE Conference.]}
column49: Awarded Prof. CNR Rao Merit Scholarship for academic excellence in semesters I-V of B.tech. Member of Centre for Cloud Computing and Big Data Research, PES University. Organiser at TEDx PESU , ,Epsilon and various other intercollegiate events.

column37:
{Project_1:[Project_1_Domain@@Project_1_1. Hotel and Flight Booking Web Application
○ Team size : 3
○ Technology used : Django, SQLite, Javascript, Bootstrap, HTML
○ Description : This application allows users to search and book hotels/flights and cancel the
booking. Also allows hotel/flight operators to view their bookings. Highlights include dynamic
pricing, emailing users information on hotel/flight on booking.
]##Project_2:[Project_2_Domain@@Project_2_Online news popularity prediction and Recommending changes for an article to be popular
○ Team size : 3
○ Technology used : R ○ Description : Predicting whether an online news article is popular or not based on the
metadata provided using different Machine learning algorithm. Also recommend changes in the
metadata to be popular if not.  ]##Project_3:[Project_3_Domain@@Project_3_Mini Compiler for selection statements in C++
○ Team size : 2
○ Technology used : Lex and Yacc
○ Description : Creates optimized intermediate code for selection statements of C++.
]##Project_4:[Project_4_Domain@@Project_4_Container Orchestration
○ Team size : 3
○ Technology used : Python
○ Description : Auto scalable, Load balanced and Fault tolerant web application using containers.
]##Project_5:[Project_5_Domain@@Project_5_Auditing and Forensic analysis for Cloud based deployments
○ Team size : 5
○ Tools used : Python, Cloud Trail, Lambda, Amazon Cloud Watch, Athena
○ Description : Implementation of auditing in application and using Amazon tools, implementation
of forensics using athena, Cloud Trust Protocol and Cloud Control Matrix. ]}

{Project_1:[Project_1_Domain@@Project_1_Word Embedding for Low Resource Language Kannada Aug 2019 till
date
]##Project_2:[Project_2_Domain@@Project_2_Working on embedding apps like Google, Uber eats, Zomato etc. for a low resource language, Kannada
 Using the GLOVE Machine Learning model to embed the pre-processed Kannada corpus; fed the cleaned corpus to the
model to achieve an optimal representation for the words
 Stemmed the corpus using an Algorithm developed and completely pre-processed the Kannada corpus removing
numbers,english word,stop word .
Pacman using Reinforcement Learning Aug 2019 till date
Working on a reinforcement technique to improve the Pacman game; introduced the model to the specificity of the
game such as rules, players, environment, lives etc.
 An improvement was made on Pacman reinforcement provided by UC Berkeley the following changes were made.
Relu was replaced with leaky Relu to beat the vanishing gradient problem. Another input layer was added to the CNN .
 The input format of the game was changed from an image based to matrix ie the game is represented using 6 matrices
each aspect ie the packman ,2 ghosts ect were represented using the six matrices.
Sketch to Images using CNN and GAN May 2019 – Jul
]##Project_3:[Project_3_Domain@@Project_3_2019 Trained a model for sketching a picture from rough sketch on 5 classes;The classes were hot air balloon,chair,Airplane,Butterfly,Flower.

recognition techniques due to Gan and CNN learning
CCTV Footage Analysis for Forensic Investigation May 2019 – Jul

]##Project_4:[Project_4_Domain@@Project_4_2019

on testing

{Project_1:[Project_1_Domain@@Project_1_Food Recommendation System using Sentiment Analysis
Built a Recommendation system of the Amazon fine food dataset provided by SNAP(Stanford Network
Analysis Program) and attempted to analyze how the sentiments regarding a product has changed over time.
]##Project_2:[Project_2_Domain@@Project_2_IPL Match Prediction
Using the previous IPL data (till 2017) we clustered the data according to their attributes by K Means clustering algorithm and probabilities of scoring runs and wickets among the clusters was generated using which a new match was taken and prediction had been made on that.
]##Project_3:[Project_3_Domain@@Project_3_File system for Unix built in user space using Fuse
A filesystem in user space built using FUSE, a software interface for Unix-like computer operating systems
that lets non-privileged users create their own filesystem without editing kernel code.Creating a filesystem
has been achieved by writing a Virtual Filesystem which is nothing but an abstraction layer above a more
concrete filesystem to provide custom access to users.
]##Project_4:[Project_4_Domain@@Project_4_Event Database Management System
Created a database system for Event Management which keeps track of all the Events ,Competitions ,Event
heads,Transactions,Participants,Judges where a website is used as an interface built using PHP , SQL
,Javascript ,HTML.]}

{Project_1:[Project_1_Domain@@Project_1_File System creation using FUSE Designed a simple File System with functionalities such as file and directory creation, modification, deletion and making it persistent. It was implemented as a modified
tree structure consisting of hierarchically chained linked lists.
Implemented basic system calls and created a user defined stat and inode structure. Compiler designed for C language contructs
Created a simple ]##Project_2:[Project_2_Domain@@Project_2_ compiler for a program in C language consisting of if-else and while
contructs using Lex and Yacc. On compilation, a symbol table, syntax tree and an
intermediate code gets generated. A simple constant folding code optimisation was
performed. All shift-reduce and reduce-reduce conflicts were handled.]}

column37:
{Project_1:[Project_1_Domain@@Project_1_Data Structures-Hostel Room Allotment
• Hostel rooms were allotted to students based on GPA.
• Special Block of hostel for high GPA students.
• Each room has all the details of students staying in that room for easy hostel management.
Advanced Computer Networks – Foodie Network Design
• Designed the network for the Foodie – a food and retail store.
• Implemented load balancer to handle the traffic in the network
]##Project_2:[Project_2_Domain@@Project_2_Implemented Access Control List (ACL) to grant access to the dataset only to the necessary person.
Compiler Design – C compiler for IF-ELSE and FOR loop constructs
• Generated a Context Free Grammar for the C language and checked the Syntax of the program using Lex-Yacc tool.
• Updated the type, scope and value into the Symbol Table which helped check the Semantics of the program.
• Generated the Abstract Syntax tree and the Intermediate Code for the C program which help understand the code easily.
• Tried showing which are the useless and more power consuming part of the code and which should probably be removed.
Data Analytics -Predicting flight delays during take-off
• Implemented polynomial regression using one airline and all origin airport.
]##Project_3:[Project_3_Domain@@Project_3_ Implemented regularization to prevent over-fitting.
• Necessary for the flight companies to predict delays so as to organise their flights efficiently.
Database Management for farmers
• Developed a database containing complete farmer information using Postgres command
]##Project_4:[Project_4_Domain@@Project_4_Implemented and passed queries using SQL
• Developed dynamic webpages and bridges to connect backend/frontend using MyPHP
]##Project_5:[Project_5_Domain@@Project_5_Made the tool editable by users by providing functions like edit, update and delete.]}
